original: 'di yang kun tu 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs rnam par gzhag pa sta de bzhin kho nar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang kun tu 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs rnam par gzhag pa sta de bzhin kho nar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is also the classification of the power of knowledge of the paths that lead to all states, and it should be applied in the same way.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang po'i khyad par nyid mi 'jigs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang po'i khyad par nyid mi 'jigs pa lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar te /
translated: The specific features of the first fearlessness should be applied to the remaining fearlessnesses.

original: gdul bya'i khyad par la bltos nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mang du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i khyad par la bltos nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mang du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In relation to the specific features of those to be trained, the Bhagavan has presented many fearlessnesses.

original: stobs kyis rnam par gzhag pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: stobs kyis rnam par gzhag pa bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four fearlessnesses that are presented by power.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis re zhig rang dang gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis re zhig rang dang gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: By these four aspects, the stages of one’s own and others’ perfections are presented.

original: ye shes ni 'grib pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni 'grib pa nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the pacification of the decline of the afflictions.

original: mi 'jigs pa snga mas ni bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa snga mas ni bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa phun sum tshogs pa bshad pa ma yin la /
translated: The first fearlessness does not explain the perfection of one’s own knowledge,

original: gnyis pas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: but the second explains the perfection of elimination.

original: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa ste bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang gzhan phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa ste bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang gzhan phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom and abandonment is also fully perfected, for the sake of one's own perfection and the perfection of others.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam bzlog pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam bzlog pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to avert the false path and to teach the true path.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa de dag slob ma rnams kyis spangs pas /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa de dag slob ma rnams kyis spangs pas /
translated: Therein, the disciples abandon those things that the Tathagata has declared to be obstacles.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs sgrub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs sgrub par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, they accomplish the means for the perfection of abandonment.

original: nges par 'byung bar gsungs pa'i chos de dag yang dag pa bsgrubs pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar gsungs pa'i chos de dag yang dag pa bsgrubs pas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And, by correctly practicing those things that the Tathagata has declared to be the means of deliverance, they accomplish the means for the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di dag gis kyang ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bzhin du dang gzhan la ji ltar rigs par ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rab tu gyur pa 'thob par 'gyur bas gzhi nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bzhin du dang gzhan la ji ltar rigs par ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rab tu gyur pa 'thob par 'gyur bas gzhi nyid do //
translated: By these, they attain the perfection of wisdom and abandonment, just as the Teacher has attained them, in accordance with their own abilities. Thus, they are the basis.

original: ji ltar mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin /
translated: How can knowledge itself be fearlessness?

original: ji ltar na ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be?

original: mi 'jigs pa ni 'jigs pa'i gnyer por gyur @323b pa'i chos 'jigs pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni 'jigs pa'i gnyer por gyur @323b pa'i chos 'jigs pa dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Fearlessness is the Dharma that serves as an antidote to fear and is free from fear.

original: mkhyen pa ni 'jigs pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni 'jigs pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Knowledge is not free from fear.

original: de gang dang ldan pas 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ba de ni 'jigs pa med pa nyid de ya shes rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas 'jigs pa med par 'gyur bas na mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang dang ldan pas 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ba de ni 'jigs pa med pa nyid de ya shes rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas 'jigs pa med par 'gyur bas na mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin no //
translated: That which is possessed and becomes fearless is itself fearlessness. Since one becomes fearless by possessing the four knowledges, knowledge itself is fearlessness.

original: slob dpon gyis shes pas byas pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin par rung gi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes smos te /🔽mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa yin la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis shes pas byas pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin par rung gi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes smos te / mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa yin la /
translated: The Master says: It is suitable that fearlessness is made by knowledge, but it is not knowledge itself.🔽Fearlessness is the absence of fear.

original: mi skrag pa nyid kyang skrag pa dang bral ba yin zhing /
analyzed: mi skrag pa nyid kyang skrag pa dang bral ba yin zhing /
translated: The absence of fear is freedom from fear.

original: de yang shes pa las byung ba yin gyi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa ni mi 'jigs pa dang ches nye ba'i rgyu nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de yang shes pa las byung ba yin gyi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes pa ni mi 'jigs pa dang ches nye ba'i rgyu nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Moreover, it arises from knowledge, not from knowledge itself. This is the cause of fearlessness, in order to make known the cause of fearlessness and its proximate cause.

original: gzhan dag na re shes pa 'dir mi 'jigs par bshad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re shes pa 'dir mi 'jigs par bshad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that fearlessness is explained as knowledge here.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang po'i rgyu'o ;
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang po'i rgyu'o ;
translated: The cause of the first fearlessness is the knowledge of all aspects of all dharmas.

original: / bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mkhyen pa ni gnyis pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: / bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mkhyen pa ni gnyis pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the second is the knowledge of the abandonment of afflictions along with their traces.

original: mi 'jigs pa phyi ma dag gi ni slob ma la phan pa dang mi phan pa mkhyen pa bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa phyi ma dag gi ni slob ma la phan pa dang mi phan pa mkhyen pa bar chad med pa'o //
translated: The latter two fearlessnesses are the uninterrupted knowledge of what is beneficial and not beneficial for disciples.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa yin te ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin na khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa yin te ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin na khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: If they are knowledge by nature, what is the difference between the powers and fearlessnesses?

original: ye shes kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig stobs dang 'ga' zhig mi 'jigs par brjod de /
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig stobs dang 'ga' zhig mi 'jigs par brjod de /
translated: Some particular knowledges are called powers, and some are called fearlessnesses.

original: mi brdzi ba'i rgyu mkhyen pa ni stobs dang / mi zhum pa'i rgyu ni mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba'i rgyu mkhyen pa ni stobs dang / mi zhum pa'i rgyu ni mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The cause of invincibility is power; the cause of non-timidity is fearlessness.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis zil gyis mi gnon pa de ltar stobs yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis zil gyis mi gnon pa de ltar stobs yin la /
translated: Inasmuch as one is not overcome by others, one has power.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa de ltar na mi 'jigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa de ltar na mi 'jigs pa yin no //
translated: Inasmuch as one overcomes others, one has fearlessness.

original: kha cig na re the tshom can gyi rtogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa ni stobs dang the tshom gyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa lta bu ni mi 'jigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re the tshom can gyi rtogs pa yongs su mkhyen pa ni stobs dang the tshom gyi sbyor ba la mkhas pa lta bu ni mi 'jigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The power is the full understanding of the doubts of others; fearlessness is like the skill in the application of doubt.

original: gzhan dag na re stobs ni dpa' ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re stobs ni dpa' ba nyid yin la /
translated: Others say: Power is courage;

original: mi 'jigs pa ni brtan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni brtan pa nyid yin no //
translated: fearlessness is firmness.

original: 'di nyid kyis bya ba tha dad de /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis bya ba tha dad de /
translated: This is the difference in their function.

original: stobs kyi don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i don to //
analyzed: stobs kyi don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of power is the accomplishment of the desired function.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i don ni mi zhum pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i don ni mi zhum pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning of fearlessness is non-timidity.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnams las gzhan pa dag go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyis bsdus pa rnams las gzhan pa dag go //
translated: The three foundations of mindfulness are those that are not included among the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'khor gyi bye brag las zhes bya @324a * //
analyzed: 'khor gyi bye brag las zhes bya @324a * //
translated: From the point of view of the distinctions of retinue.

original: ba ni 'khor gyi khyad par las so //
analyzed: ba ni 'khor gyi khyad par las so //
translated: From the point of view of the distinctions of retinue.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As it is said in the sutra.

original: dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
translated: Bhikshus, there are three foundations of mindfulness,

original: gang dag 'phags pas bsten par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'phags pas bsten par byed pa ste /
translated: which are cultivated by the noble ones,

original: 'phags pa de dang bstan na tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa de dang bstan na tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'o //
translated: which, when cultivated and developed, lead to the destruction of the influxes for those who practice them.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?🔽Bhikshus, here the teacher, who has compassion, who desires to benefit, who desires peace, who desires well-being, who desires to bestow bliss, teaches the disciples:

original: dge slong dag 'di la ston pa thugs brtse ba can thugs re can don bzhed pa phan pa bzhed pa thugs rje dang ldan pas nyan thos rnams la 'di ni khyed la phan par byed pa 'di ni khyed la bde bar byed pa 'di ni khyed la phan
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la ston pa thugs brtse ba can thugs re can don bzhed pa phan pa bzhed pa thugs rje dang ldan pas nyan thos rnams la 'di ni khyed la phan par byed pa 'di ni khyed la bde bar byed pa 'di ni khyed la phan
translated: This is for your benefit, this is for your well-being, this is for your happiness, this is for your benefit, well-being, and happiness.

original: pa dang bde bar byed pa'o zhes chos ston par mdzad cing nyan thos de dag de la nyan par byed rna ba gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed /
analyzed: pa dang bde bar byed pa'o zhes chos ston par mdzad cing nyan thos de dag de la nyan par byed rna ba gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who listen, who lend an ear, who set their minds on understanding,

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
translated: who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'gal bar byed na /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'gal bar byed na /
translated: and who do not contradict the Teacher’s teachings.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs dgyes par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs dgyes par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the Tathāgata does not rejoice in that,

original: yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: nor is he pleased,

original: thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: nor is he indifferent.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
translated: The Tathāgata remains equanimous, mindful and alert.

original: 'di ni gang dag 'phags pas bsten par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gang dag 'phags pas bsten par byed pa ste /
translated: This is the first establishment of mindfulness that is to be developed by a noble disciple.

original: 'phags pas de dag bsten na /
analyzed: 'phags pas de dag bsten na /
translated: When a noble disciple has developed it,

original: tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po yin no //
translated: it is fitting for him to lead the holy life, aiming for and focusing on that very place.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Moreover, monks, the Tathāgata has compassion for beings, as before.

original: bzlog ste nyan thos de dag la nyan par mi byed ces bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bzlog ste nyan thos de dag la nyan par mi byed ces bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: On the contrary, they do not listen to the śrāvakas.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /🔽mi bzod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur / mi bzod pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Tathāgata does not feel any resentment🔽or impatience,

original: 'tshig pa yang mi mnga' la thugs ma rangs pa yang mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'tshig pa yang mi mnga' la thugs ma rangs pa yang mi mnga'o //
translated: nor does he feel any displeasure.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /
translated: The Tathāgata remains equanimous, mindful and aware.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second establishment of mindfulness.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag 'di ston pa thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag 'di ston pa thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Moreover, monks, the Teacher is compassionate.

original: nyan thos kha cig ni de la nyan par byed rna ba gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
analyzed: nyan thos kha cig ni de la nyan par byed rna ba gtod par byed kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed /
translated: Some śrāvakas listen to him, pay attention, apply their minds to understand, practice in accordance with the Dharma,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'gal bar byed la /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'gal bar byed la /
translated: and do not contradict the Teacher’s instructions.

original: kha cig nyan par mi byed rna ba gtod par @324b mi byed pa nas ston pa'i bstan pa la 'gal ba'i bar du byed na /
analyzed: kha cig nyan par mi byed rna ba gtod par @324b mi byed pa nas ston pa'i bstan pa la 'gal ba'i bar du byed na /
translated: Some do not listen, do not pay attention, and so on up to: they contradict the teachings of the Teacher.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /
translated: The Tathagata is not pleased by that.

original: yid bde ba yang ma yin thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur la /🔽kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid bde ba yang ma yin thugs ya ya por yang mi 'gyur la / kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur /
translated: He is not happy, nor is he indifferent.🔽He is not hostile,

original: mi bzod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi bzod pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor is he impatient,

original: 'tshig pa yang mi mnga'i /
analyzed: 'tshig pa yang mi mnga'i /
translated: nor does he get angry.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te /🔽'di ni gang dag 'phags pa sten par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te / 'di ni gang dag 'phags pa sten par byed pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata remains indifferent, mindful and fully aware.🔽This is the third application of mindfulness that is worthy of being taught to the assembly,

original: 'phags pa de dag bsten na tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa de dag bsten na tshogs la rjes su ston par 'os pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: when relying on the noble ones.

original: de yang dran pa dang shes bzhin bdag nyid gsum zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i bdag nyid dang shes bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de yang dran pa dang shes bzhin bdag nyid gsum zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i bdag nyid dang shes bzhin gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: The three that are called mindfulness and introspection are the nature of mindfulness and the nature of introspection.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin du btang snyoms su bzhugs te zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: He remains in equanimity with mindfulness and introspection.

original: shes bzhin yang shes rab nyid do //
analyzed: shes bzhin yang shes rab nyid do //
translated: Introspection is wisdom.

original: gang gi tshe nyan thos kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyan thos kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: When the disciples, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽bag chags dang bcas pa spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gi bag chags kyang spangs kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // bag chags dang bcas pa spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes chags pa dang / khong khro ba dag gi bag chags kyang spangs kyi /
translated: The thought is that he does so in order to abandon the defilements.🔽In order to abandon the residues, etc.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has abandoned the residues of attachment and hostility, but the disciples have not.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba 'ang ci zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba 'ang ci zhe na /
translated: What is a residue?

original: gang snga ma nyon mongs pa spyad pa de'i nges pa'i lus dang ngag gi g-yo ba dang 'gyur ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa'i khyad par ni bag chags yin no //
analyzed: gang snga ma nyon mongs pa spyad pa de'i nges pa'i lus dang ngag gi g-yo ba dang 'gyur ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa'i khyad par ni bag chags yin no //
translated: It is a special potentiality that is the cause of the inflexions and modifications of the body and speech of one who has previously practiced the defilements.

original: yang na nyan thos rnams gang gi yin pa de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na nyan thos rnams gang gi yin pa de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, the disciples have the residues of the residues that the Blessed One has abandoned.

original: nyan thos rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: The śrāvakas are the disciples of the Lord Buddha, but others are not.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽gus pas nyan pa dang gus par mi nyan pa gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gus pas nyan pa dang gus par mi nyan pa gnyi ga dag la ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro // gus pas nyan pa dang gus par mi nyan pa gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gus pas nyan pa dang gus par mi nyan pa gnyi ga dag la ste /
translated: Because they go forth under the Lord Buddha.🔽With regard to both those who listen respectfully and those who do not listen respectfully,

original: gang gis kha cig gus pas nyan pa dang kha cig gus par mi nyan pa de dag gnyi ga la'o //
analyzed: gang gis kha cig gus pas nyan pa dang kha cig gus par mi nyan pa de dag gnyi ga la'o //
translated: with regard to both those who listen respectfully and those who do not listen respectfully.

original: de kho na la de mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de kho na la de mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is not so for them alone.

original: nyan thos de dag gang gi yin pa de kho na la'o //
analyzed: nyan thos de dag gang gi yin pa de kho na la'o //
translated: That is not so for them alone, for those śrāvakas.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag mi skye ba ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba la sogs pa de dag mi skye ba ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: That is not so for them alone, for those who are pleased and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te ma chags pa'i bdag nyid @325a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te ma chags pa'i bdag nyid @325a * //
translated: Otherwise, if they were not of the nature of nonattachment,

original: dam zag pa med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na sems can thams cad la dmigs par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: dam zag pa med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid yin na sems can thams cad la dmigs par mi 'grub la /
translated: If it were by nature undefiled knowledge, it would not be established as having all sentient beings as its object.

original: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang mi 'grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it would not be established as having the aspect of the three kinds of suffering, as does compassion.

original: snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Compassion is not established as having all sentient beings as its object, because it is by nature non-hatred.

original: thugs rje chen po ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can nyid yin te zhe sdang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can nyid yin te zhe sdang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion is by nature non-hatred, and it has the aspect of the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'dod pa'i sems can gyi yul can ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems can gyi yul can ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can nyid do //
translated: Compassion that has sentient beings of the desire realm as its object has the aspect of the suffering of suffering.

original: shes pa zag pa med pa yang de ltar mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: shes pa zag pa med pa yang de ltar mi 'jug ste /
translated: Undefiled knowledge does not operate in that way.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is by nature conventional knowledge.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is the great heap of merit and knowledge.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The great accumulation of merit is the perfections of generosity, morality, and patience.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The great accumulation of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin te /
translated: The perfections of effort and meditation are both types.

original: bsam gtan med na shes rab med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan med na shes rab med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Without meditation, there is no wisdom.”

original: brtson 'grus med par sbyin pa mi gtong la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus med par sbyin pa mi gtong la /
translated: Without effort, one does not practice generosity,

original: tshul khrims yang dag par mi len cing bzod pa mi sgom mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par mi len cing bzod pa mi sgom mo //
translated: one does not take up morality, and one does not cultivate patience.

original: de ltar na brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi cha dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi cha dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, effort is conducive to the accumulation of merit.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus med na shes rab kyang med pas ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i cha dang mthun par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus med na shes rab kyang med pas ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i cha dang mthun par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, because without effort there is no wisdom, it is also conducive to the great accumulation of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi cha mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi cha mthun pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the side of cultivation of the four immeasurables such as loving-kindness is conducive to the accumulation of merit.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa bsgom pa'i phyogs ni ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa bsgom pa'i phyogs ni ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The side of cultivation of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment such as the applications of mindfulness is conducive to the great accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'dis rgya che ba nyid dang che ba nyid ma yin pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis rgya che ba nyid dang che ba nyid ma yin pa ston par byed do //
translated: This shows the greatness and non-greatness in terms of aspects.

original: rnam pas che ba ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pas che ba ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa'i phyir te /
translated: Greatness in terms of aspects is due to the aspects of the three kinds of suffering.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can no //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can no //
translated: Compassion has the aspect of the suffering of suffering.

original: dmigs pas che ba ni khams gsum du skye ba'i so so skye bo thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pas che ba ni khams gsum du skye ba'i so so skye bo thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Greatness in terms of object is due to taking as its object all ordinary beings born in the three realms.

original: snying rje 'dod @325b pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na la dmigs so //
analyzed: snying rje 'dod @325b pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na la dmigs so //
translated: Compassion takes as its object only those born in the desire realm.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis che ba nyid ni thugs rje chen po ni sems can thams cad la mnyam par 'jug pa'i phyir te /🔽gang gi phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal sems can rnams la 'jug pa mtshungs par 'jug ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis che ba nyid ni thugs rje chen po ni sems can thams cad la mnyam par 'jug pa'i phyir te / gang gi phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal sems can rnams la 'jug pa mtshungs par 'jug ste /
translated: For, it engages equally in the suffering of conditioned existence of all sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the suffering of conditioned existence of sentient beings is undifferentiated.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi sems can rnams la 'jug ste mi mnyam par 'jug ste /
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi sems can rnams la 'jug ste mi mnyam par 'jug ste /
translated: Compassion engages in the suffering of suffering of sentient beings, but it does not engage equally,

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the suffering of suffering is differentiated.🔽It is the greatest, because there is nothing greater than it.

original: ches che ba nyid ni de bas ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la shin tu dang rim ches kyis rim pa bzlog pa'o //🔽ji ltar snying rjes snying rje bar byed pa de ltar nges kyang yin pa de gnyis la khyad par ma mthong nas tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces bya ba dris so //
analyzed: ches che ba nyid ni de bas ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la shin tu dang rim ches kyis rim pa bzlog pa'o //🔽ji ltar snying rjes snying rje bar byed pa de ltar nges kyang yin pa de gnyis la khyad par ma mthong nas tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces bya ba dris so //
translated: The greatness of non-discrimination is the knowledge of termination and the knowledge of non-production, because they are the antidotes to the discrimination of the three spheres.🔽The original: tha dad du bya ba ni dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ni dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “they are distinguished” means that they are differentiated.

original: zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they do not have the nature of nonhatred and nondelusion.

original: snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Compassion has the nature of nonhatred.

original: thugs rje chen po ni gti mug med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni gti mug med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Great compassion has the nature of nondelusion.

original: sa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase “in the stage” and so on means that

original: snying rje ni bsam gtan bzhi'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje ni bsam gtan bzhi'i sa pa yin no //
translated: compassion is in the stage of the four meditations.

original: 'dir mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can ni bsam gtan dang po'i khongs su gtogs pas logs shig tu ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can ni bsam gtan dang po'i khongs su gtogs pas logs shig tu ma bshad do //
translated: Here, the stage of unrestricted access concentration to the first meditation and the special stage of meditation are included in the first meditation and are not mentioned separately.

original: thugs rje chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is in the stage of the fourth meditation.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “in the disciples” and so on means that

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa dang rang sangs rgyas bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'jig rten pa dang rang sangs rgyas bsdu'o //
translated: the word “and so on” includes the mundane and the solitary realizers.

original: thugs rje chen po ni srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob ste /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob ste /
translated: Great compassion is attained by those who are free from attachment to the peak of cyclic existence.

original: zad pa shes pa dang stobs la sogs pa bzhi dang ma chags pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang stobs la sogs pa bzhi dang ma chags pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the four beginning with the knowledge of exhaustion and the four beginning with nonattachment.

original: yongs su mi skyob pa dang skyob pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes ni nyan thos la sogs pa dag sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la nyam nga ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi de dag gis sdug bsngal ba las bskyab par mi nus so //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyob pa dang skyob pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes ni nyan thos la sogs pa dag sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la nyam nga ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi de dag gis sdug bsngal ba las bskyab par mi nus so //
translated: They do not protect, they protect, etc. Compassion is only a pity for suffering beings, for the Sravakas, etc. cannot protect them from suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdug bsngal de las yongs su bskyab par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sdug bsngal de las yongs su bskyab par mdzad pa'o //
translated: But the Buddhas do protect them from that suffering.

original: mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar thugs rje mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar thugs rje mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the difference and similarity of compassion.

original: snying rjes ni sdug bsngal can rnams kho na la thugs rje @326a * //
analyzed: snying rjes ni sdug bsngal can rnams kho na la thugs rje @326a * //
translated: Compassion is only for those who suffer,

original: mdzad la / thugs rje chen pos ni sems can thams cad la ste /
analyzed: mdzad la / thugs rje chen pos ni sems can thams cad la ste /
translated: but great compassion is for all beings.

original: ji ltar snying rjes sdug bsngal ba rnams la thugs rjes mdzad pa de ltar thugs rje chen pos sems can thams cad skyob par mdzad do //
analyzed: ji ltar snying rjes sdug bsngal ba rnams la thugs rjes mdzad pa de ltar thugs rje chen pos sems can thams cad skyob par mdzad do //
translated: Just as compassion is for those who suffer, so great compassion is for all beings.

original: mnar med par skyob pa rnams la ji lta ba de ltar srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: mnar med par skyob pa rnams la ji lta ba de ltar srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: Just as for those born in the Avici hell, so also for those born at the peak of existence.

original: ke tsittva n+ya na tsa /
analyzed: ke tsittva n+ya na tsa /
translated: Ke-citta-nyana-cha

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bshad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams bshad de /
translated: The unshared qualities of the Buddha are explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang ca co mi mnga' ba dang thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms (stag lung ke tsi rbantya ne pa/) mi mnga'
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba dang ca co mi mnga' ba dang thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms (stag lung ke tsi rbantya ne pa/) mi mnga'
translated: The Tathagata has no error, no babbling, no non-equipoise, no loss of mindfulness, no non-discerning equanimity,🔽no loss of aspiration, no loss of effort, no perception of difference,

original: ba dang 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa dang / de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' ba dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa dang / de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: his wisdom vision penetrates without attachment or obstruction to the past, and likewise to the future and the present.

original: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa ni sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi sngon rol gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa ni sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi sngon rol gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by the former accumulations of merit and knowledge, that is, by the former accumulations of merit and knowledge prior to Buddhahood.

original: de la bsod nams dang ye shes dag tshogs pas na tshogs so //
analyzed: de la bsod nams dang ye shes dag tshogs pas na tshogs so //
translated: Therein, the accumulations of merit and knowledge are accumulations because they accumulate.

original: yang na 'dis sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad tshogs pas na tshogs so //
analyzed: yang na 'dis sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad tshogs pas na tshogs so //
translated: Or, it is an accumulation because it accumulates all the virtuous practices that are the causes of Buddhahood.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dag par sdud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dag par sdud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “etc.” means that it includes the perfections of effort and of aspiration.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyun nam gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyun nam gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The accomplishment of the Dharma Body is the transformation of the basis of the continuity of the undefiled dharmas.

original: 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa las bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi don ni mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa las bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi don ni mtho ris dang byang grol gyi rgyu'o //
translated: The performance of the function of benefiting the world is the cause of the heavens and of liberation.

original: de bsgrub pa ni don spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni don spyod pa ste /
translated: The performance of that is the benefit of the world.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i thugs rje chen po dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i thugs rje chen po dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to the great compassion of the buddhas in their performance of benefit for others.

original: 'di yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang gzhan gyi don gyi bya ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang gzhan gyi don gyi bya ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par gsungs so //
translated: And this is well spoken by all buddhas from the point of view of cause, result, and the activity of benefiting others.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar ro //
translated: As for the phrase in accordance with the time, it should be applied to all.

original: ji ltar zhe na yul shin tu ring ba dang / @326b thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri ba yin pas na sku tshe lo brgyad khri yin la skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya pa yin pas na sku tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na yul shin tu ring ba dang / @326b thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri ba yin pas na sku tshe lo brgyad khri yin la skye dgu'i tshe lo brgya pa yin pas na sku tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: How so? Because the life span of beings is long or short. That is to say, when the life span of beings is eighty thousand years, the life span of the Buddha is eighty thousand years, and when the life span of beings is one hundred years, the life span of the Buddha is one hundred years.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyis rgyal rigs bkur ba de'i tshe rgyal rigs su 'byung la /
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyis rgyal rigs bkur ba de'i tshe rgyal rigs su 'byung la /
translated: In accordance with the time, the Buddha appears in the kṣatriya or brāhmaṇa class, for when the world honors the kṣatriyas, he appears in the kṣatriya class.

original: gang gi tshe bram ze bkur ba de'i tshe ni bram zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bram ze bkur ba de'i tshe ni bram zer ro //
translated: When the Brahmins were honored, he was a Brahmin.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa gdung tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na rus gang che ba mchod par 'os par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i gdung du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa gdung tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na rus gang che ba mchod par 'os par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de'i gdung du 'byung ba'o //
translated: In accordance with the times, he had different clans, such as Kasyapa and Sakya, because when a clan was honored in the world, he appeared in that clan.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du sku bong tshod chung ba dang chung ba ma yin pa tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na bong tshod chung ngu yin pa de'i tshe sku bong tshod chung la gang gi tshe bong tshod chung ba ma yin pa de'i🔽tshe sku bong chung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du sku bong tshod chung ba dang chung ba ma yin pa tha dad pa ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten na bong tshod chung ngu yin pa de'i tshe sku bong tshod chung la gang gi tshe bong tshod chung ba ma yin pa de'i🔽tshe sku bong chung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: In accordance with the times, he had different sizes, small and not small, because when the world honored small size, he had a small body, and when the world did not honor small size, he had a large body.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di kho na zhes bya ba ni gang zhig tha ma thag tu sangs rgyas rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyur bshad pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di kho na zhes bya ba ni gang zhig tha ma thag tu sangs rgyas rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyur bshad pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the only threefoldness, which is the cause of the equality of the Buddhas, namely, the perfection of cause, the perfection of result, and the perfection of benefit.

original: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyis yang dag par 'grub pas na rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan la chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pas ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyis yang dag par 'grub pas na rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan la chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pas ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of cause is taught by the perfection of former merit and knowledge, and the perfection of result is by the perfection of the Dharma Body.

original: don spyod pas ni phan 'dogs pa phun tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pas ni phan 'dogs pa phun tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of benefit is by the service of the meaning.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of all the accumulations of merit and knowledge is the cause of the equality of the Buddhas.

original: bsod nams zhes smos pa ni ci rigs par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga dang dad pa la sogs pa rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: bsod nams zhes smos pa ni ci rigs par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lnga dang dad pa la sogs pa rnams bsdus so //
translated: The word “merit” includes the five perfections beginning with giving, and faith, etc., as is appropriate.

original: ye shes smos pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ye shes smos pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na'o //
translated: The word “knowledge” includes only the perfection of wisdom.

original: yun ring po nas goms pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas goms pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa'o //
translated: Long cultivation means cultivation for three measureless kalpas.

original: yun ring por goms kyang bar dang bcas pa yod pas de'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yun ring por goms kyang bar dang bcas pa yod pas de'i phyir bar chad med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Even though one cultivates for a long time, there is cultivation with intervals; therefore, it says, without interval.

original: bar chad med par bya dka' bas so //
analyzed: bar chad med par bya dka' bas so //
translated: Because it is difficult to cultivate without interval.

original: res 'ga' gus par ma byas par yang yin pas de'i phyir gus par byas te goms pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: res 'ga' gus par ma byas par yang yin pas de'i phyir gus par byas te goms pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Even though one cultivates with intervals, there is cultivation without devotion; therefore, it says, with devotion.

original: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar bar mdzad pa phun sum tshogs @327a * //
analyzed: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar bar mdzad pa phun sum tshogs @327a * //
translated: The perfection of the act of delivering from the three miserable states and from the suffering of cyclic existence is

original: pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum las thar bar mdzad pa phan 'dogs pa rnam pa gsum dang 'khor ba las thar bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngan song gsum las thar bar mdzad pa phan 'dogs pa rnam pa gsum dang 'khor ba las thar bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: the act of delivering from the three miserable states, which is a threefold benefit, and the act of delivering from cyclic existence.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are four kinds of acts.

original: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la bgrod par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum po rje re la bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa gsum dang bde 'gro la bkod pa ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la bgrod par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum po rje re la bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa gsum dang bde 'gro la bkod pa ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the perfection of the vehicle is the perfection of the vehicle to the three vehicles and to good destinies. Thus, there are four kinds of perfection of the vehicle.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de re re yang de ltar rnam ba bzhir 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de re re yang de ltar rnam ba bzhir 'byed pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is also fourfold. The four kinds of perfection of result are each divided into four.

original: ma bstan par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don gyis so //🔽thams cad mkhyen pa ni mtshan nyid ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ma bstan par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don gyis so // thams cad mkhyen pa ni mtshan nyid ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Knowledge without teaching is the meaning of perfect enlightenment by oneself.🔽Omniscience is the meaning of complete comprehension of all characteristics.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Knowledge of all aspects is the meaning of comprehension in all aspects.

original: ma 'bad par mkhyen pa ni bzhed pa tsam gyis thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ma 'bad par mkhyen pa ni bzhed pa tsam gyis thugs su chud pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of without effort is that he comprehends it by mere wish.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of having abandoned all the defilements is that he has abandoned the defilements of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of insight and by the path of cultivation.

original: gtan du spang ba ni yongs su mi mnyam pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gtan du spang ba ni yongs su mi mnyam pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The meaning of having abandoned them permanently is that he has abandoned them without remainder.

original: bag chags dang bcas te spang pa ni rjes su 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas te spang pa ni rjes su 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of having abandoned them with their latent tendencies is that he has abandoned them without any residual impressions.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib ba spang ba'o zhes bya ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib ba spang ba'o zhes bya ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of having abandoned the obscurations of the concentrations and the meditative developments is that he has abandoned the obscurations of the two kinds of meditative development.

original: spyi'i yul sprul pa dang yongs su bsgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de la sprul pa ni phyi'i yul sngon med pa 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i yul sprul pa dang yongs su bsgyur ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba de la sprul pa ni phyi'i yul sngon med pa 'byin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of having attained mastery in the creation of magical incarnations, in the transformation of existent things, and in the achievement of the superknowledges is that he has attained mastery in the creation of magical incarnations, in the transformation of existent things, and in the achievement of the superknowledges.

original: yongs su bsgyur ba ni rdo la sogs pa gser la sogs pa'i dngos por mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur ba ni rdo la sogs pa gser la sogs pa'i dngos por mdzad pa'o //
translated: Transformation is the creation of gold, etc. from stone, etc.

original: byin gyis rlob pa ni yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa ni yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Empowerment is the bestowal of long life.

original: de dag la mnga' ba nyid ni bzhed pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mnga' ba nyid ni bzhed pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The mastery of these is the engagement in them by the will.

original: mnga' ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnga' ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
