original: sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' de nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' de nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sku tshe gtong ba dang byin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the mastery of the abandonment and empowerment of life is the perfection of the mastery of the abandonment and empowerment of life.

original: bsgrib @327b pa la gshegs pa dang / shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / rdul phra rab chung du mang po ste 'jig rten gyi khams 'jug par mdzad pa ni bsgribs pa dang / nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: bsgrib @327b pa la gshegs pa dang / shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang / nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / rdul phra rab chung du mang po ste 'jig rten gyi khams 'jug par mdzad pa ni bsgribs pa dang / nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la myur du gshegs pa dang /
translated: The

original: chung ngur mang po 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngur mang po 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He causes many to enter the lesser vehicles.

original: de dag la mnga' ba ni bzhed dgur mdzad pa ste de nyid phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la mnga' ba ni bzhed dgur mdzad pa ste de nyid phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: His mastery is his ability to do whatever he wishes, and this is his perfection.

original: ya mtshan gyi chos rnal ma rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnal ma rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: ya mtshan gyi chos rnal ma rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnal ma rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don du ste /
translated: The perfection of the various kinds of marvelous and genuine qualities means the genuine qualities that arise naturally.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gshegs pa na mtho dman mnyam par 'gyur te /🔽mtho ba gang yin pa de ni dma' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gshegs pa na mtho dman mnyam par 'gyur te / mtho ba gang yin pa de ni dma' bar 'gyur la /
translated: When the Lord Buddhas walk, the high places become low and the low places become high.🔽Whatever is high becomes low.

original: dma' ba gang yin pa de ni mthon por 'gyur ro //🔽long ba rnams kyis ni mig 'thob po //
analyzed: dma' ba gang yin pa de ni mthon por 'gyur ro // long ba rnams kyis ni mig 'thob po //
translated: Whatever is low becomes high.🔽The blind regain their sight.

original: 'on pa rnams kyis ni rna ba 'thob po //
analyzed: 'on pa rnams kyis ni rna ba 'thob po //
translated: The deaf regain their hearing.🔽The insane regain their reason.

original: smyon pa rnams kyis ni dran pa 'thob po zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: smyon pa rnams kyis ni dran pa 'thob po zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the way things are.

original: thams cad rgyas par mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyas par mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: All of this should be understood in detail as it is described in the sutras.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni /🔽gsal la rdzogs pa dang yul la gnas pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo nye bar mtshon pas mtshan dag ste /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ni zhes bya ba ni / gsal la rdzogs pa dang yul la gnas pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo nye bar mtshon pas mtshan dag ste /
translated: The perfection of marks is

original: de dag ni gtsug tor la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ni gtsug tor la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: the thirty-two marks of a great person, such as the tuft between the eyebrows, which indicate the nature of a great person because they are clear, complete, and located on the body.

original: dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo bsal bar byed pa'i phyir dpe byad bzang po dag ste /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni / skyes bu chen po'i ngo bo bsal bar byed pa'i phyir dpe byad bzang po dag ste /
translated: The perfection of excellent therapies is

original: de dag ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu la sogs pa brgyad cu ste de dag kyang mtshan bzhin du phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog lta bu la sogs pa brgyad cu ste de dag kyang mtshan bzhin du phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: the eighty excellent therapies, such as nails that are copper-colored, which indicate the nature of a great person.

original: stobs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sred med kyi bu'i stobs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: stobs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sred med kyi bu'i stobs dang ldan pas so //
translated: The perfection of strength is

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gdung rdo rje lta bur sra ba ni mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gdung rdo rje lta bur sra ba ni mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the strength of Narayana, because the Bhagavat's body is hard like a diamond.

original: de ltar na de dag ni mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, these are in brief.

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang phan 'dogs pa rnams kyis yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang phan 'dogs pa rnams kyis yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for many incalculable periods,

original: gal te sku tshe bskal pa grangs med du mar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te sku tshe bskal pa grangs med du mar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan @328a * //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan @328a * //
translated: then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,🔽then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,

original: 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis sam gsum du sku tshe byin gyis rlob par mdzad na /
analyzed: 'das kyis bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis sam gsum du sku tshe byin gyis rlob par mdzad na /
translated: then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,🔽then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas gyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa dang mkhyen par spyod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas gyi che ba'i bdag nyid gsungs pa dang mkhyen par spyod do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,🔽then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.

original: re zhig de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,🔽then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,🔽then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.🔽Thus it is said.🔽Now, if the Bhagavat Buddha had prolonged his life for two or three incalculable periods,

original: yon tan rnams dang ye shes rnams dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa dang thugs rje chen po ni yon tan dang ye shes dang phan 'dogs pa dang thugs rje chen po rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan rnams dang ye shes rnams dang mthu dang phan 'dogs pa dang thugs rje chen po ni yon tan dang ye shes dang phan 'dogs pa dang thugs rje chen po rnams so //
translated: then he would have taught this greatness of the Buddha and the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba ni de nyid kyi yon tan dang ye shes la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba ni de nyid kyi yon tan dang ye shes la sogs pa ste /
translated: Infinite and marvelous means its qualities, intuitions, etc.

original: mtha' yas pa ni grangs dang mthu mthas gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa ni grangs dang mthu mthas gtugs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is infinite because its number and power are unlimited.

original: rmad du byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams las gzhan med pa'i phyir dang mdzad par dka' ba'i phyir dang brnyes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni sangs rgyas rnams las gzhan med pa'i phyir dang mdzad par dka' ba'i phyir dang brnyes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is marvelous because it is not found in any other than the buddhas, because it is difficult to perform, and because it is difficult to attain.

original: de nyid rin po che chen po yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rin po che chen po yin te /
translated: It is a great jewel,

original: sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir te rin po che chen po de dag gi 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir te rin po che chen po de dag gi 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: because it benefits all beings, and it is the source of those great jewels.

original: sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: Those who do not respect the Buddha and his Dharma

original: gus par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gus par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: do not respect those who practice it.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni lha dag na yod pa ni lha'o //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni lha dag na yod pa ni lha'o //
translated: Gods are those who exist among the gods.

original: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / myur ba dang / mtha' bzang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / myur ba dang / mtha' bzang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is not fruitless, it is pleasing, it is supreme, it is swift, and it has a good end.

original: de la bsod nams bya ba'i sa bon chung du yin yang 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsod nams bya ba'i sa bon chung du yin yang 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Here, even though the seed of the meritorious work is small, it is not fruitless,

original: 'bras bu 'byin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it definitely remains to yield a fruit.

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fruit is pleasing because the maturational fruit is desired.

original: 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ni lha la sogs pa'i 'byor pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ni lha la sogs pa'i 'byor pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fruit is supreme because it is the cause of the prosperity of gods and so on, and because the fruit is abundant.

original: 'bras bu myur ba ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu myur ba ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fruit is swift because it is experienced in this life.

original: 'bras bu mtha' bzang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mtha' bzang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fruit has a good end because it becomes the cause of nirvana.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i khungs gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni gang dag rgyal ba zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i khungs gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni gang dag rgyal ba zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: who are the knowers of the world,🔽who are the seers of the world,🔽who are the expounders of the world,🔽who are the saviors of the world,🔽who are the lords of the world,🔽who are the teachers of the world,🔽who are the buddhas, the benefactors of the world,🔽are the ones who have taught the Dharma

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa las rgyal bar byed pas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.🔽They have taught the holy life in its entirety,

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: both in its meaning and in its words.🔽They have fully revealed the supreme holy life.🔽Those who have seen the truth and are free from doubt🔽should practice the Dharma taught by the Buddha.🔽Those who are wise should practice the Dharma🔽and not be negligent in this world.🔽Those who are wise should practice the Dharma🔽and attain the state of immortality.”🔽This is the verse.

original: gdul @328b bya gdul bas na rnam 'dren no //
analyzed: gdul @328b bya gdul bas na rnam 'dren no //
translated: The word “victorious” means that they are victorious over the afflictions together with their traces.🔽“🔽The word “action” means “aspect.”🔽“🔽Guide” means that they guide those to be trained.🔽“

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: Various” means that they act in the desire and form realms.🔽“🔽The state of immortality” means nirvana.

original: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽slob dang thun mong yin zhing rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o // slob dang thun mong yin zhing rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The state of ambrosia is nirvana.🔽It is shared with the trainees, and it is extensive.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos thams cad ni dbang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa yin mod kyi slob ma dang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos thams cad ni dbang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir bla na med pa yin mod kyi slob ma dang thun mong yin no //
translated: The Dharma of the buddhas, the blessed ones, is unsurpassed because it is completely pure, and it is shared with the disciples.

original: so so skye bo dang thun mong yin no zhes yon tan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rigs la dgongs nas brjod do //
analyzed: so so skye bo dang thun mong yin no zhes yon tan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rigs la dgongs nas brjod do //
translated: It is shared with ordinary beings.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par ro //
translated: As appropriate means as is possible.

original: de la slob ma dang thun mong ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob ma dang thun mong ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: Among those, that shared with disciples is the absence of conflict, knowledge through prayer, and analytical knowledges.

original: so so skye bo dang thun mong ba ni mngon par shes pa dang bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: so so skye bo dang thun mong ba ni mngon par shes pa dang bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: That shared with ordinary beings is the superknowledges, meditative stabilizations, and so on.

original: zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The bases of mastery, the bases of totality, and so on. The term “and so on” includes the meditative stabilizations of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and other meditative stabilizations.

original: dgra bcom pa la la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Some arhats, etc.

original: 'di na dgra bcom pa la la smad 'tshong ma dang zlos gar mkhan dang g-yon can dang chang 'tshong la sogs pa'i skye bo dag la bdag dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rjes su 'brel pa dran nas /
analyzed: 'di na dgra bcom pa la la smad 'tshong ma dang zlos gar mkhan dang g-yon can dang chang 'tshong la sogs pa'i skye bo dag la bdag dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba rjes su 'brel pa dran nas /
translated: Here, some arhats remember that they and others have unpleasant results that are related to the afflictions of prostitutes, actors, swindlers, bartenders, and so on.

original: re shig 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rgyud la skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin na /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud la skyes pa rnams kyi gnas skabs gang zhig tu 'gyur snyam du de ltar rjes su sems shing bsams nas ji ltar gzhan dag la de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang ngam nga rgyal lam ser sna'am /
analyzed: re shig 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rgyud la skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin na / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud la skyes pa rnams kyi gnas skabs gang zhig tu 'gyur snyam du de ltar rjes su sems shing bsams nas ji ltar gzhan dag la de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang ngam nga rgyal lam ser sna'am /
translated: They think, “Even the afflictions that arise in the mindstreams of those who are attached have unpleasant results.🔽What then is the situation for those who arise in the mindstreams of those who are free from attachment?”

original: phrag dog la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba skye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo'i shes pa bskyed de /
analyzed: phrag dog la sogs pa rnams las gang yang rung ba skye bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ngo bo'i shes pa bskyed de /
translated: Having thought in this way, they generate the knowledge that prevents any of the following afflictions from arising in others: attachment, aversion, pride, miserliness, and jealousy.

original: 'dir mthong bas spang bar bya bar bsrung bar mi nus pas 'dod chags la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir mthong bas spang bar bya bar bsrung bar mi nus pas 'dod chags la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Here, attachment and so on are mentioned because they cannot be guarded against by the path of insight.

original: nyon mongs par mi byed pa ni nyon mongs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽kun rdzob shes zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud kyi bsgom pas @329a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs par mi byed pa ni nyon mongs par byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // kun rdzob shes zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud kyi bsgom pas @329a * //
translated: They do not afflict means they do not afflict.

original: spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Conventional knowledge is the object of the knowledge of the path, because it has as its object the future affliction that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the continuum of another.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the uncontaminated knowledge of one who has entered that path does not exist.

original: de la phung po la rgod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la phung po la rgod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three obscurations of the affliction of agitation with regard to the aggregates:

original: phung po nyon mongs pa dang 'chi ba la rgol ba nyon mongs pa dang / 'thab pa nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: phung po nyon mongs pa dang 'chi ba la rgol ba nyon mongs pa dang / 'thab pa nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: the affliction of the agitation of the aggregates, the affliction of the agitation of death, and the affliction of the agitation of strife.

original: nyon mongs pa brgyad dang bcas pa'i brgya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa brgyad dang bcas pa'i brgya'o //
translated: There are one hundred afflictions, together with their eight secondary afflictions.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa nyon mongs pa med pa yin yang zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs pa med bsten par bshad pas 'dres pa rnams gang yang rung bas kyang bstan pa yin
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa nyon mongs pa med pa yin yang zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs pa med bsten par bshad pas 'dres pa rnams gang yang rung bas kyang bstan pa yin
translated: But it is explained as the absence of conflict that relies on the concentration of peace, so it is taught as any of the mixed ones.

original: no // nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin snga ma langs pa des bdag mthong nas 'di'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: no // nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin snga ma langs pa des bdag mthong nas 'di'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: When the former concentration of absence of conflict arises, it sees that and thinks, “His attachment will arise.”

original: 'di'i zhe sdang dang 'di'i nga rgyal dang / 'di'i bag med pa skye bar 'ong ngo snyam du ji lta ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas kyang mthun par spyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di'i zhe sdang dang 'di'i nga rgyal dang / 'di'i bag med pa skye bar 'ong ngo snyam du ji lta ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas kyang mthun par spyod par byed do //
translated: “His aversion, his pride, his heedlessness will arise,” and it arises from that concentration in accordance with whatever is desired and acts in accordance with that.

original: bsam gtan mtha' na zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha' na zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa kho na yin te /
translated: The end of the absorptions refers to the fourth absorption alone, because it is the highest of the easy paths and because it is the opposite of the cause of suffering.

original: gzhan mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi yin te /
translated: It is the immoveable arhat alone who possesses it,

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa sel bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa sel bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is engaged in eliminating afflictions in the mindstreams of others.🔽Other arhats do not possess it,

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan gyis ni mi yin te zhes bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan gyis ni mi yin te zhes bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i ma yin pa'o //
translated: because they are not liberated according to circumstance.🔽It is also in their own mindstreams,

original: rang gi rgyud las kyang zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i tshe na ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud las kyang zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa'i tshe na ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when they fully degenerate, they do not possess mastery over concentration.

original: gzhir bcas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhir bcas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
translated: It is said to be a basis because it is desire realm attachment and so on that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs she na /
translated: How does it focus on future affliction?

original: de'i pha rol po dag nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ba smos smos so //
analyzed: de'i pha rol po dag nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ba smos smos so //
translated: Because they engage in the thought, “May the afflictions not arise in others.”

original: ci'i phyi bzhi dang bcas pa rnams kho na la dmigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyi bzhi dang bcas pa rnams kho na la dmigs she na /
translated: Why do they focus on the four formless states?

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Those who are free from affliction…”

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi med pa ni mthong bas spangs bar bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi med pa ni mthong bas spangs bar bya ba rnams te /
translated: Those who are free from the four afflictions are those who abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'jig tshogs lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni khams @329b dang sa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni khams @329b dang sa thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: But the afflicted view of the self and so on cannot be averted because they focus on all realms and levels.

original: smon na shes pa'ang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon na shes pa'ang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one wishes, knowledge is also like that.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa rang gi ngo bo dang sa dang rgyu dang rten las ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du smos nas shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa rang gi ngo bo dang sa dang rgyu dang rten las ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du smos nas shes pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as the nature, level, cause, and basis of those free from affliction are explained, so too is knowledge.

original: smon nas shes pas gzugs med pa rnams mngon sum du ni ye shes so zhes bya ba ni smon nas shes pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir te /🔽mngon par shes pa rang dang 'og ma'i sa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: smon nas shes pas gzugs med pa rnams mngon sum du ni ye shes so zhes bya ba ni smon nas shes pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir te / mngon par shes pa rang dang 'og ma'i sa'i yul can yin la /
translated: Knowledge through prayer is on the level of the fourth absorption because higher perception is an object of its level and lower levels.🔽Higher perception is explained as being similar to knowledge through prayer.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.

original: smon nas shes pa yang mngon par shes pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad par bya'o //🔽rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa yang mngon par shes pa dang 'dra'o zhes bshad par bya'o // rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa dang gzugs skyes pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i bye brag las so //🔽'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa gang du skye ba gang yin pa de ni spyod pa'i bye brag las so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa dang gzugs skyes pa ni rgyu mthun pa'i bye brag las so // 'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa gang du skye ba gang yin pa de ni spyod pa'i bye brag las so //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu dang rgyus kyang 'bras bu shes pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu dang rgyus kyang 'bras bu shes pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its object.🔽Knowledge of others' minds is distinguished by its cause and its

original: 'dir dpe ni zhing pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dper na zhing pa dag sa bon gyis 'bras bu dang 'bras bus sa bon rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no //🔽smon pa sngar btang ba zhes bya ba ni gtong ba sngar btang ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni zhing pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dper na zhing pa dag sa bon gyis 'bras bu dang 'bras bus sa bon rtogs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang yin no // smon pa sngar btang ba zhes bya ba ni gtong ba sngar btang ba ste /
translated: The example here is like a farmer. Just as farmers understand seeds from fruits and fruits from seeds, so it is here.🔽Having previously made a vow means having previously made a resolution.

original: smon nas zhes bya ba 'di ni btang nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon nas zhes bya ba 'di ni btang nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This having vowed means having resolved.

original: 'di ni shes par bya'o snyam du smon nas rang gyi mtha'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni shes par bya'o snyam du smon nas rang gyi mtha'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having vowed, I will know this, one enters meditative absorption in the fourth dhyāna of one's own stage.

original: sa thams cad dang mthun par byas pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'phel ba mthar thug pa ni rab kyi mtha' las bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa thams cad dang mthun par byas pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'phel ba mthar thug pa ni rab kyi mtha' las bya ba'o //
translated: Having made it compatible with all stages, the culmination of the increase of the fourth dhyāna is the supreme limit.

original: ci ltar zhe na dgra bcom ba bsam gtan dang po nas btsams te ji srid 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du lugs dang mthun par snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na dgra bcom ba bsam gtan dang po nas btsams te ji srid 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du lugs dang mthun par snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: How? The arhat enters meditative absorption in the forward order, beginning with the first dhyāna up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and up to the fourth dhyāna.

original: de nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar dang bsam gtan dang po las langs nas yang lugs dang mthun par bzhi pa'i chu ngu la'o //
analyzed: de nas bsam gtan dang po'i bar dang bsam gtan dang po las langs nas yang lugs dang mthun par bzhi pa'i chu ngu la'o //
translated: Then, having arisen from the first meditation, he again enters the fourth meditation in the direct order.

original: de'i 'og tu 'bring la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'bring la'o //
translated: After that, he enters the medium one.

original: de'i 'og tu che po la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu che po la'o //
translated: After that, he enters the great one.

original: chen po'i 'og tu chen po la ste /
analyzed: chen po'i 'og tu chen po la ste /
translated: After the great one, he again enters the great one.

original: de'i 'og tu smon nas shes pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu smon nas shes pa mngon du byed do //
translated: After that, he manifests the cognition resulting from a resolve.

original: gang gi ting nge 'dzin de yul du gyur pas ji ltar smon pa'i don sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir rab @330a * //
analyzed: gang gi ting nge 'dzin de yul du gyur pas ji ltar smon pa'i don sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir rab @330a * //
translated: Since that concentration becomes the domain of the cognition resulting from a resolve, it accomplishes the aim as wished for.

original: kyi mtha'i sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyi mtha'i sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the highest worldly factor.

original: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba spang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to avoid the fault of overextension, he says: “as much as is the domain of that concentration.”

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi dngos su shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi dngos su shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The past, future, and present are not directly known by inference alone.

original: tsa sogs pa'i skyon mthong ba las zhing phun sum tshogs par rjes su dpag pa bzhin no zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: tsa sogs pa'i skyon mthong ba las zhing phun sum tshogs par rjes su dpag pa bzhin no zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: It is like the inference of a perfect field from the observation of a fault, such as the presence of salt.

original: de lta mod kyi slob pa dang so so skye bo dag la yod pa'i shes pa 'di lta bu de ni smon nas shes pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi slob pa dang so so skye bo dag la yod pa'i shes pa 'di lta bu de ni smon nas shes pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the knowledge of this kind that belongs to the learners and ordinary worldlings is not knowledge through a vow, because it is mistaken.

original: gang nyan thos chen po rnams ma 'ongs pa'i don la nyan pa de ni 'khrul pa ma yin te smon nas shes pa dang cig shos kun dzo ba shes pas mthong ba brda sprod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang nyan thos chen po rnams ma 'ongs pa'i don la nyan pa de ni 'khrul pa ma yin te smon nas shes pa dang cig shos kun dzo ba shes pas mthong ba brda sprod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the knowledge of the great disciples concerning future things is not mistaken, because it is knowledge through a vow and because it is knowledge through direct intuition that is not mistaken.

original: smon nas shes pa dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dag la khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa dang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dag la khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between knowledge through a vow and the recollection of past lives?

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni snga ma dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni phyi ma nyid do //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni snga ma dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can ni phyi ma nyid do //

analyzed: spyi'i yul can nyid kyang yul ches shin tu gsal g-yo ba gang yin pa ni smon nas shes pas shes so zhes bya ba khyad par ro //

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sems pa da ltar byung ba'i yul can dang smon nas shes pa khyad par ji ltar rigs par brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa dang sa sa dang rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ces bya ba la /

original: bye brag gi sgra ni re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: bye brag gi sgra ni re re dang sbyar te /

original: dmigs pa'i bye brag dang rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag ces bya ba tha dad du brjod do //🔽nyon mongs pa med pa las zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: thogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: don la 'dud par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it bows to the meaning.

original: 'dis don rtogs par byed pas na tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis don rtogs par byed pas na tshig go //

analyzed: sgra'i don la bltos pa med pa'i blo las gang gi tshe tshig de dag yig ge ka tsa ta ta pa la sogs pa de dag sgra'i don las bltos pa med pa'i blo'i gnas skabs su yod pa nyid kyis dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur bar nus pa ma

analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par ram sdug bsngal gyi phyogs gcig la mi 'jug ste /

original: tha dad pa nyid ci zhe na /🔽nges pa'i tshig la ma bltos pa rig pa thogs pa med par brjod pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid ci zhe na / nges pa'i tshig la ma bltos pa rig pa thogs pa med par brjod pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: What is the difference between them?🔽The analytical knowledge of eloquence is the unhindered expression of knowledge that does not rely on linguistic expressions.

original: nges pa'i tshig la bltos pa ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig la bltos pa ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: The analytical knowledge of linguistic expression relies on linguistic expressions.

original: dper na gzugs su rung bas gzugs so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs su rung bas gzugs so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, “It is visible, therefore it is form,” and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re gong nas gong du spobs pas spobs pa dang chos kyi rang bzhin gsal bar byed pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gong nas gong du spobs pas spobs pa dang chos kyi rang bzhin gsal bar byed pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is etymology because it is eloquence in the higher realms and because it illuminates the nature of the Dharma.

original: yan chad na ming gi tshogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs med pa dag la chos yang dag par rig pa med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: yan chad na ming gi tshogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs med pa dag la chos yang dag par rig pa med do zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the discernment of phenomena does not exist in the formless realm because there is no collection of names there.

original: ming gi tshogs bkag pa kho nas tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs bkag pa ste /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs bkag pa kho nas tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs bkag pa ste /
translated: The collection of words and the collection of syllables are also absent there because the collection of names is absent there.

original: phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually concomitant.

original: yan chad na rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa med de /
analyzed: yan chad na rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa med de /
translated: It is said that the discernment of eloquence does not exist in the second absorption and above, or in the special first absorption,

original: ngag kun nas slong ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag kun nas slong ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no discursive thought that motivates speech.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di gtan tshigs ma yin te ngag kun nas slong ba'i shes pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i zhes sgrub @332a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di gtan tshigs ma yin te ngag kun nas slong ba'i shes pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i zhes sgrub @332a * //
translated: Others say: This is not a reason, because the knowledge that motivates speech is not established as the analytical knowledge of language.

original: par mi nus so //
analyzed: par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be established.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were established, it would follow that it is the nature of analytical knowledge in equipoise.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes dri'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhes dri'o //
translated: Therefore it should not be said that it is nonconceptual.

original: 'di la skyon med de don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la skyon med de don gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no error here, because it has a different meaning.

original: 'dir 'di'i don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here its meaning should be stated.

original: dag kun nas slong ba'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang gong na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag kun nas slong ba'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni rab tu ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang gong na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The investigation and analysis that motivate speech have the characteristic of non-peacefulness, and they do not exist above that level.

original: rab tu zhi ba dang phra mo ni sa gong mar yang 'dod do //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba dang phra mo ni sa gong mar yang 'dod do //
translated: Peacefulness and subtlety are asserted to exist on higher levels.

original: ngag tsam gyi yul yang shes pa rab tu ma zhi ba dang rgya chen po yin pas sa gong ma na med do //
analyzed: ngag tsam gyi yul yang shes pa rab tu ma zhi ba dang rgya chen po yin pas sa gong ma na med do //
translated: The object of mere speech is also non-peaceful knowledge and extensive, so it does not exist on higher levels.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The correct knowledge of the etymological interpretation is called the correct knowledge of the etymological interpretation.

original: bsam gtan dang po rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa la yang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa skye bas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa la yang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa skye bas /
translated: Because the first absorption has investigation, the correct knowledge of the etymological interpretation arises in equipoise.

original: de ni 'dod dang po na zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'dod dang po na zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore it is said to exist in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: de ni ming dang don la dmigs shing snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni ming dang don la dmigs shing snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: It focuses on names and meanings, and it is associated with equipoise.

original: de'i rjes su smra ba dang rjes thob pa rnams la thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su smra ba dang rjes thob pa rnams la thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the unobstructed knowledge of those who speak and those who attain it subsequently.

original: btags pa las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las so //
analyzed: btags pa las zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las so //
translated: From the treatises means from the scriptures.

original: tshig dang yi ge zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshig gsal bar byed pas na yi ge ste ming ngo //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshig gsal bar byed pas na yi ge ste ming ngo //
translated: Words and letters means that which clarifies words is a letter, which is a name.

original: de nyid kyi don zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge'o //
translated: That itself is the meaning means that words and letters are that itself.

original: de nyid kyi gcig dang zhes bya ba don gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gcig dang zhes bya ba don gyi'o //
translated: That itself is one means that it is for the sake of the meaning.

original: de la thag thogs med par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la thag thogs med par bya ba la zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In that regard, in order to act without impediment means in regard to words, letters, and so on.

original: thogs pa med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: thogs pa med par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa med pa'o ;
translated: “Unimpeded cognition” means without obstruction.

original: / pho dang mo la sogs pa'i tshig bla dags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ma ning dang byed pa po la sogs pa bsdu'o //🔽tshig gcig nyid la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: / pho dang mo la sogs pa'i tshig bla dags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ma ning dang byed pa po la sogs pa bsdu'o // tshig gcig nyid la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshig bla dags so //
translated: “Terms such as male and female” and so on refers to terms such as neuter, agent, and so on.🔽“Terms” refers to terms such as one, and so on.

original: tshig nges pa ni nges pa'i tshig ste zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa gcig go //
analyzed: tshig nges pa ni nges pa'i tshig ste zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa gcig go //
translated: “Definitive terms” refers to etymologies.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In order” means in accordance with the order of the four knowledges.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i sngon gyi spyod pa ni rtsis yin no //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i sngon gyi spyod pa ni rtsis yin no //
translated: The former practice of the knowledge of the Dharma is mathematics.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka'o //🔽nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni sgra rig pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bka'o // nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni sgra rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the meaning is the Buddha’s word.🔽The knowledge of definitive terms is grammar.

original: spobs pa so so yang @332b dag par rig pa ni gtan tshigs rig pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang @332b dag par rig pa ni gtan tshigs rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of eloquence is logic.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sangs rgyas kyi bka' kho na yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re sangs rgyas kyi bka' kho na yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is the Buddha’s word.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kho na de skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kho na de skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are generated only by those who are Buddhists.

original: gang la gcig yod pa de la gdon mi za bar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi char yod de zhes bya ba ni lam gcig gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la gcig yod pa de la gdon mi za bar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi char yod de zhes bya ba ni lam gcig gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one exists, all four exist without doubt, because they are the result of one path.

original: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
analyzed: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
translated: One does not obtain them without a complete set.

original: ces bya ba ni 'gas kyang so so yang dag par rig pa dag ma tshang bar 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'gas kyang so so yang dag par rig pa dag ma tshang bar 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not obtain any of the analytical knowledges without a complete set.

original: de dag kyang tshe rabs gzhan du yi ge dang don la mkhas par byas ba la bltos te skye'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshe rabs gzhan du yi ge dang don la mkhas par byas ba la bltos te skye'o //
translated: They arise in dependence on skill in the letters and meanings in other lives.

original: gang la gcig yod pa de la gdon mi za bar thams cad ces bya ba ni lam gcig gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la gcig yod pa de la gdon mi za bar thams cad ces bya ba ni lam gcig gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When one exists, all exist without doubt, because they are the result of one path.

original: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
analyzed: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
translated: One does not obtain them without a complete set.🔽One does not obtain any of the analytical knowledges without a complete set.

original: ces bya ba ste 'phags pa'i rigs ni 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ste 'phags pa'i rigs ni 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: They arise in dependence on skill in the letters and meanings in other lives.

original: gzhan dag na re ma tshang ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa 'thob pa'i sgra thob pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ma tshang ba'i so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi so so yang dag par rig pa 'thob pa'i sgra thob pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The words “one who obtains” do not refer to one who obtains the analytical knowledges that are incomplete.

original: nges pa'i tshig dang don gyi dam bca' la thogs pa med pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa'o //🔽de dag ni rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis 'thob po zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni rab kyi mtha' pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed nas 'thob kyi /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang don gyi dam bca' la thogs pa med pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa'o // de dag ni rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis 'thob po zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams ni rab kyi mtha' pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed nas 'thob kyi /
translated: The analytical knowledges are unimpeded with regard to the expression and the proposition of meaning.🔽They are obtained by the power of the fourth absorption of the summit of existence.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The qualities such as the absence of conflict are obtained by generating the fourth absorption of the summit of existence, but not otherwise.

original: rab kyi mtha' pa de nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rab kyi mtha' pa de nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The fourth absorption of the summit of existence itself

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa sbyor ba las byung ba bsam gtan bzhi pa chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa sbyor ba las byung ba bsam gtan bzhi pa chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: is the great of the great fourth absorption that is distinct from the absence of conflict and so on and is derived from preparation.🔽They are obtained by the power of that,

original: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rab kyi mtha' pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'thob pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni rab kyi mtha' pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: that is, by the power of the fourth absorption of the summit of existence.

original: de bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not on the level of the fourth meditation,

original: de na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis de kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis de kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no investigation there, and because it is aroused by a mind that is accompanied by investigation.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pas de'i bdag nyid zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan gyis bsdus pas de'i bdag nyid zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The end of the qualities such as the absence of conflict is included in the fourth meditation, and so it is said that it has that for its nature.🔽But it is not of the nature of the fourth meditation,

original: yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not included in the fourth meditation.

original: 'phel ba'i rab tu phyin pa yin zhes bya ba ni thams cad ma yin no snyam du bsam pa'o //🔽mi @333a * //🔽mthun pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i rab tu phyin pa yin zhes bya ba ni thams cad ma yin no snyam du bsam pa'o // mi @333a * // mthun pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //
translated: The end of the increase is not all, that is, it is not the case that all of the fourth meditation is the end of the increase.🔽The end of the decrease is the first meditation.🔽The end of the decrease of the first meditation is the second meditation.🔽The end of the decrease of the second meditation is the third meditation.🔽The end of the decrease of the third meditation is the fourth meditation.🔽The end of the decrease of the fourth meditation is the sphere of infinite space.🔽The end of the decrease of the sphere of infinite space is the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la yin pa nas /🔽de bzhin du 'dod phan spyod pa'i bar sems 'phel ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la yin pa nas /🔽de bzhin du 'dod phan spyod pa'i bar sems 'phel ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The end of the decrease of the sphere of infinite consciousness is the sphere of nothingness.

original: gang zag la bltos nas ji ltar rigs par nyan thos la sogs pa rnams rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bltos nas ji ltar rigs par nyan thos la sogs pa rnams rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: In relation to the person, it is the culmination of the śrāvaka, etc.

original: 'di'i 'phel ba'i don gang yin pa rab tu gyur pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'phel ba'i don gang yin pa rab tu gyur pa thob pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “culmination” is the attainment of the highest degree of that which is to be increased.

original: mu bzhi pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu rnam pa bzhi yin pas de bzhin du rab kyi mtha' yang rnam pa'i mthar rab tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mu rnam pa bzhi yin pas de bzhin du rab kyi mtha' yang rnam pa'i mthar rab tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Like the four alternatives, just as there are four alternatives, so too the culmination is the highest degree of the alternatives.

original: 'phel ba phul du dbyung du med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phel ba phul du dbyung du med pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no higher degree of increase.

original: kha cig ni snying rje nyid nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni snying rje nyid nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Some think that compassion itself is the absence of conflict.

original: snyam du sems te snying rje ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pas nyam nga bar yang 'jug pa de'i phyir snying rje rang bzhin nyon mongs pa med pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: snyam du sems te snying rje ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pas nyam nga bar yang 'jug pa de'i phyir snying rje rang bzhin nyon mongs pa med pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Compassion is associated with the absence of conflict, and so it engages without distress. Therefore, compassion is the absence of conflict by nature.

original: 'di mtha' gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di mtha' gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not certain in every case.

original: gcig tu gzhan gyi don kho na la gzigs pa rnams gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa skye ba bzlog par mdzad mod kyi de dag zhi ba'i lam gyis kyang de ltar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gcig tu gzhan gyi don kho na la gzigs pa rnams gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa skye ba bzlog par mdzad mod kyi de dag zhi ba'i lam gyis kyang de ltar sgrub par byed do //
translated: Those who see only the welfare of others, even though they prevent the arising of the defilements of others, they also practice with the path of peace.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyud la sor mo'i phreng ba can la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i phyir ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyud la sor mo'i phreng ba can la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i phyir ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Since the defilements of Aṅgulimāla and others arose in the continuum of the Bhagavat, how can the Tathāgata be said to abide in the absence of defilements?

original: skyon 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: skyon 'dir thal bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: This fault does not arise.

original: thugs rje mnga' ba gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa gtan du dbyung bar bzhed pa rnams ni res 'ga' nyon mongs pa skye ba btang snyoms su mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje mnga' ba gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa gtan du dbyung bar bzhed pa rnams ni res 'ga' nyon mongs pa skye ba btang snyoms su mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Those who possess compassion and wish to eliminate the defilements of others sometimes allow the arising of defilements.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa med pa 'di med par smon nas shes pa bskyed par nus la /🔽de lta na 'di yin no gal te bdag 'di mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa med pa 'di med par smon nas shes pa bskyed par nus la /🔽de lta na 'di yin no gal te bdag 'di mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they are able to generate the knowledge of the absence of defilements after generating the knowledge of aspiration.🔽If it were otherwise, they would not be able to generate the knowledge of the absence of defilements.

original: de bzhin du yang nyon mongs pa bskyed pa de bzhin byed pa nyon mongs pa bskyed par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang nyon mongs pa bskyed pa de bzhin byed pa nyon mongs pa bskyed par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of another's thoughts does not necessarily produce the defilements, even though it is produced by the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa bskyed par ma nus kyang smon nas shes pa bskyed par nus so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa bskyed par ma nus kyang smon nas shes pa bskyed par nus so //
translated: One is not able to produce the knowledge of non-defilement, but one is able to produce the knowledge by resolve.

original: kha cig na re smon nas shes pa bskyed par yang nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re smon nas shes pa bskyed par yang nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Some say: One is not able to produce the knowledge by resolve, even though one is able to produce the knowledge of non-defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dag @333b phan tshun bsdus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dag @333b phan tshun bsdus so zhes zer ro //
translated: The knowledge of non-defilement and the knowledge by resolve are mutually inclusive.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa med pa ni rnam pa tha dad pa rnam pa gzhan med par gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'jug la smon nas shes pa ni don 'di dang 'di bdag gis shes par bya'o snyam du smon nas snyoms par 'jug cing do de
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa med pa ni rnam pa tha dad pa rnam pa gzhan med par gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'jug la smon nas shes pa ni don 'di dang 'di bdag gis shes par bya'o snyam du smon nas snyoms par 'jug cing do de
translated: Moreover, the knowledge of non-defilement enters into the pacification of another's defilements without any other aspect. The knowledge by resolve enters into meditative concentration by resolving: “I will know this and that object.”

original: las langs nas don shes par byed cing brda sprod par yang byed do //
analyzed: las langs nas don shes par byed cing brda sprod par yang byed do //
translated: Having arisen from that, one causes the object to be known and one also causes the conventional symbol to be known.

original: sangs rgyas las gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las gzhan zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: “Other than a Buddha” refers to the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la des dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la des dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Because He is the Lord of all dharmas” means that He is the Master of all dharmas.

original: bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: “It depends on His mere will” is the elaboration.

original: ji skad bshad pa bzhin sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not produced by application as has been explained.

original: kha cig na re dge ba dang dge ba las gzhan pa yang bzhed pa tsam la rag las te /
analyzed: kha cig na re dge ba dang dge ba las gzhan pa yang bzhed pa tsam la rag las te /
translated: Some say that the good and the other than good also depend on His mere will.

original: gang bzhed par dbang bsgyur ba'o zhes zer ro //🔽so so skye bo dag dang yang zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: gang bzhed par dbang bsgyur ba'o zhes zer ro // so so skye bo dag dang yang zhes bya ba la ;
translated: He is the Master of what He wills.🔽“Even with ordinary people” means

original: yang gi sgras ni nyan thos rnams dang yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni nyan thos rnams dang yang ngo //
translated: even with the Sravakas.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The superknowledge of the realization of the knowledge of the domain of supernormal power.

original: 'dis sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'byong bar byed pas na rdzu 'phrul dang ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'dis sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba 'byong bar byed pas na rdzu 'phrul dang ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Since this causes one to master emanation and travel in space, it is called supernatural power and concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul ni sprul pa dang nam mkha' la 'gro ba'o //
translated: The domain of supernatural power is emanation and travel in space.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi shes pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of the domain of supernatural power is knowledge of the domain of supernatural power.

original: de mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Its realization is its actualization.

original: lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba la lha'i rna ba la brten pa'i shes pa ni lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba la lha'i rna ba la brten pa'i shes pa ni lha'i rna ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of divine ear is knowledge based on the divine ear.

original: de mngon du byed pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon du byed pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Its realization is its actualization.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowledge of the categories of mind is knowledge of the categories of mind.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs ni khyad par ram rim pa zhes pa ste /🔽res 'ga' chags so snyam du shes la /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs ni khyad par ram rim pa zhes pa ste / res 'ga' chags so snyam du shes la /
translated: The categories of mind are its distinctions or stages.🔽Sometimes one knows, “He is attached,”

original: res 'ga' sngang ngo snyam du shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' sngang ngo snyam du shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: sometimes one knows, “He is frightened,” and so on.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du byed ces bya ba la sngon gyi gnas /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon du byed ces bya ba la sngon gyi gnas /
translated: The expression “he manifests the superknowledge that is knowledge of recollecting past lives” is to be analyzed as follows:

original: ksha ti ka ta tra ba te /
analyzed: ksha ti ka ta tra ba te /
translated: kṣattikātkatastravadet.

original: 'das pa'i tshe rabs snga ma ni sngon gyi gnas so //🔽de'i yul dran pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshe rabs snga ma ni sngon gyi gnas so // de'i yul dran pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Past lives are past births.🔽The knowledge of their object is the knowledge of recollecting past lives.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that is associated with that is the knowledge of recollecting past lives.

original: de mngon du byas pa ni mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon du byas pa ni mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The manifestation of that is the superknowledge.

original: @334a * // 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @334a * // 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The expression “he manifests the superknowledge that is knowledge of death and rebirth” is to be analyzed as follows:

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag go //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba ni 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dag go //
translated: Death and rebirth are death and rebirth.

original: de'i yul shes pa ste 'di ni lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul shes pa ste 'di ni lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of their object is the superknowledge of the divine eye.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du byed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du byed ces bya ba la /
translated: The expression “he manifests the superknowledge that is knowledge of the destruction of the impurities” is to be analyzed as follows:

original: zag pa zad pa ni zag pa zad pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa ni zag pa zad pa ste /
translated: The destruction of the impurities is the destruction of the impurities.

original: de shes pa ni zag pa zad pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: de shes pa ni zag pa zad pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: de'i yul shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i yul shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “object” is “that which is to be known.”

original: de mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa re re la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa re re la sbyar ro //
translated: Each of the superknowledges is applied to the object that is to be known.

original: lnga ni so so skye bo rnams dang thun mong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni so so skye bo rnams dang thun mong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni tha ma ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Five are common to ordinary beings, because the last one is excluded.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the fruits of asceticism.

original: ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa de bzhin du mngon par shes pa yang yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa de bzhin du mngon par shes pa yang yin gyi /
translated: Just as the fruits of asceticism are conditioned and included in the path of liberation, so too are the superknowledges.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the uninterrupted paths.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir dang / zag pa zad par byed pa'i bar chad med pa la ma btang nas dgra bcom pa yang mngon par shes pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir dang / zag pa zad par byed pa'i bar chad med pa la ma btang nas dgra bcom pa yang mngon par shes pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the knowledge of the minds of others is excluded from the uninterrupted paths, and because if the uninterrupted path that brings about the destruction of the defilements is excluded, it would follow that the arhat would not have the superknowledges.

original: bzhi ni kun rdzob shes pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi ni kun rdzob shes pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Four are conventional knowledge.

original: nub phyogs pa rnams na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa ni shes pa drug rnams so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nub phyogs pa rnams na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa ni shes pa drug rnams so zhes zer ro //
translated: The Westerners say: The superknowledge of recollecting former abodes is six cognitions.

original: chos shes pa ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang rjes su shes pa rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa la kun rdzob shes pa 'jig rten pa 'jug go //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang rjes su shes pa rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa la kun rdzob shes pa 'jig rten pa 'jug go //
translated: Conventional cognition, which is mundane, is added to cognition of the doctrine, which is the class of cognition of the doctrine, and to subsequent cognition, which is the class of subsequent cognition.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa 'das pa la sdug bsngal te de ltar kun 'byung shes pa dang lam shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa 'das pa la sdug bsngal te de ltar kun 'byung shes pa dang lam shes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa kun rdzob yin no //
translated: Conventional cognition is added to cognition of unsatisfactoriness, which is past, to cognition of the origin, and to cognition of the path, which are supramundane.

original: mdor ni kun rdzob shes pa nyid snang ngo //
analyzed: mdor ni kun rdzob shes pa nyid snang ngo //
translated: In brief, conventional cognition is added to the cognitions.

original: de bzhin du sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa rnam pa du ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa rnam pa du ma gsungs te /
translated: Similarly, the superknowledge of recollecting former abodes is said to be of many types:

original: skye ba gcig kyang dran no zhes bya ba nas rgyas par yul phyogs dang bcas rnam pa dang bcas zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: skye ba gcig kyang dran no zhes bya ba nas rgyas par yul phyogs dang bcas rnam pa dang bcas zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: one recollects one birth, and so on, up to: one recollects with their aspects and their locations.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni de ltar mi 'jug go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni de ltar mi 'jug go //
translated: But the uncontaminated cognition does not proceed in this way.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa ni lnga yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa ni lnga yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The superknowledge of the categories of mind is five.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i @334b phyir shes pa lnga bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i @334b phyir shes pa lnga bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is included in five knowledges because it is either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is one knowledge.

original: bzhi'i cha yang yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //🔽zad pa dang mi skye ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa shes pa rnams ma gtogs te /
analyzed: bzhi'i cha yang yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to // zad pa dang mi skye ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa shes pa rnams ma gtogs te /
translated: It is also a part of four knowledges, as was previously explained.🔽It is not the knowledge of elimination, nonarising, suffering, origin, or cessation.

original: de la zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa bkag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de la zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa bkag pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin la /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is not the nature of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising because it is excluded from them.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir 'gog pa shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir 'gog pa shes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the knowledge of cessation because it has the mind and mental factors as its object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid phyogs gcig yul can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid phyogs gcig yul can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang shes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the knowledge of suffering or origin because it has as its object the specific characteristics of the mind and mental factors.

original: 'di ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gal te na gang zad pa shes pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji skad du bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gal te na gang zad pa shes pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa yin na ni shes pa drug yin te /
translated: If it is knowledge of extinction that focuses on cessation, then it is six knowledges:

original: chos dang rjes dang 'gog pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag go //
analyzed: chos dang rjes dang 'gog pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag go //
translated: the knowledge of cessation, extinction, nonproduction, and the conventional, subsequent, and knowledge of the path.

original: 'on te zag pa zad pa'i rgyu la yod pa yin na ni de ltar na shes pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zag pa zad pa'i rgyu la yod pa yin na ni de ltar na shes pa bcu yin no //
translated: But if it is the cause of the extinction of the contaminants, then it is ten knowledges.🔽It should be understood that this is also the case with all levels.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin par yang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zag pa zad par mkhyen pa'i stobs sa thams cad pa yin pa de bzhin du zag pa zad shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yang sa thams cad pa
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni sa thams cad pa yin par yang shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zag pa zad par mkhyen pa'i stobs sa thams cad pa yin pa de bzhin du zag pa zad shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yang sa thams cad pa
translated: Just as the power of knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants is on all levels, so too the superknowledge of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants

original: yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as being on all levels.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The five superknowledges are on the level of the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i dngos gzhi rnams kho na yin gyi gzugs med pa rnams dang nye bar bsdogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i dngos gzhi rnams kho na yin gyi gzugs med pa rnams dang nye bar bsdogs ni ma yin no //
translated: The formless realm is not a basis because it is not a basis for the meditative development of the superknowledges.

original: re zhig gsum ni med de gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: re zhig gsum ni med de gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ste /
translated: The three of supernatural power, eye and ear are not in the formless realm because they are not in the form realm.

original: gsum po de dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin no /
analyzed: gsum po de dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin no /
translated: These three are in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa ma yin te gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
