analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa ma yin te gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The formless realm is not in the form realm because it is devoid of the notion of form.

original: gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are established in dependence on form because they are established by means of form.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i @335a * //🔽phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i @335a * //🔽phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are established by the path that has form as its object.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / mthar gyis sngon gyi gnas gzhan rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mthar gyis bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs gzhan dag 'dod pa'i khams su dran pa na skrug par byed pa na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / mthar gyis sngon gyi gnas gzhan rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mthar gyis bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs gzhan dag 'dod pa'i khams su dran pa na skrug par byed pa na /
translated: The recollection of past lives of others is the recollection of the former states of others, because it recollects the former states of others in the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The formless realm does not focus on the desire realm.🔽Because it focuses on time and so on.

original: dus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas dang dus la sogs pa dag na ni ci rigs par 'dod pa'i khams sam /🔽gzugs kyi khams na yod kyi /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas dang dus la sogs pa dag na ni ci rigs par 'dod pa'i khams sam / gzugs kyi khams na yod kyi /
translated: The desire realm and the form realm exist in places and times,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ma yin no //
translated: but the formless realm does not.

original: gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dag na ni khams 'og ma la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi dag na ni khams 'og ma la dmigs pa'am /
translated: The formless realm does not focus on lower realms,🔽because it does not focus on the desire realm or the form realm.🔽The formless realm does not focus on form,

original: gzugs la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because it does not focus on the form realm.

original: de lta na 'o na bsam gtan gyi nyer bsdogs dang / gzugs med pa dang po'i nyer bsdogs dag tu yang 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na bsam gtan gyi nyer bsdogs dang / gzugs med pa dang po'i nyer bsdogs dag tu yang 'gyur /
translated: If that is so, then the access concentrations to the absorptions and the access concentrations to the first formless realm would also be the basis of higher perception because they are the focal object of the mind of higher perception.

original: gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te ting nge 'dzin yan lag gis yongs su bzung ba kho na mngon par shes pa'i rten yin na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te ting nge 'dzin yan lag gis yongs su bzung ba kho na mngon par shes pa'i rten yin na /
translated: That is not so, because the basis of higher perception is only that which is fully qualified by the branch of concentration.

original: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i nyer bsdogs dag na yod pa ma yin pas de na mngon par shes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs med pa'i nyer bsdogs dag na yod pa ma yin pas de na mngon par shes pa med de /
translated: But that does not exist in the access concentrations to the formless realm, therefore higher perception does not exist there.

original: yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it does not exist there, it would not exist at all.

original: sa thams cad kyi shes pas zag pa zad pa'i shas pa la dmigs par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa thams cad kyi shes pas zag pa zad pa'i shas pa la dmigs par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is possible to focus on the knowledge that exhausts contaminants through the knowledge of all levels.

original: yang na ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par sgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa gzugs la stegs bcas nas mngon par sgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Or else, how is the knowledge of others' minds established by taking form as its basis?

original: de'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes par 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, if one wishes to know the minds of others...

original: de bzhin du pha rol po dag la yang gtod de zhes bya ba ni gtod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol po dag la yang gtod de zhes bya ba ni gtod par byed pa ste /
translated: So too, they are directed to others.🔽This is the process of directing the mind to others.

original: bdag gi lus 'di 'dra ba zhig la sems ni 'di 'dra ba zhig yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'di 'dra ba zhig la sems ni 'di 'dra ba zhig yin la /
translated: This is the way my mind is in a body like this.

original: gzhan la yang lus 'di 'dra ba yod de /🔽de'i phyir 'di'i sems kyang 'di dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs 'dis mngon par shes pas mngon par shes pa ste de lta na de dag ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa 'grub nas gzugs la mi bltos par gzhan gyi
analyzed: gzhan la yang lus 'di 'dra ba yod de / de'i phyir 'di'i sems kyang 'di dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba'i gnas skabs 'dis mngon par shes pas mngon par shes pa ste de lta na de dag ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa 'grub nas gzugs la mi bltos par gzhan gyi
translated: Others have bodies like this.🔽Therefore, their minds are like this.

original: sems shes so //
analyzed: sems shes so //
translated: In this way, they know the minds of others without relying on form, having already achieved the superknowledge of the extinction of the contaminants.

original: mtshan @335b ma bzung nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan @335b ma bzung nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having taken up its sign means having ascertained the aspect of the mind.

original: de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems gang la mtshan ma nye bar bzung na de'i de ma thag tu 'gog pa gnas skabs gzhan gang yin pa de rnams dang po yid la byed do //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba ni sems gang la mtshan ma nye bar bzung na de'i de ma thag tu 'gog pa gnas skabs gzhan gang yin pa de rnams dang po yid la byed do //
translated: Immediately after means that they first attend to the other states that immediately follow the mind in which they take up the sign.

original: skad cig ma bar med pa yid la byed pa mi srid pas gnas skabs gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skad cig ma bar med pa yid la byed pa mi srid pas gnas skabs gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is impossible to attend to a momentary, uninterrupted state, he says, “a different state.”

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te nyams su myong ba dran na'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams ji ltar dran zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te nyams su myong ba dran na'o //
translated: How can one remember the gods of the pure abodes?

original: gnas gtsang ma pa rnams 'dir 'ong ba ni med de phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma pa rnams 'dir 'ong ba ni med de phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The gods of the pure abodes do not come here, because they are nonreturners.

original: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha rnams 'di 'dra ba zhig go zhes thos pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnas gtsang ma'i lha rnams 'di 'dra ba zhig go zhes thos pa yin no //
translated: “Because one experiences them through hearing” means that one hears, “The gods of the pure abodes are like this.”

original: nyams su myong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Experience is of two kinds:

original: thos pas nyams su myong ba dang mthong bas nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: thos pas nyams su myong ba dang mthong bas nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: experience through hearing and experience through seeing.

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa ni zhes bya ba la gzugs med pa dag nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa gang zhig bsam gtan bskyed nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa de ni pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas bskyed
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa ni zhes bya ba la gzugs med pa dag nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa gang zhig bsam gtan bskyed nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran par 'dod pa de ni pha rol po'i rgyud la brten nas bskyed
translated: who generates the absorptions and wishes to recollect past existences, generates them in dependence on the continuum of another.

original: do // sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa yin pas des gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: do // sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa yin pas des gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems mi 'dzin no //
translated: The knowledge that recollects past existences is subsumed by the absorptions, therefore it does not apprehend the mind that operates in the formless realm.

original: de pha rol po'i rgyud kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag par mtshan ma bzung nas de'i de ma thag tu lugs las bzlog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de pha rol po'i rgyud kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag par mtshan ma bzung nas de'i de ma thag tu lugs las bzlog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having apprehended the sign of the mind of another that has just ceased, immediately after that, in reverse order, it recollects the continuum of the mind of that other person.

original: mngon par grub nas ni gzugs med pa rnams thod rgal du yang dran par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par grub nas ni gzugs med pa rnams thod rgal du yang dran par byed do //
translated: Having been actualized, it recollects the formless realm in a skipping manner.

original: gal te gzugs med pa rnams mi dran na 'o na mdo las bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gal te gzugs dag gam gzugs med pa dag tu sngon gnas pa thams cad rnam pa dang bcas par rjes su dran no zhes mdo las gsungs pa ji ltar zhe na
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa rnams mi dran na 'o na mdo las bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gal te gzugs dag gam gzugs med pa dag tu sngon gnas pa thams cad rnam pa dang bcas par rjes su dran no zhes mdo las gsungs pa ji ltar zhe na
translated: The Blessed One said: If one remembers all one’s previous abodes in the form realm or formless realm, one remembers them with their aspects.

original: / bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni rjes su dpag ba 'khrul pa med pas shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni rjes su dpag ba 'khrul pa med pas shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: One knows this through unmistaken inference.

original: phyi rol pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dag ni nges par chad pa yin no zhes rab tu shes so //
analyzed: phyi rol pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dag ni nges par chad pa yin no zhes rab tu shes so //
translated: Non Buddhists know that desire realm and form realm objects are definitely severed.

original: gzugs med pa las shi 'pho ba mthong nas ma byung ba las byung ba zhes zer ro //🔽nyan thos @336a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa las shi 'pho ba mthong nas ma byung ba las byung ba zhes zer ro // nyan thos @336a * //
translated: They say that when one sees death and transmigration from the formless realm, one arises from the unarisen.

original: rnams kyis kyang gzugs med pa'i khams na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched pa rnams bskal pa stong phrag nyi shu nas 'chi 'pho ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnams kyis kyang gzugs med pa'i khams na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched pa rnams bskal pa stong phrag nyi shu nas 'chi 'pho ba mthong ngo //
translated: Sravakas also see that those of the base of infinite space die after twenty thousand eons in the formless realm.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse nas bskal pa stong phrag brgyad cu nas 'chi 'pho ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse nas bskal pa stong phrag brgyad cu nas 'chi 'pho ba mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, he sees that beings die after eighty thousand eons in Bhavāgra.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: “In the case of others” means in the case of other beings.

original: res 'ga' de'i sa pa tshe mtha' dag ma zad par 'chi'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' de'i sa pa tshe mtha' dag ma zad par 'chi'o //
translated: Sometimes, without having exhausted the entire life span of the level, they die.

original: res 'ga' sa 'og ma pa'i ris mthun pa gnyis sam gsum zad nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' sa 'og ma pa'i ris mthun pa gnyis sam gsum zad nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes, after having exhausted two or three types of homogeneous collections of the lower level, they are reborn.

original: de dag gi der shes pa 'khrul par spyod do //
analyzed: de dag gi der shes pa 'khrul par spyod do //
translated: They are mistaken about that.🔽The Bhagavat sees the thought of death just as it is, and he knows the thought of birth, the thought of the exhaustion of the entire life span, and the thought of the exhaustion of the life span.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag 'chi 'pho ba'i sems pa ji lta ba bzhin gzigs shing skye ba dang tshe mtha' dag ma tshang ba dang zad pa yang mkhyen cing de bzhin du de nas 'chi 'pho ba dang 'dir mtshams sbyor ba'i sems pa ji lta ba bzhin
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag 'chi 'pho ba'i sems pa ji lta ba bzhin gzigs shing skye ba dang tshe mtha' dag ma tshang ba dang zad pa yang mkhyen cing de bzhin du de nas 'chi 'pho ba dang 'dir mtshams sbyor ba'i sems pa ji lta ba bzhin
translated: In the same way, he sees the thought of death in that realm and the thought of conception here, just as it is.

original: du gzigs shing tshe mtha' dag ma tshang ba dang zad pa yang mkhyen te /
analyzed: du gzigs shing tshe mtha' dag ma tshang ba dang zad pa yang mkhyen te /
translated: He knows the thought of the exhaustion of the entire life span and the thought of the exhaustion of the life span.

original: de'i phyir ma 'khrul ba rjes su dpag pas mkhyen pa min no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'khrul ba rjes su dpag pas mkhyen pa min no //
translated: Therefore, he is not mistaken, and his knowledge is not by inference.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gzugs med pa nas shi 'pho ba ma yin pa de dag ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas bskyed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gzugs med pa nas shi 'pho ba ma yin pa de dag ni rang gi rgyud la brten nas bskyed do //
translated: Others are generated in dependence on their own mental continuum.

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang lha'i rna ba dang mig gi mngon par shes pa dag gi sbyor ba ni go rims bzhin du yang ba dang sgra dang snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang lha'i rna ba dang mig gi mngon par shes pa dag gi sbyor ba ni go rims bzhin du yang ba dang sgra dang snang ba yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The application of the superknowledges, etc. The application of the superknowledge of supernatural power and the superknowledge of divine ear and eye are, respectively, the mental attentions of lightness, sound, and form.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi sbyor ba ni yang ba nyid yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi sbyor ba ni yang ba nyid yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the superknowledge of supernatural power is the mental attention of lightness.

original: lha'i rna ba'i sbyor ba ni sgra yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i sbyor ba ni sgra yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the superknowledge of divine ear is the mental attention of sound.

original: lha'i mig gi sbyor ba ni snang ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig gi sbyor ba ni snang ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The application of the superknowledge of divine eye is the mental attention of form.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed pa'i sbyor ba yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed pa'i sbyor ba yang mi brjod do //
translated: The application of the superknowledge of the destruction of the contaminants is not mentioned because it is not necessary to generate it through application.

original: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ces bya ba ni 'thob pa rnyed pa'i dbang du byas nas dris pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar 'thob ces bya ba ni 'thob pa rnyed pa'i dbang du byas nas dris pa ste /
translated: How are they obtained? This question is asked from the point of view of the obtainment of acquisition.

original: mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni 'dris pa'am ma 'dris pa 'ang rung ste sbyor ba kho nas yin no //🔽ma 'dris pa rnams ni sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni bye brag can mngon par ma bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur ba ni 'dris pa'am ma 'dris pa 'ang rung ste sbyor ba kho nas yin no // ma 'dris pa rnams ni sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni bye brag can mngon par ma bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The direct realization of the truths is by practice alone, whether one is familiar or unfamiliar with the truths.🔽Those who are unfamiliar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.

original: thams cad kyang sbyor bas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sbyor bas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa'o //
translated: Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag dang srid pa tha ma pa dang so so skye bo rnams 'dris pa dang ma @336b 'dris pas dmigs pa dang khyad par can rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag dang srid pa tha ma pa dang so so skye bo rnams 'dris pa dang ma @336b 'dris pas dmigs pa dang khyad par can rnams so //
translated: Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.

original: so so skye bo rnams ni 'dris pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: so so skye bo rnams ni 'dris pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.

original: yang mngon par shes pa ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yang mngon par shes pa ni gang zhig yin /
translated: Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni du zhe na thams cad shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni du zhe na thams cad shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.

original: mngon par shes pas na mngon par shes pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon par shes pas na mngon par shes pa'o ;
translated: Those who are not familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone.🔽Those who are familiar with the truths realize them by practice alone

original: / de bzhin du thams cad chos dran pa nye par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du thams cad chos dran pa nye par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Likewise, all are the application of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: 'ga' zhig tu rna ba dang mig dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin du rig par bya zhing shes rab gsum gyi rang bzhin du sems so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rna ba dang mig dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin du rig par bya zhing shes rab gsum gyi rang bzhin du sems so //
translated: In some places, it should be known as having the nature of the ear, eye, and form, and as having the nature of the three wisdoms.

original: de dag las gnyis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gsum ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las gnyis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gsum ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Among them, two are the application of mindfulness to the body, and three are the application of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: lhan cig dmigs pas brjod pa gsum pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum rnams so //
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pas brjod pa gsum pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum rnams so //
translated: The third, which is expressed as co-observation, is the three applications of mindfulness.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i rim pas gsum pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i rim pas gsum pa ni sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: The third in the order of the verses is the superknowledge of the categories of mind,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it observes mind and mental factors.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma yin te de ni lus la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma yin te de ni lus la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is not the application of mindfulness to the body, because that observes the body.

original: sgra ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir des dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni sgra ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir des dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Except for sound, it is said that sound is not observed by it, because it is interrupted.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mig gi mngon par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa yin na ;
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mig gi mngon par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa yin na ;
translated: If the higher perception of the eye focuses on form,

original: lha'i mig gis ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang legs par spyad pa'am de dang ldan pa gzugs kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang legs par spyad pa'am de dang ldan pa gzugs kyi skye mched kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa ji ltar shes she na /
translated: then how does the divine eye know speech and mental negative and positive action and those possessing that, which are not the nature of the form base?

original: 'di'i lam gyi phyir de ni des mi shes kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i lam gyi phyir de ni des mi shes kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Because it is the path of that, it does not know that.

original: mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i phyir de yang da'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i 'khor du gyur pa'i phyir de yang da'i sgras brjod do //
translated: That is also called that because it is a retinue of higher perception.

original: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //🔽re zhig sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa'o // re zhig sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: The remainder are the higher perceptions of recalling past lives and the elimination of contaminants.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bdag nyid yin la rag mod /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i bdag nyid yin la rag mod /
translated: First, recalling past lives is definitely the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness since it focuses on form, mind and mental factors.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa ni ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon par shes pa ni ji ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The superknowledge of the extinction of contaminants is the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it focuses on cessation.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyogs yin na ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyogs yin na ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na yin la /
translated: If it focuses on the aspect of cessation, it is the establishment of mindfulness of phenomena alone.

original: zag pa zad pa'i rgyud kyi phyogs yin na ni @337a * //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i rgyud kyi phyogs yin na ni @337a * //
translated: If it focuses on the aspect of the mindstream that has exhausted contaminants,🔽it is the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: de dag dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni /
analyzed: de dag dge ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas ni /
translated: They are classified as virtuous and so on.

original: kha cig ni thams cad dge ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni thams cad dge ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: All are virtuous.

original: 'di ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa ste /
translated: This is definite:

original: mig dang rna ba'i mngon shes ni //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i mngon shes ni //
translated: The higher perceptions of eye and ear

original: lung du ma bstan lhag rnams dge / zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan lhag rnams dge / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are neutral. The rest are virtuous.

original: gal te mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab yin na /
translated: If they are wisdom concomitant with eye consciousness and ear consciousness,

original: 'o na ji ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par grub /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par grub /
translated: how are they established as belonging to the level of the fourth absorption?

original: mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dag ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa med do //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dag ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa med do //
translated: The wisdoms concomitant with eye and ear consciousness do not exist on the second absorption and so on.

original: rten gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The Autocommentary states:

original: lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi dag na zhes pa der /
analyzed: lnga ni bsam gtan bzhi dag na zhes pa der /
translated: The five are on the four absorptions.

original: rten gyi dbang gis brten pa mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par bshad do //
analyzed: rten gyi dbang gis brten pa mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa par bshad do //
translated: The higher perception of the eye and ear are explained as being on the level of the fourth absorption due to the power of their basis.

original: de'i rten zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa'i rten no //
analyzed: de'i rten zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa'i rten no //
translated: The basis of that is the basis of higher perception.🔽Or they are due to the power of the uninterrupted path.

original: yang na bar chad med pa'i lam gyi dbang gis so zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bskyed pa'i bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bar chad med pa'i lam gyi dbang gis so zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bskyed pa'i bsam gtan dang po'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first absorption liberated paths generated by the uninterrupted path are also called the level of the fourth absorption.

original: de dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: They are also called the level of the fourth absorption.

original: mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid dang mngon par shes par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag rnam par grol ba'i lam nyid dang mngon par shes par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that the eye and ear consciousnesses are the path of liberation and higher perception.

original: kha cig na re rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni lta ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni lta ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is not view because it is the nature of the path of liberation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po rnams su shes rab la khyad par yod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po rnams su shes rab la khyad par yod de /
translated: Wisdom is distinguished in the four absorptions.

original: rang gi sa pa'i 'bras bu mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i 'bras bu mngon du gyur pa gang yin pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa ste /
translated: That which manifests the result of its level is the result of its level.

original: mig dang rna ba dag gi rten yin no //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag gi rten yin no //
translated: It is the basis of the eye and ear consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni mngon par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni mngon par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore wisdom concomitant with consciousness is not higher perception.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa dge ba yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa dge ba yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin la /
translated: The dominant is the dominant, because supernatural power and so on are virtuous.

original: de la yod pa'i brten pa ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i brten pa ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: That which exists in that is dominant.

original: phal che ba zhes bya ba ni med pas byas pa ni phal che ba ste /
analyzed: phal che ba zhes bya ba ni med pas byas pa ni phal che ba ste /
translated: The majority is the majority, because it is made of nonexistence.

original: dge ba bzhi ni mang ba yin la /
analyzed: dge ba bzhi ni mang ba yin la /
translated: The four wholesome ones are more numerous.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni gnyis yin pas so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni gnyis yin pas so //
translated: The two indeterminate ones are less numerous.

original: shes pa mngon sum du bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas shes @337b pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du shes pa zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa mngon sum du bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas shes @337b pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du shes pa zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The direct realization of knowledge is to be applied to each of the following: the direct realization of the knowledge of former abodes, the direct realization of the knowledge of death and rebirth, and the direct realization of the knowledge of the destruction of defilements.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni lha'i rna ba dang mig dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams so ;
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni lha'i rna ba dang mig dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams so ;
translated: The others are not, meaning the supernormal knowledge of the divine ear, the divine eye, and the knowledge of others' minds.

original: / go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: / go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: In order, the recollection of former abodes

original: sngon gyi mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: reverses delusion regarding the past.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pas ni bar la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pas ni bar la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: The knowledge of death and rebirth reverses delusion regarding the present.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pas ni 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes phyi ma'i mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pas ni 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes phyi ma'i mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa sel bar byed do //
translated: By the superknowledge of the destruction of the taints, one does not know any other existence beyond this one.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i mngon par shes pas ni phyi ma'i mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i mngon par shes pas ni phyi ma'i mtha' la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do //
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says: The superknowledge of death and rebirth eliminates confusion about the future.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni bar la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni bar la kun tu rmongs pa zlog par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The superknowledge of the destruction of the taints eliminates confusion about the present.

original: yang mngon par shes pa gsum kho na rigs gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: yang mngon par shes pa gsum kho na rigs gsum yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: Again, only three superknowledges are of three types. How is this known?

original: 'di ltar mi slob pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi slob pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du byed pa'i rig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said: The knowledge of the recollection of past lives of a non-learner, the knowledge of death and rebirth of a non-learner, and the knowledge of the destruction of the taints of a non-learner.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba kho na mi slob pa'i rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyud kyis kyang yin no //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon du bya ba kho na mi slob pa'i rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang rgyud kyis kyang yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of one beyond training.🔽The others are of the nature of one beyond training and also of the lineage of one beyond training.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyud kyi sgo nas yin gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te /🔽de nyid kyi phyir de gnyis ni slob pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyud kyi sgo nas yin gyi rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te / de nyid kyi phyir de gnyis ni slob pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The others are of the lineage of one beyond training, but not of the nature of one beyond training.

original: mi slob pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this very reason, they are neither in training nor beyond training, because they are associated with the cankers.

original: mngon par shes pa 'di dag zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa 'di dag zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: These superknowledges, i.e., the superknowledge of the cognition of former abodes and existences and the superknowledge of the cognition of death and rebirth,

original: slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'o //
translated: of the one in training, i.e., of the non-returner,

original: yang ma rig pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni langs par gyur pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ma rig pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni langs par gyur pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are dominated by ignorance, i.e., by the ignorance that should be abandoned by cultivation, when they are in the state of arising.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyis mngon par shes pa ni rdzu @338a * //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyis mngon par shes pa ni rdzu @338a * //
translated: As stated, respectively.🔽🔽The superknowledge of supernatural power is the basis of the others.🔽

original: 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: As the case may be means: the superknowledge of supernatural power is the miracle of supernatural power.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa ni kun rdzob brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa ni kun rdzob brjod pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind is the miracle of reading the thoughts of others.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yin no //🔽pra dang aa ti'i sgra dag po'o las dang shin tu'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ni rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yin no // pra dang aa ti'i sgra dag po'o las dang shin tu'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The superknowledge of the destruction of the impure influences is the miracle of instruction.

original: pra'i sgra ni dang po'i las kyi don te 'di dang 'dis las dang por rtsom zhes bya ba lta bu'o //🔽aa ti'i sgra ni shin tu'i don to //
analyzed: pra'i sgra ni dang po'i las kyi don te 'di dang 'dis las dang por rtsom zhes bya ba lta bu'o // aa ti'i sgra ni shin tu'i don to //
translated: The superknowledge of supernatural power is the first, and the superknowledge of the destruction of the impure influences is the last.

original: shin tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind is the middle one.

original: dang po nas shin tu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po nas shin tu zhes bya ste /
translated: The superknowledge of supernatural power is the first, because it is the first to be produced.🔽The superknowledge of the destruction of the impure influences is the last, because it is the last to be produced.🔽The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind is the middle one, because it is the middle one to be produced.

original: pra'i sgra'i don ni dang po nas ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pra'i sgra'i don ni dang po nas ni zhes bya'o //
translated: The superknowledge of supernatural power is the first, because it is the first to be produced.🔽The superknowledge of the destruction of the impure influences is the last, because it is the last to be produced.

original: aa ti'i sgra'i don ni shin tu'i don to //
analyzed: aa ti'i sgra'i don ni shin tu'i don to //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the categories of mind is the middle one, because it is the middle one to be produced.

original: zhes 'gras pa dang bar mar gnas pa rnams kyis yid 'phrog par byed pas zhes 'byung ste nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis cho 'phrul zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes 'gras pa dang bar mar gnas pa rnams kyis yid 'phrog par byed pas zhes 'byung ste nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis cho 'phrul zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The term “miracle” is applied by the method of derivation, since it is said that the Buddha’s miracles captivate the minds of those who are hostile and those who are neutral.🔽The Buddha’s miracles are not shared in common with others, because they are unerring and unique.

original: mi 'phrul phyir dang zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dag ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la yang srid kyi /
analyzed: mi 'phrul phyir dang zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa dag ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams la yang srid kyi /
translated: Miracles, clairvoyance, and recollection are possible for non Buddhists,

original: zag pa zad pa zhes pa ni ma yin te mi 'khrul ba dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa zhes pa ni ma yin te mi 'khrul ba dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the extinction of the contaminants is not, because it is unerring and unique.

original: rdzu 'phrul sman dang gsang sngags dag gis kyang 'grub ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul sman dang gsang sngags dag gis kyang 'grub ste /
translated: Miracles are accomplished by spells, herbs, and so on.

original: g'a na h'a r'i zhes bya ba'i rig sngags gang gis nam mkha' la 'gro ba yod cing /
analyzed: g'a na h'a r'i zhes bya ba'i rig sngags gang gis nam mkha' la 'gro ba yod cing /
translated: There is a spell called ganahara, by which one can fly through the sky.

original: sman gyi khyad par lag pa dang rkang pa la bskus pa gang gis nam mkha' la 'gro bar yod par grag go //
analyzed: sman gyi khyad par lag pa dang rkang pa la bskus pa gang gis nam mkha' la 'gro bar yod par grag go //
translated: There is a special herb that, when applied to the hands and feet, enables one to walk on water.

original: gzhan gyi sems kun brjod pa yang mtshan ma dang gsang sngags la sogs pa dag gis byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kun brjod pa yang mtshan ma dang gsang sngags la sogs pa dag gis byed do //
translated: Clairvoyance is also accomplished by means of signs, spells, and so on.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su ston pa ni rnam pa gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas mi 'khrul ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su ston pa ni rnam pa gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas mi 'khrul ba nyid yin te /
translated: The teaching of reality just as it is cannot be otherwise, and thus it is nondeceptive.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su ston pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin 'doms pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi ting nge 'dzin te de'i 'bras bu ni cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rjes su ston pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin 'doms pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi ting nge 'dzin te de'i 'bras bu ni cho 'phrul lo //
translated: The concentration of miracles is the teaching of reality just as it is and the instruction in reality just as it is, and its result is the miracle.🔽A sūtra explains:

original: mdo las rags pa dang phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mdo las rags pa dang phra ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it enters the gross and subtle, it is a miracle.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang des chos nye ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'doms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang des chos nye ba'i rgyur gyur pa 'doms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is concentration and the cause of the Dharma because it instructs.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nges pa'i tshig las 'dis 'byor par byed pas rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nges pa'i tshig las 'dis 'byor par byed pas rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: Therefore, in etymological explanations, it is said that it is a miracle because it causes mastery.

original: 'byor bar byed pa ni sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byor bar byed pa ni sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Mastery is a synonym for accomplishment.

original: yid bzhin du mgyogs pas na zhes bya ba ni yid kyis 'gro ba dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin du mgyogs pas na zhes bya ba ni yid kyis 'gro ba dmigs pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It is swift as one wishes because it is the apprehension of the object of the mind that goes as one wishes.

original: dus de tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nas bzhed pa'i yul 'og @338b min du byon te /
analyzed: dus de tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di nas bzhed pa'i yul 'og @338b min du byon te /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavat went to the Akanistha heaven, the realm intended here.

original: thub pa'i nyan thos la ni yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: thub pa'i nyan thos la ni yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since this is not the case for the disciples of the Sage,

original: yid mgyogs ni sangs rgyas rnams kho na yin no //
analyzed: yid mgyogs ni sangs rgyas rnams kho na yin no //
translated: only the Buddhas have the swiftness of thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat, etc.

original: rnam par ma chad pas ming der 'gro bar bya 'am rnam pa gzhan zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par ma chad pas ming der 'gro bar bya 'am rnam pa gzhan zhe na /
translated: Does it go to that name without being interrupted, or in some other way?

original: der nye bar chad pa 'byung bas 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: der nye bar chad pa 'byung bas 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It goes there without being interrupted, because it is the nature of going.

original: yul shin tu thag ring ba yang thugs bskyed pa tsam gyis gshegs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: yul shin tu thag ring ba yang thugs bskyed pa tsam gyis gshegs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: Since he goes to a very distant place merely by generating the thought, the Bhagavat Buddha has inconceivable power.

original: mos pa las byung ba ni mos pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba ni mos pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Arisen from resolve is the result of resolve.

original: myur du 'gro ba ni lus phyin par byed pas so //
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba ni lus phyin par byed pas so //
translated: Swiftness of movement is the movement of the body.

original: mos pa las byung ba ni thag ring ba la nye bar mos pa gang yin pa las te /
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba ni thag ring ba la nye bar mos pa gang yin pa las te /
translated: Arisen from resolve is that which is arisen from the resolve to go to a very distant place.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs so //🔽sprul pa ni rnam pa gnyis te 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs so // sprul pa ni rnam pa gnyis te 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “The object of the concentration of the contemplatives is inconceivable.”🔽Emanation is of two kinds:🔽in the realm of desire and in the realm of form.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa med pa ste /
translated: There is none in the formless realm,

original: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no form there.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /🔽phyi'i zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched ni sprul par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni / phyi'i zhes bya ba ni nang gi skye mched ni sprul par mi byed de /
translated: Emanation belonging to the realm of desire🔽is external.

original: sngon med pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i sems 'byung bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: It does not emanate internal sense bases, because it would follow that a non-existent mind would arise.

original: sgra'i sprul pa ni yod pa ma yin te rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i sprul pa ni yod pa ma yin te rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no emanation of sound, because it is interrupted.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel par zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel par zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus dang 'brel ba dang / gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is related to one’s own and others’ bodies.

original: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams na rang dang gzhan dag gi lus dang 'brel ba de bzhin du gzugs su gtogs pa yang bdag gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams na rang dang gzhan dag gi lus dang 'brel ba de bzhin du gzugs su gtogs pa yang bdag gi lus dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Similarly, in the form realm, there are two types of emanations, those related to one's own body and those related to another's body.🔽These are the four types of emanations.

original: 'di ni sprul pa rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sprul pa rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i'o //
translated: Those born in the desire realm have four types of emanations.

original: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i yang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i yang /
translated: Those born in the form realm have four types of emanations.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa rang gi lus dang 'brel ba dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa rang gi lus dang 'brel ba dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Those born in the desire realm have two types of emanations, those related to one's own body and those related to another's body.🔽Those born in the form realm have two types of emanations, those related to one's own body and those related to another's body.

original: rnam pa brgyad yin no zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa brgyad yin no //🔽mdor @339a * //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad yin no zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa brgyad yin no //🔽mdor @339a * //
translated: In brief, there are eight types of emanations.

original: bsdus na zhes bya ba rgyas par ni mtha' yas so //🔽ji ltar dri dang ro dang mi ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa skye mched kho na sprul par byed na /🔽ji ltar rang gi lus dang 'brel bar sprul pa dri dang ro dag dang mi ldan zhes bya'o //🔽gos dang rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni dper na sems can du mi grangs pa'i phyir gos dang rgyan rang gi lus dang 'brel pa dag dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du sprul pa dang yang yin no //
analyzed: bsdus na zhes bya ba rgyas par ni mtha' yas so // ji ltar dri dang ro dang mi ldan zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa skye mched kho na sprul par byed na / ji ltar rang gi lus dang 'brel bar sprul pa dri dang ro dag dang mi ldan zhes bya'o // gos dang rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni dper na sems can du mi grangs pa'i phyir gos dang rgyan rang gi lus dang 'brel pa dag dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du sprul pa dang yang yin no //
translated: If it is asked, “How many are there in detail?” the answer is “in detail, they are limitless.”

original: gzhan dag na skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus 'brel pa gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched kho na sprul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus 'brel pa gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched kho na sprul par byed pa'o //

original: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa ni skye mched bzhi yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa ni skye mched bzhi yin no //

original: 'di la skyon med de 'gro ba'i khyad par gyi skye gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la skyon med de 'gro ba'i khyad par gyi skye gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no error here, because the term “birth existence” is a particular kind of going.

original: 'gro ba ni 'dir 'gro bar byed pa la mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'dir 'gro bar byed pa la mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, going is asserted to be the act of going.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pas ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pas ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus la /
translated: A magical emanation that is the result of the first absorption is not able to go to the level of the second absorption.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu sprul pas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sar 'gro bar mi nus so //
translated: Similarly, a magical emanation that is the result of the second absorption is not able to go to the level of the third absorption, and a magical emanation that is the result of the third absorption is not able to go to the level of the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pa 'dod pa na spyod pa gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pa gzugs na spyod pa gang yin pa de dag 'gros kyi sgo nas khyad par yod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pa 'dod pa na spyod pa gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu sprul pa gzugs na spyod pa gang yin pa de dag 'gros kyi sgo nas khyad par yod de /
translated: A magical emanation that is the result of the first absorption and that experiences the desire realm and a magical emanation that is the result of the first absorption and that experiences the form realm differ in terms of their mode of going.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa las khams kyi sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa las khams kyi sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: The one that experiences the form realm is superior to the one that experiences the desire realm in terms of realm.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: de rnyed bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnyed bsam gtan bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attainment of the meditative development of the four investigations is due to the attainment of the four meditative states.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan rnyed ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan rnyed ce na //
translated: How is the meditative development of the four meditative states attained?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang skye ba dang sbyor ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang skye ba dang sbyor ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is attained through the absence of attachment, through birth and through application.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni gang zhig sa gang la thob pa'o //🔽de'i 'bras bu rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems rnams thob po //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni gang zhig sa gang la thob pa'o // de'i 'bras bu rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems rnams thob po //
translated: Through the absence of attachment, i.e. one who has attained a particular meditative state through the absence of attachment to the lower realm.🔽The meditative development of the four meditative states is also attained through the attainment of the mind of the realm of sensuality that is conducive to the attainment of the first meditative state.

original: sa gong ma nas 'chi 'phos pa bsam gtan rnams su skyes pas bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems rnams 'thob po //
analyzed: sa gong ma nas 'chi 'phos pa bsam gtan rnams su skyes pas bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems rnams 'thob po //
translated: The meditative development of the four meditative states is also attained through the attainment of the mind of emanation that is the fruit of the meditative states, i.e. one who has been born in the meditative states from the higher realms.

original: gang dang gang bsam gtan la brten pa dang de la rag las te yon tan skyed par byed pa ni @339b thams cad du de'i 'bras bu rnams 'thob po //
analyzed: gang dang gang bsam gtan la brten pa dang de la rag las te yon tan skyed par byed pa ni @339b thams cad du de'i 'bras bu rnams 'thob po //
translated: The meditative development of the four meditative states is also attained through the attainment of all the virtues that are dependent on the meditative states and that are generated through the meditative states.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa dgra bcom pa thob pa ni mi g-yo bar rtogs pa thams cad thob pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa las dgra bcom pa thob pa thob pa'i bar thams cad de'i 'bras bu rnams 'thob pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa dgra bcom pa thob pa ni mi g-yo bar rtogs pa thams cad thob pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa las dgra bcom pa thob pa thob pa'i bar thams cad de'i 'bras bu rnams 'thob pa nyid de /
translated: All arhats who obtain the state of an arhat in the desire realm obtain the result of that state, from the state of understanding that is immutable up to the state of an arhat who obtains that state from the fourth absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “who abide in the result of meditative absorption” means

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ni sprul pa'i sems te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ni sprul pa'i sems te /
translated: the following. The result of meditative absorption is the mind that creates emanations.

original: kha cig na re rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is the result of the path of liberation because it is the nature of the path of liberation.

original: gzhan dag na re mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te rnam par grol ba'i lam ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te rnam par grol ba'i lam ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is the result of the superknowledge of the creation of emanations because it is not the path of liberation.

original: bar chad med pa'i dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag de'i don nyid la bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag de'i don nyid la bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The uninterrupted path and the path of liberation are the result of meditative absorption because they are the cause of that result.

original: gang gi tshe smra ba'i sems yod pa de'i tshe sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe smra ba'i sems yod pa de'i tshe sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When the mind that creates emanations exists, the mind that speaks does not exist.

original: sprul pa'i sems 'gags shing smrar 'jug pa'i sems skye na sprul pa'i sems 'gags pas sprul pa'i gnas skabs mi gnas te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems 'gags shing smrar 'jug pa'i sems skye na sprul pa'i sems 'gags pas sprul pa'i gnas skabs mi gnas te /
translated: If the mind that is the basis of magical emanation ceases and the mind that is the basis of speech arises, then the mind that is the basis of magical emanation ceases and the state of magical emanation does not endure,

original: sems gnyis cig car med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems gnyis cig car med pa'i phyir //
translated: because two minds do not occur simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar smrar 'jug ce na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar smrar 'jug ce na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can one speak through a magical creation?

original: 'di smra ba skye ba yin te 'gags pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di smra ba skye ba yin te 'gags pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The mind that is the basis of speech arises and the mind that is the basis of magical emanation ceases.

original: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sems kyis sprul par byed do //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir // zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sems kyis sprul par byed do //
