original: phyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems mngon du gyur te smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: phyis rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems mngon du gyur te smrar 'jug go //
translated: One causes another to speak through the power of a previous resolution.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems mngon du gyur na sprul pa'i sems mi snang bar gyur pas sprul pa mi snang bar ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /🔽byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems mngon du gyur na sprul pa'i sems mi snang bar gyur pas sprul pa mi snang bar ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: One causes another

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: We must respond to this.

original: sngon gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rjes su 'brang ste sprul pa sprul par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rjes su 'brang ste sprul pa sprul par bya'o //
translated: The emanator emanates the emanation following the stream of prior intention.

original: de'i byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: He blesses it.

original: de smrar gzhug go snyam du de ltar sngar sems la bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de smrar gzhug go snyam du de ltar sngar sems la bzhag pa yin no //
translated: He causes it to speak.

original: 'o na gang 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i sprul pa'i bya ba la 'jug par byed ce na des ji ltar skal ba mnyam pa'i khams su gnas pa'i spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dag mngon du @340a * //
analyzed: 'o na gang 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i sprul pa'i bya ba la 'jug par byed ce na des ji ltar skal ba mnyam pa'i khams su gnas pa'i spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dag mngon du @340a * //
translated: Now, if one born in the desire realm enters the activity of emanation of the second absorption level, how does he manifest the behavior and arts of the level of the desire realm?

original: byed par mi nus she na /
analyzed: byed par mi nus she na /
translated: He cannot manifest them, just as he cannot manifest the behavior and arts of the level of the second absorption and so on.

original: de dag der mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi rten la rag lus pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de dag der mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyi rten la rag lus pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error, because those are manifested in dependence on the basis of equipoise.

original: de'i khams kyi 'byung ba rnams kho na las de mngon du byed pa'i phyir de dag gis gzugs spyod pa'i 'byung ba rnams gcig tu mkhregs par byas pa'i rten de nas rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas slong bas mngon du byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i khams kyi 'byung ba rnams kho na las de mngon du byed pa'i phyir de dag gis gzugs spyod pa'i 'byung ba rnams gcig tu mkhregs par byas pa'i rten de nas rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas slong bas mngon du byed pa yin pas /
translated: Because it manifests from the primary elements of its own realm alone, it manifests from the basis that is made solid by the primary elements of the form realm through the motivation of informative form.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa de mngon du byed par thal ba med do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa de mngon du byed par thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore it is not the case that it is illogical that meditative attainment manifests in dependence on the basis of absorption.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i rten la rag las pa la yang rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas slong ba yod pas lha'i mig dang rna ba dag rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni skyon med do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i rten la rag las pa la yang rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas slong ba yod pas lha'i mig dang rna ba dag rnam par shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni skyon med do //
translated: Also, since the divine eye and ear are motivated by the mind of absorption, it is not illogical that they manifest in dependence on the basis of absorption.

original: dang por du mas gcig yin te //
analyzed: dang por du mas gcig yin te //
translated: The first is one by many.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //🔽bsgrubs na ni sprul pa'i sems mang pos sprul ba nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gcig sprul par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // bsgrubs na ni sprul pa'i sems mang pos sprul ba nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gcig sprul par byed la /
translated: This is the extensive explanation.🔽If one cultivates the ability to emanate, then many emanating minds emanate one single emanation that possesses appropriated aggregates.

original: mngon par shes pa byas nas ni sems gcig gis du ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa byas nas ni sems gcig gis du ma yin no //
translated: But if one has already perfected the higher perception of emanation, then one emanation is emanated by one mind.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang // skyes pas thob pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin pas 'dri ba ni yang ci sprul pa'i sems thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang // skyes pas thob pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin pas 'dri ba ni yang ci sprul pa'i sems thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The question is asked: “Are all emanation minds…”

original: bsgom las skyes pa lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba la sa gong mar skyes pas sa 'og ma pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'i phyir de dang ldan par lung du ma bstan pa dang des byas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bsgom las skyes pa lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba la sa gong mar skyes pas sa 'og ma pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'i phyir de dang ldan par lung du ma bstan pa dang des byas pa yang ngo //
translated: The result of meditation is neutral. One who is born in a higher level manifests an emanation mind of a lower level. Therefore, it is neutral and it is also created by that.

original: lhag la sogs pas byas pa ni skye bas byas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag la sogs pas byas pa ni skye bas byas pa'o //
translated: That created by the remaining three is created by birth.

original: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
translated: That created by birth is of three types.

original: zhes bya ba ni yi dags la sogs pa dag ni res 'ga' gzhan la mtho btsams pa'i phyir gzugs sprul par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yi dags la sogs pa dag ni res 'ga' gzhan la mtho btsams pa'i phyir gzugs sprul par byed la /
translated: Pretas and so on sometimes emanate form in order to harm others,

original: res 'ga' phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / res 'ga' lung ma bstan nyid do //
analyzed: res 'ga' phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / res 'ga' lung ma bstan nyid do //
translated: sometimes in order to benefit others, and sometimes they are neutral.

original: sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are formless bases that are not sound.

original: sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched rnams ni 'dir sgra med pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched rnams de'i ngo bo ni sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched nyid do //
analyzed: sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched rnams ni 'dir sgra med pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched rnams de'i ngo bo ni sgra med pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched nyid do //
translated: The form sense spheres that are not sound are the form sense spheres that are not sound.

original: gang gi phyir der rang dang gzhan gyi lus sprul pa la sgra ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa skye mched gzugs can thams cad yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir der rang dang gzhan gyi lus sprul pa la sgra ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa skye mched gzugs can thams cad yod do //
translated: Because in that realm, all the physical sense spheres, except for sound, exist in the emanations of one’s own body and others’ bodies.

original: de'i phyir skye mched dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched dgu pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there are nine sense spheres.

original: sgra la rgyun med @340b pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed la /
analyzed: sgra la rgyun med @340b pa'i phyir sprul par mi byed la /
translated: Sound is not emanated because it has no continuum.

original: sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag kyang sprul par mi byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems med pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag kyang sprul par mi byed do //
translated: The mental faculty and the entity sense sphere are not emanated because there is no mind of emanation.

original: bstan bcos las sgrub pa sems par bcas pa zhes brjod par bya ba'am sems med pa zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: bstan bcos las sgrub pa sems par bcas pa zhes brjod par bya ba'am sems med pa zhes brjod par bya /
translated: In the treatise, should it be said that the establishment of emanation is with mind or without mind?

original: smras pa sems med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa sems med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is without mind.

original: gal te dbang po dag kyang sprul par byed na ni dbang po rnams sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po dag kyang sprul par byed na ni dbang po rnams sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the faculties are also emanated, then since the faculties are counted as sentient beings, how could a sentient being who did not previously exist come to arise?

original: de'i phyir dbang po rnams dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po rnams dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, because they are not different from the faculties.

original: sprul pa skye mched bzhi pa de ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par skyes pa ste rang gi lus dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa skye mched bzhi pa de ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par skyes pa ste rang gi lus dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That emanation possessing four sense bases is not different from the eye faculty and so on because it is related to its own body.

original: de'i phyir skye mched dgu par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched dgu par bshad do //
translated: Therefore it is explained as possessing nine bases.

original: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The faculties are not emanated.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they arise from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: sprul pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: sprul pa ni rnam par smin pa dang rgyas pa las byung bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that emanations arise from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: dper na nga las nu dang srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul ston pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nga las nu dang srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni las las skyes pa'i rdzu 'phrul ston pa'o //
translated: This shows the supernormal knowledge arisen from karma.🔽Like the Bodhisattva, the wheel-turning king, and the precious householder.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'khor los sgyur ba dang khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bur zhes bya ba la de dag gi ni lha dang 'dra bas lha'i yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'khor los sgyur ba dang khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi lta bur zhes bya ba la de dag gi ni lha dang 'dra bas lha'i yin no //
translated: Their divine eye is like that of the gods, but not like the eye of the lord of the gods.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ni bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang ba yin pa de'i phyir de dag ni lha'i kho na yin gyi lha'i dbang 'dra ba'i lha ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ni bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang ba yin pa de'i phyir de dag ni lha'i kho na yin gyi lha'i dbang 'dra ba'i lha ni ma yin no //
translated: Because those two are the clear form of the absorption stage, they are only divine, not like the eye of the lord of the gods.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lha'i mig ni sha dang pags pa dang rus pa dang khrag dang ma 'brel zhing gzugs dang pa'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lha'i mig ni sha dang pags pa dang rus pa dang khrag dang ma 'brel zhing gzugs dang pa'o zhes brjod do //
translated: For that very reason, the divine eye is said to be unattached to form, flesh, skin, bones, and blood.🔽The divine eye and ear are not similar to those.

original: lha'i mig gam rna ba ni de dang mtshungs pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dag lta ba dang nyan pa'i sgo nas mngon par bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gam rna ba ni de dang mtshungs pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dag lta ba dang nyan pa'i sgo nas mngon par bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: They are accomplished through seeing and hearing.

original: de'i phyir rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is always associated with consciousness.

original: zhar ba dang long ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhar ba dang long ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no one-eyed or blind person, etc.

original: zhar ba ni gang rung cig ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: zhar ba ni gang rung cig ma tshang ba'o //
translated: One-eyed means incomplete in one eye.

original: long ba ni yo ba'o //
analyzed: long ba ni yo ba'o //
translated: Blind means crooked.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four, divine ear, etc., are also obtained from birth.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha'i mig dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsdu ste /
translated: The word “etc.” includes divine eye, recollection of past lives, and knowledge of the minds of others.

original: 'di dag thams cad skyes nas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad skyes nas thob pa yin no //
translated: All of these are obtained from birth.

original: @341a * // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang klu rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: @341a * // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang klu rnams dang / gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: They belong to gods and nāgas active in the desire realm, and to those active in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not belong to those active in the formless realm,

original: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no form there.

original: 'gro ba'ang sprul pa med pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul med do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'ang sprul pa med pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul med do //
translated: Miraculous powers do not exist there because emanations do not exist there.

original: de nyid kyi lha'i mig dang rna ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi lha'i mig dang rna ba med do //
translated: Divine eye and divine ear also do not exist there.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa med do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa med do //
translated: Because it does not fully comprehend the mindstreams of others, it does not comprehend the minds of others.🔽

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa yang med do //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa yang med do //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another does not exist there, because the mental stream of the gods of the second meditation is not susceptible to being cut off, and because the knowledge of the mind of another is the knowledge of the mind of another in a lower stage.

original: rigs dang rus dang kha dog dang gnas dang zas la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs dang rus dang kha dog dang gnas dang zas la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The recollection of former abodes or existences does not exist there, because there is no caste, family, color, food, etc.

original: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can bzhin mngon par shes pa thams cad kyang de na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can bzhin mngon par shes pa thams cad kyang de na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Or else, as in the case of the sentient beings of the realm of desire, all the superknowledges are absent there.

original: de lta bu'i lus kun tu 'gro ba'i phyir lha'i mig thams cad lung ma bstan nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus kun tu 'gro ba'i phyir lha'i mig thams cad lung ma bstan nyid do //
translated: The divine eye is neutral, because the body is not susceptible to being directed.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa skye bas thob pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa skye bas thob pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another, when it is innate, is wholesome, unwholesome, or neutral.

original: gang rtog dang rig sngags kyis byas pa 'ang zhes bya ba de yang rnam pa gsum yin no //🔽de la 'dod pa'i khams kho na ni mi dge ba yod kyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rtog dang rig sngags kyis byas pa 'ang zhes bya ba de yang rnam pa gsum yin no //🔽de la 'dod pa'i khams kho na ni mi dge ba yod kyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another, when it is produced through a formula or a spell, is of the stage of the realm of desire.🔽The knowledge of the mind of another, when it is produced through meditation, is of the stage of the realm of desire or of the first meditation.🔽The knowledge of the mind of another, when it is produced through meditation, is wholesome.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin no //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is the result of meditation and is wholesome.

original: dmyal ba pas ni dang po zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba rnams kyis ni skyes tsam nyid nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas de ma thag pa'i skye ba dran gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba pas ni dang po zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba rnams kyis ni skyes tsam nyid nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pas de ma thag pa'i skye ba dran gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Hell beings remember their previous existence immediately after their birth, by means of the cognition resulting from the resolve, but not by means of the cognition resulting from meditation.

original: ji skad du de dag 'dod pa ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'jigs par lta bar gyur zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du de dag 'dod pa ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'jigs par lta bar gyur zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: As it is said: “They are afraid of future objects of desire. ”

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas kyang dang po'i kho na shes so //🔽ji srid sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa zhes bya ba la de dag ni gang gi tshe tshor ba drag po gnad thams cad 'byed par byed pa dag gis gnon pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang mi dran no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas kyang dang po'i kho na shes so // ji srid sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa zhes bya ba la de dag ni gang gi tshe tshor ba drag po gnad thams cad 'byed par byed pa dag gis gnon pa de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang mi dran no //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts also knows the first thought of the hell beings.🔽As long as they are not tormented by the sensation of suffering, they remember their previous existence.

original: sngon gyi gnas sam gzhan gyi sems shes par go ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas sam gzhan gyi sems shes par go ga la 'gyur /
translated: When they are tormented by the sensation of suffering, which rends their very bones, they no longer remember themselves, much less the previous existence or the thought of another.

original: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so zhes bya ba ni yi dgas dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha'i 'gro ba la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so zhes bya ba ni yi dgas dang dud 'gro dang mi dang lha'i 'gro ba la gnas pa ste /
translated: Beings in other destinies always know it.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa de dag gis rtag tu shes so //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa de dag gis rtag tu shes so //
translated: Beings in the destinies of ghosts, animals, humans, and gods always know it by means of the superknowledge of recollecting previous lives and the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others.

original: dung dang bya kur nga bzhin no //
analyzed: dung dang bya kur nga bzhin no //
translated: It is like the sound of a conch shell or a peacock.

original: yi dags kyis kyang shes te /
analyzed: yi dags kyis kyang shes te /
translated: Ghosts also know it.

original: ji skad du /🔽bdag gis mthun dang mi mthun @341b las ;
analyzed: ji skad du / bdag gis mthun dang mi mthun @341b las ;
translated: As it is said:🔽Whatever enjoyments I have accumulated

original: / longs spyod dag ni gang bsags pa //
analyzed: / longs spyod dag ni gang bsags pa //
translated: from agreeable and disagreeable actions

original: de dag gzhan gyi longs spyod de //
analyzed: de dag gzhan gyi longs spyod de //
translated: are the enjoyments of others.

original: kho bo cag ni sdug bsngal te //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni sdug bsngal te // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: I am suffering.

original: mi skye ba dran pa dag ni mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi skye ba dran pa dag ni mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Those who remember nonarising see it.

original: lhas kyang dran te /
analyzed: lhas kyang dran te /
translated: The gods also remember it.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The assembly of sages rely on it,

original: drang srong tshogs kyis bsten pa dang // chos kyi rgyal pos bzhugs gyur cing //
analyzed: drang srong tshogs kyis bsten pa dang // chos kyi rgyal pos bzhugs gyur cing //
translated: and the Dharma King abides in it.

original: bdag la dga' ba bskyed pa yin //
analyzed: bdag la dga' ba bskyed pa yin //
translated: It generates joy in me.

original: rgyal byed tshad de 'di yin no //
analyzed: rgyal byed tshad de 'di yin no //
translated: This is the measure of the Victorious One.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang nas shi 'phos gang du skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang nas shi 'phos gang du skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: But they do have innate supernormal knowledge, such as the superknowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of the mental command of others’ minds, and the superknowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: mi la skye bas thob pa med ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa thams cad do //🔽skye bas thob pa bdag pas 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa dang / rtogs pa dang rig sngags dang / sman dang las kyis byas pas te yod do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi la skye bas thob pa med ces bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa thams cad do // skye bas thob pa bdag pas 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa dang / rtogs pa dang rig sngags dang / sman dang las kyis byas pas te yod do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The supernormal knowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.

original: de dag gi de ni las gyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa ma yin pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir skye bas thob ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par rigs mthun par gyur pa rnams so //🔽rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi de ni las gyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa ma yin pa'o // gang gi phyir skye bas thob ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par rigs mthun par gyur pa rnams so // rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.🔽The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni bsgom ba'i 'bras bu kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni bsgom ba'i 'bras bu kho na ma yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are not innate in humans, because they are produced by the power of karma.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine

original: rdzu 'phrul bzhin du 'di dag kyang rnam pa du ma yin zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul bzhin du 'di dag kyang rnam pa du ma yin zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Just as there are many types of miracles, so too there are many types of these qualities.

original: slob dpon blo gros brtan pas nye bar bkod pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi bshad pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa don gyi de kho na nyid rnam par bshad pa las ye shes bstan ba zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon blo gros brtan pas nye bar bkod pa chos mngon pa mdzod kyi bshad pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa don gyi de kho na nyid rnam par bshad pa las ye shes bstan ba zhes bya ba ste mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the seventh chapter of the great treatise on differentiation, the explanation of the chapter on knowledge.

original: // / 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the protector of the world.

original: shes pa'i skabs kyi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa'i skabs kyi shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of the qualities of knowledge has been explained.

original: gang gi phyir zad pa shes par bshad pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i chos stobs la sogs pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang thun mong pa nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zad pa shes par bshad pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i chos stobs la sogs pa rnams dang / nyan thos dang thun mong pa nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: The knowledge of elimination is explained to be the qualities of the Buddha Bhagavans that are not shared with others, such as the strengths and so on, and the qualities that are shared with sravakas, such as the absence of conflict, knowledge through prayer, the uncontaminated aggregate of absorption and so on, and the uncontaminated aggregate of discernment, which is the uncontaminated aggregate of correct

original: so so skye bo dang thun mong pa mngon par shes pa dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams 'thob po zhes @342a * //
analyzed: so so skye bo dang thun mong pa mngon par shes pa dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnams 'thob po zhes @342a * //
translated: One obtains the common states of ordinary beings, such as the superknowledges, the dhyanas, the formless states, and so on.

original: spyir bshad la /
analyzed: spyir bshad la /
translated: This is the general explanation.

original: de dag kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin dang rang bzhin gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang shes pa'i rang bzhin dang rang bzhin gzhan yin no //
translated: But are these the nature of consciousness or something else?

original: de la shes pa'i rang bzhin stobs la sogs pa nas mngon par shes pa'i mthar thug de rnams ni shes pa'i skabs kho nas bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la shes pa'i rang bzhin stobs la sogs pa nas mngon par shes pa'i mthar thug de rnams ni shes pa'i skabs kho nas bshad zin to //
translated: The nature of consciousness, such as the powers, up to the final superknowledges, have already been explained in the chapter on consciousness.

original: de la shes pa zag bcas zag pa med ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas ni rgyas par shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas so //
analyzed: de la shes pa zag bcas zag pa med ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas ni rgyas par shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas so //
translated: The nature of consciousness, such as contaminated and uncontaminated consciousness, is explained in detail in the chapter on consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa dang 'brel pas shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams kho nar bshad kyi rang bzhin gzhan rnams ni ma yin pas da ni rang bzhin gzhan bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang tshad med pa rnams brjod par bya ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa dang 'brel pas shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi yon tan rnams kho nar bshad kyi rang bzhin gzhan rnams ni ma yin pas da ni rang bzhin gzhan bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang tshad med pa rnams brjod par bya ste zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since they are related to consciousness, only the qualities that are the nature of consciousness are explained, not those that are of a different nature. Now, the other natures, such as the dhyanas, formless states, and immeasurables, should be explained.

original: de la dang po kho nar bsam gtan rnams las brtsams te gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dang po kho nar bsam gtan rnams las brtsams te gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the concentration, because it is the principal one.

original: ji ltar gtso bo yin zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo yin zhe na //
translated: How is it the principal one?

original: de'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because it is the basis of all the qualities.”

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyang yon tan gyi rten yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyang yon tan gyi rten yin mod kyi /
translated: The formless states are also the basis of the qualities,

original: yon tan thams cad kyi rten ni ma yin pas de dag sngar ma brjod de de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi rten ni ma yin pas de dag sngar ma brjod de de'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but they are not the basis of all the qualities, so they are not mentioned first, because they arise immediately after the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan dag ni rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bsam gtan gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag ni rnam gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bsam gtan gyi dbye bas so //
translated: The concentrations are twofold, because they are divided into the concentrations that are causes and the concentrations that are results.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi bye brag gis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because of the distinction between the concentrations that are births and the concentrations that are meditative equipoise.”

original: de la skye ba'i bsam gtan ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i bsam gtan ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: Among them, the concentrations that are births are the results.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan ni rgyu'o //
translated: The concentrations that are meditative equipoise are the causes.

original: de dag kyang bzhi bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar ro zhes bya ba ni 'di dag kho nas bsam gtan rnams bsdus shing ting nge 'dzin rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang bzhi bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar ro zhes bya ba ni 'di dag kho nas bsam gtan rnams bsdus shing ting nge 'dzin rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The four are from the first meditation to the fourth meditation.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'di dag kho nas ji ltar ye shes kyi khyad par rnams sgrub par mdzad pa de ltar nyan thos dang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang mi shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'di dag kho nas ji ltar ye shes kyi khyad par rnams sgrub par mdzad pa de ltar nyan thos dang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang mi shes so //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, by means of these very meditations, accomplish the special knowledges. The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas do not even know the names of these meditations.

original: 'di ltar mdor bsdus pa las bsam gtan bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdor bsdus pa las bsam gtan bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, in brief, there are four meditations.

original: dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One-pointedness of mind is wholesome.

original: 'di ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid do //🔽sems rtse gcig pa nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yod pas dge ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan gyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid do // sems rtse gcig pa nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yod pas dge ba smos so //
translated: This is the general definition of the meditation of absorption.🔽Since there is also one-pointedness of mind that is defiled and indeterminate, the word wholesome is added.

original: dge ba g-yeng ba yang yod pas rtse gcig pa smos @342b so ;
analyzed: dge ba g-yeng ba yang yod pas rtse gcig pa smos @342b so ;
translated: Since there is also wholesome that is distracted, the word one-pointed is added.

original: / sems rtse gcig pas ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bya ba dang sems las byung ba ma smos pa ni sems gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sems rtse gcig pas ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bya ba dang sems las byung ba ma smos pa ni sems gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental factors are not mentioned because mind is primary.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan rnams la dmigs pa gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan rnams la dmigs pa gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of meditative concentration.

original: rjes 'brang bcas na phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni gal te snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan rnams kyi rang bzhin tshol na ni /
analyzed: rjes 'brang bcas na phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni gal te snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan rnams kyi rang bzhin tshol na ni /
translated: If you seek the nature of the meditative concentrations that are meditative attainments,

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pas dge ba rtse gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pas dge ba rtse gcig pa yin te /
translated: they are the nature of virtue and one-pointedness.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meditative concentrations are the nature of meditative concentration.

original: 'on te 'khor dang bcas pa brjod par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'khor dang bcas pa brjod par 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you wish to speak of them together with their retinue,

original: de'i phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: then they are the nature of five aggregates.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is form that is a concomitant.

original: 'di dag gi khyad par ji ltar ni rtogs dka' bar mtshungs pa de'i phyir sa'i dbye ba las khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar ro zhes grangs tsam gyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi khyad par ji ltar ni rtogs dka' bar mtshungs pa de'i phyir sa'i dbye ba las khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar ro zhes grangs tsam gyis bstan te /
translated: Since the distinctions among these are equally difficult to understand, the first four stages are taught by their mere enumeration in order to indicate their distinctions.

original: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bshad na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan yin te zhes bshad na /
translated: It was explained that concentration is a virtuous one-pointed mind.

original: de ni nges par ma zin pas de'i phyir rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: de ni nges par ma zin pas de'i phyir rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: Since that is not ascertained, it is asked, What is this called one-pointedness?

original: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yul gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni yul gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the state of a single object means it is the state of a single object field.

original: de lta na 'o na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag kyang dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir rtse gcig pa nyid du thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag kyang dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir rtse gcig pa nyid du thal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that eye consciousness and mental consciousness are one-pointed because they have the same object.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: de'i phyir rten gcig pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dang rtse gcig pa'i khyad par brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten gcig pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dang rtse gcig pa'i khyad par brjod par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the difference between having the same basis, the same object and being one-pointed should be stated.

original: de lta na ni'o na zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na ni'o na zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then what is the meaning of the following passage?

original: gal te rtse gcig pa nyid dmigs pa gcig yin na /
analyzed: gal te rtse gcig pa nyid dmigs pa gcig yin na /
translated: If one pointedness is a single focal object,

original: des na sems dmigs pa gcig pa ste mi g-yengs shing mnyam par gzhag pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi /
analyzed: des na sems dmigs pa gcig pa ste mi g-yengs shing mnyam par gzhag pa dag kho na ting nge 'dzin yin gyi /
translated: then only minds that are one pointed, undistracted, and in equipoise are concentrations.

original: chos gzhan sems las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gzhan sems las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Other mental factors are not concentrations.

original: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid de ni sems dag las gzhan na med de /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa nyid de ni sems dag las gzhan na med de /
translated: Because one pointedness does not exist apart from the mind.

original: sems ni g-yengs pa nyid yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: sems ni g-yengs pa nyid yin par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: It would follow that the mind would be distracted.

original: sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems rnams kho na ting nge 'dzin ma yin gyi zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The minds themselves are not concentrations.

original: sems rnams ni dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa las rang las nus pa yod pa ma yin @343a * //
analyzed: sems rnams ni dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa las rang las nus pa yod pa ma yin @343a * //
translated: The minds themselves do not have the power to engage a single focal object.

original: gyi ; gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos te ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: gyi ; gang gis de dag rtse gcig par byed pa'i chos te ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: The phenomenon that causes them to be one pointed is concentration.

original: de nyid rtse gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas de dag sems rtse gcig par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin kho nas rtse gcig pa yin gyi sems dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rtse gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas de dag sems rtse gcig par 'gyur bas ting nge 'dzin kho nas rtse gcig pa yin gyi sems dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is endowed with concentration, it is one-pointedness of mind due to concentration alone, not due to the minds.

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir sems thams cad rtse gcig pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Isn’t all mind one-pointed because it is momentary?

original: sems thams cad ni rtse gcig pa kho na yin te skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems thams cad ni rtse gcig pa kho na yin te skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa gzhan la 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All minds are one-pointed because they are momentary, since they do not shift to another object.

original: de'i phyir sems la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rtog pa don med de ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sems la ting nge 'dzin yongs su rtog pa don med de ;
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to imagine that mind is concentration.

original: dge ba'i sems thams cad mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems thams cad mnyam par gzhag pa nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that all virtuous minds are equipoise.

original: gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyis pa de las rnam par mi g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that the second is nondistraction from that,

original: sems gnyis pa ni sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng bas nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems gnyis pa ni sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng bas nyes pa 'di med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second mind is not defective, because it is not distracted from the object of the first mind by the power of concentration associated with the first mind.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa la ni ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa la ni ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But concentration is useless in association.

original: sems dang po ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dang po ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de la ting nge 'dzin don med pa yin te /
translated: Concentration is useless in the first mind, because it is associated with concentration.

original: de la bya ba ni byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bya ba ni byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its function has already been performed.

original: gnyis pa las rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang don med do //
analyzed: gnyis pa las rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang don med do //
translated: It is also useless in the second mind, because it is the cause of the second mind.

original: gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin yin pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin yin pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: What is the use of concentration in that which is concentration?

original: gang zhig sems ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis snga ma dang phyi ma dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yongs su rtog par 'gyur ba ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sems ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis snga ma dang phyi ma dmigs pa gcig pa nyid du yongs su rtog par 'gyur ba ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other concentration that is imagined to have the same object as the first and second minds by the power of concentration.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rnam la ni ting nge 'dzin tha dad pa goms pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin rnam la ni ting nge 'dzin tha dad pa goms pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the different concentrations are cultivated in order to eliminate the different faults of the concentrations.🔽

original: gzhan zhig las ting nge 'dzin rnams la rtse gcig pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhig las ting nge 'dzin rnams la rtse gcig pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, concentration should be accepted as the one-pointedness of mind in any object, whether it is cultivated in the form of a different object or the same object.

original: gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de kho na las sems dag kyang dmigs pa gcig tu 'gyur bas don gzhan du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin don med do //
analyzed: gang kho na las ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de kho na las sems dag kyang dmigs pa gcig tu 'gyur bas don gzhan du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin don med do //
translated: Since the mind is one-pointed in any object in which concentration is cultivated, concentration is not a different object.

original: yang na gang kho na'i rgyu las ting nge 'dzin skyong ba gang yin pa las sems gnyis pa sems snga ma'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng ba de kho na @343b las sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gang kho na'i rgyu las ting nge 'dzin skyong ba gang yin pa las sems gnyis pa sems snga ma'i dmigs pa las mi g-yeng ba de kho na @343b las sems rnams kyi dmigs pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, since the mind is not distracted from the object of the former mind in any object in which concentration is cultivated, the mind is one-pointed in any object in which concentration is cultivated.

original: ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because concentration is a universal mental factor.

original: gal te sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus sems phyi ma sems snga ma'i dmigs pa las mi g-yengs pa yin na de lta na ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te sems snga ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus sems phyi ma sems snga ma'i dmigs pa las mi g-yengs pa yin na de lta na ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the power of concentration concomitant with the former mind prevents the latter mind from being distracted from the object of the former mind, then concentration would not be a universal mental factor because it would not be concomitant with the latter mind.

original: sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would follow that all minds would be single pointed.

original: ma yin te ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma yin te ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is not so, because concentration is weak.

original: sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not follow that all minds are single pointed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ting nge 'dzin stobs chung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Why? Because concentration is weak.

original: / ting nge 'dzin stobs dang ldan pas ni sems gnyis pa sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi gsal bar byed kyi stobs chung bas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: / ting nge 'dzin stobs dang ldan pas ni sems gnyis pa sems dang po'i dmigs pa las mi gsal bar byed kyi stobs chung bas ni ma yin la /
translated: Concentration with strong power makes the second mind and so on clear with regard to the object of the first mind and so on, but weak concentration does not.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyang stobs mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyang stobs mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: And all concentrations are not of equal strength.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin yang sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin sa mang po pa yin yang sems thams cad rtse gcig pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though concentration is a universal mental factor, it does not follow that all minds are one pointed.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba'i rgyun 'jug par nus pa ting nge 'dzin kho na la bsam gtan du brjod pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba'i rgyun 'jug par nus pa ting nge 'dzin kho na la bsam gtan du brjod pa'i phyir thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: It is called meditative concentration dhyana because it is concentration that is able to generate a continuum of virtuous minds and mental factors, but it is not all of them.

original: sems rtse gcig pa kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa kho na ting nge 'dzin yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Only one pointedness of mind is concentration.

original: gzhan dag na re sems kho na rten dang dmigs pa gcig pas sems gzhan pa skyes pa'i nus pa rtse gcig pa nyid med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems kho na rten dang dmigs pa gcig pas sems gzhan pa skyes pa'i nus pa rtse gcig pa nyid med kyi /
translated: Others say: It is not one pointedness of mind because it is the capacity of a different mind to arise when the support and focal object are the same.

original: sems las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan ni ting nge 'dzin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan ni ting nge 'dzin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is a different phenomenon that is a mental factor and is different from mind.🔽The source of this is the sutra that states:

original: 'di'i khungs nyid ni mdo las 'di ltar lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di'i khungs nyid ni mdo las 'di ltar lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The training in superior mind is concentration.

original: gang gi phyir mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo las lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo ni bsam gtan bzhi yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the sutra says that the four meditative stabilizations are the principal training of mind and the principal purification of mind.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gtan sems las gzhan du rtogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gtan sems las gzhan du rtogs par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, meditative stabilization should not be understood as something other than mind.

original: 'o na ci zhe na sems rtse gcig pa kho na bsam gtan no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na sems rtse gcig pa kho na bsam gtan no //
translated: What then is it? It is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin ni sems las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin ni sems las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, meditative stabilization is not something other than mind.

original: dper na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa tshul khrims kho na yin pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa shes rab kho na yin gyi de las gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa tshul khrims kho na yin pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa shes rab kho na yin gyi de las gzhan ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the training in superior morality is just morality and the training in superior wisdom is just wisdom, and nothing else.

original: @344a * // de ltar mdo de nyid las tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo yang tshul khrims dang lta ba dang rnam par grol ba las don gzhan ma yin pa
analyzed: @344a * // de ltar mdo de nyid las tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang lta ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo dang rnam par grol ba yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo yang tshul khrims dang lta ba dang rnam par grol ba las don gzhan ma yin pa
translated: Thus, in that sutra, the foremost of those with pure ethics, the foremost of those with pure view, and the foremost of those with pure liberation are not objects other than ethics, view, and liberation.

original: de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo yang sems las don gzhan ma yin no zhes mdo las khong du chud do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems yongs su dag pa'i gtso bo yang sems las don gzhan ma yin no zhes mdo las khong du chud do //
translated: Similarly, the foremost of those with pure minds are not objects other than the mind.🔽If the absorptions are by nature concentration, then it follows that all concentrations would be absorptions.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la gal te bsam gtan dag ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin na ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /🔽ting nge 'dzin dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la gal te bsam gtan dag ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin na ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /🔽ting nge 'dzin dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang bsam gtan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
translated: If the absorptions are by nature concentration, then it follows that all concentrations would be absorptions because all concentrations are absorptions.🔽If you say that is not so, then you must explain what is the difference between the two?

original: ma yin te phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la bsam gtan zhes ming du btags kyi ting nge 'dzin tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni phul du phyin pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la bsam gtan zhes ming du btags kyi ting nge 'dzin tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: That concentration which possesses perfection is called meditative stabilization, but it is not mere concentration.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽nyi ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yul du phyin par snang ba dang ldan pa de nyid la nyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsam gtan du thal bar mi 'gyur ro // nyi ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yul du phyin par snang ba dang ldan pa de nyid la nyi ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that all concentrations are meditative stabilizations.🔽Like the sun, etc.

original: srin bu me khyer la sogs pa dag ni nyi ma ma yin no //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer la sogs pa dag ni nyi ma ma yin no //
translated: That which is endowed with the appearance of light in a certain place is called the sun, but fireflies, etc. are not the sun.

original: zung du 'brel par dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zung du 'brel par dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it arises naturally in union, etc.

original: zung du 'brel pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gnya' sprel ba dang 'dra ba ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zung du 'brel pa ni zung du 'jug pa ste 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gnya' sprel ba dang 'dra ba ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Union is the union of the two truths, which is to say, their relation.🔽The union of the two truths is like the union of a person’s arms.

original: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung bas na zung du 'jug par ngang gis 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung bas na zung du 'jug par ngang gis 'byung ba ste /
translated: Since they occur together, they are called “occurring together.”

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis mnyam par ngang gis 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gis mnyam par ngang gis 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called “occurring together” because they occur equally through calm abiding and insight.

original: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung ba'i dngos po ni zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'byung ba'i dngos po ni zung du 'brel par ngang gis 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: The state of occurring together is the very occurrence of the union.

original: gal te dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid bsam gtan yin na nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba dang ldan pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa nyid bsam gtan yin na nyon mongs pa can ro myang ba dang ldan pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If concentration is the one-pointedness of a virtuous mind, then how can it be the enjoyment of an afflicted mind?

original: log par nges par sems pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: log par nges par sems pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is wrongly determined,

original: ro myang ba dang 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: others say that it is because the enjoyment of the afflicted mind is the apprehension of the world as permanent and so on.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad log par @344b nges par sems pa'i phyir bsam gtan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa thams cad log par @344b nges par sems pa'i phyir bsam gtan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na'o //
translated: If you say that it is wrongly determined because it is wrongly engaged, then all afflicted states would be concentration because they are wrongly determined.🔽If you say that it is wrongly determined because it is wrongly engaged, then all afflicted states would be concentration because they are wrongly determined.

original: ma yin te de dang mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma yin te de dang mthun pa kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: No, it is only that which is similar to it.

original: ha cad thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ha cad thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: All would follow,

original: de dang mthun pa mtshan nyid mang po mi mthun pa med pa bsam gtan nyon mongs can la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa mtshan nyid mang po mi mthun pa med pa bsam gtan nyon mongs can la de'i ming du btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is similar to it, which is not devoid of many characteristics, is designated by that name in afflicted meditative stabilization.

original: sa bon rul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon rul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a rotten seed.

original: sa bon nyid ma yin pa rdo la sogs pa sa bon rul pa zhes mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: sa bon nyid ma yin pa rdo la sogs pa sa bon rul pa zhes mi brjod kyi /
translated: A seed itself is not a stone, etc., and is not called a rotten seed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de dang 'dra ba kho na'i 'brul sogs pa'i 'bras bu la brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de dang 'dra ba kho na'i 'brul sogs pa'i 'bras bu la brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: But rather, it is like a result, such as rice, that is similar to it.🔽Also, nonvirtuous meditative stabilizations are stated.

original: bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan mi dge ba dag kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are associated with the entanglement of desire realm attachment.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas nas sems par byed rab tu sems par byed do zhes rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas nas sems par byed rab tu sems par byed do zhes rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They are contemplated and thoroughly contemplated, taking the entanglement of desire realm attachment as the objective support.

original: de'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: bsam gtan dge ba zhes bya ba ni phal che ba la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dge ba zhes bya ba ni phal che ba la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “wholesome meditation” is intended to include the majority of cases.🔽Like smoke and fire.

original: du ba dang me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na du ba yod pas zhes smos pas me yang smos pa yin te /
analyzed: du ba dang me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'di na du ba yod pas zhes smos pas me yang smos pa yin te /
translated: For example, when it is said, “Here, because there is smoke,” it is understood that there is also fire,

original: me med na du ba mi 'byung bas lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me med na du ba mi 'byung bas lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because smoke does not occur in the absence of fire, since the two are concomitant.

original: de bzhin du dpyod pa smos pas rtog pa yang smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpyod pa smos pas rtog pa yang smos pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, when investigation is mentioned, it is understood that there is also deliberation,

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two are concomitant.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can ni rtog pa med pa'i dpyod pa yod pas dogs pa bsu nas rtog pa med par ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can ni rtog pa med pa'i dpyod pa yod pas dogs pa bsu nas rtog pa med par ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: In order to anticipate the objection that the special meditative development of the formless states is not mentioned, he says: “without investigation,” etc.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can ni dga' ba dang bde ba dag med pa'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa ni bsam gtan dang po kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can ni dga' ba dang bde ba dag med pa'i phyir dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa ni bsam gtan dang po kho na dang ldan no //
translated: The special meditative development of the formless states is not mentioned because it is devoid of both joy and pleasure.

original: gzhan du rtog pa la mi 'khrul te me la du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du rtog pa la mi 'khrul te me la du ba bzhin no //
translated: It is not mistaken with respect to other conceptual thoughts, like smoke with respect to fire.

original: de dag gis skye pa rnams kyang bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gis skye pa rnams kyang bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The arising of these has also been explained.

original: gzugs med khams na gnas med de //
analyzed: gzugs med khams na gnas med de //
translated: There is no abode in the formless realm.

original: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba las ni rnam pa bzhi // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Arising is of four kinds.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no form that accompanies them.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means because there is no form of the absorptions or the uncontaminated vows.

original: 'og ma'i sa las dpen las skyes //
analyzed: 'og ma'i sa las dpen las skyes //
translated: They arise from the separation of lower levels.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di dag bsam gtan gyi yan lag bzhin phan tshun las ma yin gyi /🔽tha dad pa nyid yod par @345a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di dag bsam gtan gyi yan lag bzhin phan tshun las ma yin gyi / tha dad pa nyid yod par @345a * //
translated: These are not like the branches of the absorptions, which arise from each other.

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽de nyid kyi phyir dben pa nis 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bar byed pa'i lam gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / de nyid kyi phyir dben pa nis 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bar byed pa'i lam gang yin pa ste /
translated: They are said to exist separately.🔽Therefore they are the path that separates from attachment to lower levels.

original: 'dis rnam par 'byed pas na dben pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par 'byed pas na dben pa'o //
translated: They are separation because they separate from attachment to lower levels.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar ni rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i thi tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar ni rgyab kyis phyogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i thi tshig go //
translated: The phrase “because they turn away from attachment” is a commentarial statement.🔽Like a little yellow,

original: cung zad ser ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam ser ba la cung zad ser ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du gzugs cung zad tsam cig yod pas gzugs med pa yin no //
analyzed: cung zad ser ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam ser ba la cung zad ser ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du gzugs cung zad tsam cig yod pas gzugs med pa yin no //
translated: just as something that is a little yellow is called “a little yellow,” so too, since there is just a little form, it is called formless.🔽If they do not exist, how can there be🔽the restraint of body and speech?🔽The restraint of body and speech🔽would not exist in the formless realm.

original: de dag med na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dag med na'o //
analyzed: de dag med na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dag med na'o //
translated: The restraint of body and speech would not exist in the formless realm, because there is no form there.

original: de'i sdom pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i sdom pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni /

original: lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dag tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dag tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The restraint of body and speech would not exist there.🔽The formless realm is called formless because there is no form there.🔽The formless realm is called formless because there is no form there.🔽If form does not exist there, how can there be the restraint of body and speech?🔽The restraint of body and speech would not exist there.🔽The formless realm is called formless because there is no form there.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na 'byung ba med par 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na 'byung ba med par 'byung ba las gyur pa mi rung ste /
translated: The formless realm is called formless because there is no form there.🔽If form does not exist there, how can there be the restraint of body and speech?🔽The restraint of body and speech would not exist there.🔽The formless realm is called formless because there is no form there.

original: 'byung ba la bltos pa med pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa 'jug pa med pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba la bltos pa med pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa 'jug pa med pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The formless realm is called formless because there is no form there.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba dag med bzhin du yang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yod pa de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'byung
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba dag med bzhin du yang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yod pa de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'byung
translated: If you say, “It is like the uncontaminated vows,”

original: ba rnams la lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gzugs med pa na spyod pa yod par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba rnams la lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i rang bzhin 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gzugs med pa na spyod pa yod par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: it would follow that form that is derived from the primary elements that exist in the formless realm would exist, since the uncontaminated vows exist even though the uncontaminated primary elements do not exist.

original: ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa ni zag pa med pa'i 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not like that because contaminated primary elements exist.

original: gang du skyes pa de pa'i 'byung brgyur byas nas 'byung ba yin gyi 'byung ba la mi ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa de pa'i 'byung brgyur byas nas 'byung ba yin gyi 'byung ba la mi ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The uncontaminated vows are derived from the primary elements that exist in the level where one is born, but they do not rely on the primary elements.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na lus dang ngag gi sdom pa gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'byung ba la brten nas mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na lus dang ngag gi sdom pa gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'byung ba la brten nas mi 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, the vows of body and speech do not occur in the formless realm in dependence on the primary elements of other levels.

original: 'byung ba la ma bltos pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba la ma bltos pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not independent of the primary elements,

original: gzugs med khams pa'i sa pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med khams pa'i sa pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are of the same level as the formless realm.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'byung pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because primary elements that are contaminated exist there.

original: dpe dang de'i dpe can 'dra ba med do //
analyzed: dpe dang de'i dpe can 'dra ba med do //
translated: The example and the one to whom it is applied are not similar.🔽It is explained that they are also refuted in meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang sdom pa skye ba med de de pa'i 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la yang de dgag pa bshad do zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la yang sdom pa skye ba med de de pa'i 'byung ba med do //
translated: Vows do not arise in formless realm meditative attainment because the primary elements of the formless realm do not exist.

original: gzhan gyi sa pa'i sdom pa ni gzhan @345b gyis pa'i 'byung ba rgyur byas nas 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa pa'i sdom pa ni gzhan @345b gyis pa'i 'byung ba rgyur byas nas 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that vows of other levels do not arise in dependence on the primary elements of other levels.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag bar 'das te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de dag ga ba bshad do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag bar 'das te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de dag ga ba bshad do zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is explained as the sphere of infinite space because it is said, “One completely transcends the discernment of form in every respect.”

original: de ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin nges par skye bo zhes de ltar skye ba'i gzugs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin nges par skye bo zhes de ltar skye ba'i gzugs bkag pa yin no //
translated: It is form that definitely arises with the nature of space.

original: 'on te lus kyang zhes bya ba ni khog pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te lus kyang zhes bya ba ni khog pa'o //
translated: But the body exists,🔽the physical sense faculties exist,

original: dbang po gzugs can rnams kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //🔽ji ltar na de dag gzugs cung zad yod par 'dod ces bya ba ni gzugs mtha' dag yod pa ma yin pas gzugs cung zad yod pa zhes bya ba mi 'dod par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can rnams kyang yod do zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o // ji ltar na de dag gzugs cung zad yod par 'dod ces bya ba ni gzugs mtha' dag yod pa ma yin pas gzugs cung zad yod pa zhes bya ba mi 'dod par bsam pa'o //
translated: the eyes and so on exist.🔽How can they assert that they have some form?🔽They assert that they have some form because all form does not exist.

original: bong tshod chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ci ste gzugs mtha' dag med pa ma yin pas gzugs cung zad du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: bong tshod chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ci ste gzugs mtha' dag med pa ma yin pas gzugs cung zad du brjod do zhe na /
translated: They say that they have some form because they have a small size.

original: 'o na bong tshod chung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba chu'i srog chags rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o na bong tshod chung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba chu'i srog chags rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: But if you say that they are not form because their size is small, then it would follow that the water creatures would also be formless, because their size is small.

original: chu'i skye bo ltar mi snang ba rnams la yang gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i skye bo ltar mi snang ba rnams la yang gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that those who are not visible, like water creatures, would also be formless.

original: gal te dang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste gzugs dang pa'i phyir de dag gzugs cung zad yod pa yin gyi tshad chung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no snyam na /🔽srid pa bar ma dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ste gzugs dang pa'i phyir de dag gzugs cung zad yod pa yin gyi tshad chung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no snyam na / srid pa bar ma dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that they are form because it is clear, then it would follow that the intermediate beings and those who experience form would also be formless,

original: de dag ni dang ba'i phyir rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi ri dag la yang thogs pa med par 'gro bas de'i phyir de dag la yang gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dang ba'i phyir rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi ri dag la yang thogs pa med par 'gro bas de'i phyir de dag la yang gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are clear and unimpeded in their movement even through diamond mountains.🔽If you say that they are form because it is more clear, then it would follow that the form of those who experience form is formless,

original: gang las ches dang ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs las gzugs na spyod pa dang la /
analyzed: gang las ches dang ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs las gzugs na spyod pa dang la /
translated: because it is even more clear than the form of those who experience desire.

original: gzugs na spyod pa bas gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang ba yin zhing /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa bas gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang ba yin zhing /
translated: Those of the formless realm are more refined than those of the form realm.

original: de las ches dang ba gzhan med de /
analyzed: de las ches dang ba gzhan med de /
translated: There is nothing more refined than that.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa de dag kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa de dag kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore they are formless.

original: srid pa bar ma dang gzugs na spyod pa ni ma yin no zhe na srid pa'i rtse mo kho na gzugs med par 'gyur gyi /🔽nam mkha' mtha' las skye mched la sogs pa gsum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma dang gzugs na spyod pa ni ma yin no zhe na srid pa'i rtse mo kho na gzugs med par 'gyur gyi / nam mkha' mtha' las skye mched la sogs pa gsum ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that intermediate existence and the form realm are not formless, then only the summit of existence would be formless.

original: de las gzhan pa gzugs ches dang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gzugs ches dang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three formless states such as infinite space would not be formless because there is no form more refined than that.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro @346a * //🔽zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin du skye ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro @346a * // zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Because birth is more refined than meditative attainment.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ches shin tu khyad par du 'gag pa'i dbye bas gnas pa de bzhin du de dag gi skye ba'i khyad par yang khas blang dgos so //
