analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ches shin tu khyad par du 'gag pa'i dbye bas gnas pa de bzhin du de dag gi skye ba'i khyad par yang khas blang dgos so //
translated: Just as meditative attainment of infinite space and so on is distinguished by the classification of extremely refined states, so too their birth must be accepted as distinguished.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i tse mo'i gzugs kho na ches dang bar thal bar 'gyur gyi lhag ma rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i tse mo'i gzugs kho na ches dang bar thal bar 'gyur gyi lhag ma rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it follows that only the form of the peak of existence is clear, not the others.

original: ci ste gzugs med par skye ba'i gzugs ni sa 'og ma pa'i mig gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gzugs med par skye ba'i gzugs ni sa 'og ma pa'i mig gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang ba nyid yin te /
translated: If you think that the form of those born in the formless realm is clear because the eyes of lower levels do not apprehend it,

original: de'i phyir de dag nyid kho na gzugs med pa yin gyi srid pa bar ma la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag nyid kho na gzugs med pa yin gyi srid pa bar ma la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: then only those formless beings would be formless, not intermediate beings and so on.

original: bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /🔽bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dbang pos bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin pa nas de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i dbang pos bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin pa'i bar du yin te gong ma pa'i gzugs ches dang
analyzed: bsam gtan du skye ba'i gzugs kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i dbang pos bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin pa nas de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i dbang pos bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin pa'i bar du yin te gong ma pa'i gzugs ches dang
translated: The form of those born in the absorptions is also like that.

original: ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eyes of the first absorption do not apprehend the form of the second absorption and so on. Similarly, the eyes of the third absorption do not apprehend the form of the fourth absorption because the form of higher levels is clearer.

original: de ltar gyur na gang las de dag gzugs med pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs na spyod pa dag ma yin par 'gyur ba de dang khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na gang las de dag gzugs med pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs na spyod pa dag ma yin par 'gyur ba de dang khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: If that were so, then what difference would there be between the formless realm and those for whom it is not the form realm?🔽If you say: The names of those two are consistent with their meaning,

original: gal te de gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams te /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams te /
translated: then the desire realm and the form realm are consistent with their meaning.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams yin /
translated: The desire realm is distinguished by the objects of desire.

original: gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs kyi khams yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs kyi khams yin no //
translated: The form realm is distinguished by form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The formless realm is not.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: The name of the formless realm is not consistent with its meaning.

original: 'o na ci 'dod rgyal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'dod rgyal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the name of the formless realm?

original: de la rig pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rig pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba la /
translated: What knowledge is there of that?

original: rig pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: rig pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: Knowledge is valid knowledge.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: And that is inference.

original: gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba las so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi ming ni don dang mthun pa yin gyi gzugs med pa'i khams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba las so //
translated: The names of the two realms are consistent with their objects, but the formless realm is not.

original: 'dod pa de'i lung dam de ste rjes su dpag pa las rtogs na /
analyzed: 'dod pa de'i lung dam de ste rjes su dpag pa las rtogs na /
translated: If you understand that scripture is the source of that desire,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs yod pa nyid la rjes su dpag pa ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs yod pa nyid la rjes su dpag pa ma mthong zhing /
translated: then you have not seen any inference that form exists in the formless realm.

original: lung yongs su 'dzin pa ni gal te tshe dang drod @346b gnyis 'dres par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lung yongs su 'dzin pa ni gal te tshe dang drod @346b gnyis 'dres par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The source of scripture is the statement, “If life and heat are combined,”🔽because a sutra states:

original: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che tshe gang yin pa dang drod gang yin pa'i chos 'di dag na 'dres pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che tshe gang yin pa dang drod gang yin pa'i chos 'di dag na 'dres pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, these phenomena, life and heat, are combined.

original: de'i phyir de na tshe yod pas drod kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de na tshe yod pas drod kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since life exists there, heat also exists there.

original: yang mdo las /
analyzed: yang mdo las /
translated: Again, a sutra states:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dper na 'dam bu'i shog gnyis gnam du 'greng bar gyur la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dper na 'dam bu'i shog gnyis gnam du 'greng bar gyur la /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, for example, it is like two bundles of reeds🔽standing in such a way that they support each other.

original: de gnyis phan tshun brten cing phan tshun brten nas 'dug pa de las 'ga' zhig gis cig shos bsal na cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun brten cing phan tshun brten nas 'dug pa de las 'ga' zhig gis cig shos bsal na cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These two are mutually dependent and exist in mutual dependence. If one of them is removed, the other falls away.

original: gnyis pa bsal na cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa bsal na cig shos 'gyel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If both are removed, both fall away.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i pu de bzhin du ming dang gzugs rnams kyang phan tshun brten cing brten cing brten nas gnas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //🔽ming yod pas gdon mi za bar gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i pu de bzhin du ming dang gzugs rnams kyang phan tshun brten cing brten cing brten nas gnas zhes rgyas par 'byung ba yin no // ming yod pas gdon mi za bar gzugs med pa dag na gzugs yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, in the same way, name and form are mutually dependent and exist in mutual dependence.🔽If name exists, form is not nonexistent.

original: gzugs la bltos pa med par ming 'ba' zhig gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la bltos pa med par ming 'ba' zhig gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If form exists, name is not nonexistent.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo las rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo las rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Sūtra on the Support of Mindfulness says, “Conditioned by consciousness, name and form arise.”

original: de la gzugs med par nyid mtshams spyor ba'i skad cig ma la rnam par shes pa dang de'i rkyen gyis ming yin la de yang gdon mi za bar lhan cig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzugs med par nyid mtshams spyor ba'i skad cig ma la rnam par shes pa dang de'i rkyen gyis ming yin la de yang gdon mi za bar lhan cig par 'gyur te /
translated: In the moment of linking with the formless realm, consciousness and name are conditions of form, and they are definitely concomitant.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it says name and form are conditions of consciousness.

original: 'du byed kyi bar la gzhan du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi bar la gzhan du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Up to the phrase “Conditioned by ignorance, the karmic predispositions,” and so on.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las dge slong dag rnam par shes pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba /🔽gzugs la dmigs pa /
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag rnam par shes pa gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba / gzugs la dmigs pa /
translated: Monks, consciousness moves toward form,🔽it focuses on form,

original: gzugs la brten te gnas so zhes rgyas par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gzugs la brten te gnas so zhes rgyas par 'byung zhing /
translated: it exists in dependence on form.

original: dge slong dag gang la la zhig 'di skad du bdag ni gzugs las gzhan dang / tshor ba las gzhan dang / 'du shes las gzhan dang / 'du byed las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'gro ba 'am 'ong ba 'am skye bar smra'o zhes zer na de'i dag de ni tshig tsam du zad do zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang la la zhig 'di skad du bdag ni gzugs las gzhan dang / tshor ba las gzhan dang / 'du shes las gzhan dang / 'du byed las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'gro ba 'am 'ong ba 'am skye bar smra'o zhes zer na de'i dag de ni tshig tsam du zad do zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Monks, if someone were to say, “I speak of consciousness going or coming or arising apart from form, apart from feeling, apart from perception, and apart from formations,” that would be mere words for him.

original: lung de las kyang gzugs yod pa nyid grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung de las kyang gzugs yod pa nyid grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, form is established as existing in the formless realm.

original: gzugs las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'gro ba dang 'od ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan du rnam par shes pa 'gro ba dang 'od ba bkag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it refutes the idea that consciousness goes or comes apart from form.

original: ma yin te dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @347a * //
analyzed: ma yin te dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba @347a * //
translated: That is not so, because it is to be analyzed.

original: ni ; lung 'di las gzugs med pa rnams su gzugs yod pa grub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ni ; lung 'di las gzugs med pa rnams su gzugs yod pa grub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: This passage does not establish that form exists in the formless realm.

original: lung 'di nyid dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung 'di nyid dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is to be analyzed.

original: 'on te thams cad las zhes bya ba ni khams gsum kar yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad las zhes bya ba ni khams gsum kar yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or from all, means from all three realms.

original: kho bo ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe kho na la dgongs nas tshe dang drod 'dres par gsungs so zhes smra ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe kho na la dgongs nas tshe dang drod 'dres par gsungs so zhes smra ste /
translated: I say that the statement that life and heat are mixed was made with reference to the time when beings are in the desire realm.🔽Because the same sutra states:

original: gang gi phyir mdo de nyid las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dbang po lnga po gang yin pa 'di dag ni spyod yul tha dad pa yul tha dad pa rnams te zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mdo de nyid las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dbang po lnga po gang yin pa 'di dag ni spyod yul tha dad pa yul tha dad pa rnams te zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Sariputra, these five faculties have different domains and different objects.

original: 'di dag gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong ba ni gang /
analyzed: 'di dag gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong ba ni gang /
translated: What is the domain and object of these faculties?

original: 'di dag gi rtog pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi rtog pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is their conceptualization?

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dbang po lnga po gang yin pa 'di dag ces snga ma bzhin te lus kyi dbang po'i bar ro //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dbang po lnga po gang yin pa 'di dag ces snga ma bzhin te lus kyi dbang po'i bar ro //
translated: Venerable Mahakausthila, these five faculties are as stated above, up to the body faculty.

original: 'di dag gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong ba ni yid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi spyod yul dang yul nyams su myong ba ni yid do //
translated: The domain and object of these faculties is the mind.

original: 'di dag gi rton pa ni yid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rton pa ni yid do //
translated: Their conceptualization is the mind.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yid kyi rton pa ni gang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu yid kyi rton pa ni gang /
translated: Venerable Sariputra, what is the conceptualization of the mind?

original: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che yid ni tshe la rton to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che yid ni tshe la rton to //
translated: Venerable Mahakausthila, the mind relies on life.

original: tshe ci la rton /
analyzed: tshe ci la rton /
translated: What does life rely on?

original: tshe ni drod la rton to //
analyzed: tshe ni drod la rton to //
translated: Life relies on heat.🔽Also, the Venerable Sariputra says,

original: gang yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshe dang drod ces bya ba chos gnyis po 'di dag ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /🔽mdo de nyid las yid dbang po lnga la rton pas skyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshe dang drod ces bya ba chos gnyis po 'di dag ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste / mdo de nyid las yid dbang po lnga la rton pas skyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: These two dharmas, life and heat, are not generated by the five faculties.

original: dbang po lnga'i rten rnam par shes pa kho na dbang pos byas par gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i rten rnam par shes pa kho na dbang pos byas par gsungs te /
translated: In that same sutra, it is said that life is not generated by the five faculties, but that the consciousness that is the support of the five faculties is generated by the faculties.

original: drod rnam par shes pa lnga'i spyod yul dang yul de la rton par gyur pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drod rnam par shes pa lnga'i spyod yul dang yul de la rton par gyur pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that heat is the object field of the five consciousnesses and that life relies on that object field.

original: de yang 'dod par gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang 'dod par gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, it belongs to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe kho na rton pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe kho na rton pa yin no //
translated: Life belongs to the desire realm alone.

original: tshe dang drod 'dres pa dag ni ma yin zhes bya ste /🔽tshe dang drod 'dres pa nyid ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe nyid la dgongs nas gsungs kyi /
analyzed: tshe dang drod 'dres pa dag ni ma yin zhes bya ste / tshe dang drod 'dres pa nyid ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe nyid la dgongs nas gsungs kyi /
translated: It is not a mixture of life and heat.

original: khams gsum pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Life and heat are said to be a mixture in the desire realm, but not in the three realms.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Conditioned by consciousness is name-and-form.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen thams cad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen thams cad do //
translated: “Conditioned by consciousness” means conditioned by all the consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gsungs te /
translated: It is said that consciousness is a condition for name-and-form.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa dang gzugs med @347b par gtogs pa thams cad dam /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa dang gzugs med @347b par gtogs pa thams cad dam /
translated: Is it that all that is included in the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm is conditioned by the karmic forces,

original: 'on te ming dang gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can zhes de ltar smra zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ming dang gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can zhes de ltar smra zhe na /
translated: or is it that all name-and-form is conditioned by consciousness?

original: ming gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par shes pa thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ming gzugs thams cad rnam par shes pa'i rkyen can no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par shes pa thams cad ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen ni ma yin no //
translated: It is definitely stated that all name-and-form is conditioned by consciousness, but not that all consciousness is a condition for name-and-form.

original: de gang gi phyir gzugs med pa na spyod pa 'du byed kyi rkyen can rnam par shes pa ni ming kho na'i rkyen yin gyi ming dang gzugs kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir gzugs med pa na spyod pa 'du byed kyi rkyen can rnam par shes pa ni ming kho na'i rkyen yin gyi ming dang gzugs kyi ma yin te /
translated: This is because in the formless realm, the consciousness that is conditioned by the karmic forces is a condition for name only, not for name-and-form.

original: de na ming dang gzugs 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na ming dang gzugs 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no name-and-form at all there.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'du byed kyi rkyen can rnam par shes pa ni bltos pa med par yod ces so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'du byed kyi rkyen can rnam par shes pa ni bltos pa med par yod ces so //
translated: In the desire realm, consciousness conditioned by formations exists without reliance.

original: rnam par shes pa 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dgag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dgag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Refutation of the Coming and Going of Consciousness

original: 'jig rten snga ma nas srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis skye ba ni 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten snga ma nas srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis skye ba ni 'ong ba'o //
translated: Coming is the arising of the continuum of the intermediate existence from the previous world.

original: de kho na bzhin du 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu skye ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu skye ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going is the arising of the continuum from here to the next world in the same way.🔽Do all of them come and go?

original: ci de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: ci de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams so //
translated: They are form, feeling, perception, and formations.🔽Their coming and going is refuted,

original: de dag bkag ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa kho na 'ong ba dang 'gro ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bkag ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa kho na 'ong ba dang 'gro ba bkag pa'o //
translated: but the coming and going of consciousness alone is refuted.

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or does any of them come and go?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i nang nas gang yang rung ba zhig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i nang nas gang yang rung ba zhig go //
translated: Any one of them, such as form, comes and goes.

original: me n'a pi bi n'a pi bi dznya n'a sy'a ga ti pra ti she rdon tu sa mu di tee re be /
analyzed: me n'a pi bi n'a pi bi dznya n'a sy'a ga ti pra ti she rdon tu sa mu di tee re be /
translated: Even though they are not seen, they are seen by the eye of knowledge.🔽

original: gal te bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir dpyad par mi bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir dpyad par mi bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it should not be analyzed because it is stated without distinction,🔽the sutra states without distinction:

original: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang tshe gang yin pa dang drod gang yin pa'i chos 'di gnyis ni 'dres pa ste ma 'dres pa ma yin no zhes bye brag med par gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang yang tshe gang yin pa dang drod gang yin pa'i chos 'di gnyis ni 'dres pa ste ma 'dres pa ma yin no zhes bye brag med par gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Sariputra, life and heat are not separate things.

original: 'dis ni 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa'i tshe'i dbang du mdzad de bye brag med par gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa'i tshe'i dbang du mdzad de bye brag med par gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: This is stated without distinction from the perspective of life belonging to the desire and form realms.

original: gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not belong to the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir khams gsum pa'o zhes bya ba la yang dgongs pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khams gsum pa'o zhes bya ba la yang dgongs pa shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore the three realms should be understood to be the intended meaning of the statement that it belongs to the three realms.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba der yang khyad par du ma byas pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dag kho na'i rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba der yang khyad par du ma byas pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dag kho na'i rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen te /
translated: The condition of consciousness is name-and-form, but since that is not specified, it is the consciousness of the desire realm and the form realm that is the condition of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rgyu dag gang yang gzugs la sogs @348a * //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rgyu dag gang yang gzugs la sogs @348a * //
translated: The causes of name-and-form are not other than form and so on.

original: pa rnams las gzhan du rnam par shes pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag par gsungs pa 'dir yang byed brag tu ma byas la /
analyzed: pa rnams las gzhan du rnam par shes pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dgag par gsungs pa 'dir yang byed brag tu ma byas la /
translated: The refutation of the coming and going of consciousness is also not specified here.

original: ci de dag thams cad bkag gam 'on te 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci de dag thams cad bkag gam 'on te 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One might ask, “Are all of these refuted or are some not?”

original: de ltar bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir dpyad par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir dpyad par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Since it is stated without distinction, it should not be analyzed.

original: de lta yin na ha cad thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ha cad thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that everything would be refuted.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yang tshe med par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yang tshe med par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that that which is not counted as a sentient being would not arise without life force.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because it is stated without distinction.

original: der ni tshe dang drod sems can du bgrang ba 'dres so zhes bye brag tu ma mdzad do //
analyzed: der ni tshe dang drod sems can du bgrang ba 'dres so zhes bye brag tu ma mdzad do //
translated: But in that passage, life force, heat, and sentient beings are not distinguished.

original: phyi'i gzugs shing dang rtsig pa la sogs pha sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yang ming la brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs shing dang rtsig pa la sogs pha sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yang ming la brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it would follow that external form such as trees, walls, and so on, which are not counted as sentient beings, would also be dependent on name, because it is stated without distinction.

original: der ni ming dang sems can du bgrang ba'i gzugs phan tshun brten nas gnas so zhes ma gsungs so //
analyzed: der ni ming dang sems can du bgrang ba'i gzugs phan tshun brten nas gnas so zhes ma gsungs so //
translated: But it does not state that name and form counted as sentient beings remain in mutual dependence.

original: de'i phyir ming ltar gzugs kyang bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir thams cad gzung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming ltar gzugs kyang bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir thams cad gzung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because form is stated without distinction, like name, it would follow that all form is apprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Like the four abodes of consciousness,

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi khyad par med par gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs yod pa nyid du 'dod pa de bzhin du zas bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang kham du byed
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi khyad par med par gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs yod pa nyid du 'dod pa de bzhin du zas bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yang kham du byed
translated: Just as you assert that form exists in the formless realm because the four abodes of consciousness are stated without differentiation, so too you should assert that the four types of food exist in the formless realm just as they do in the desire realm because the four types of food are stated.🔽

original: pa'i zas yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i zas yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as you assert that form exists in the formless realm because the four abodes of consciousness are stated without differentiation, so too you should assert that oral food exists in the formless realm just like the desire realm because the four foods are stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they are stated without differentiation.🔽The four foods are stated in the sūtras:

original: de skad du yang zas bzhi ni sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas de'i byed ba dang sred pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de skad du yang zas bzhi ni sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas de'i byed ba dang sred pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin la /
translated: The four foods are the condition for the origination of sentient beings and they benefit those who seek craving.

original: zas bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four foods?

original: kham kyi zas rags pa dang / phra ba dang / gnyis pa reg pa'i zas dang / gsum pa yid la sems pa'i zas dang / bzhi pa rnam par shes pa'i zas so //
analyzed: kham kyi zas rags pa dang / phra ba dang / gnyis pa reg pa'i zas dang / gsum pa yid la sems pa'i zas dang / bzhi pa rnam par shes pa'i zas so //
translated: The first is oral food, the second is contact, the third is mental intention and the fourth is consciousness.

original: sems can gnas pa rnams zhes bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa ltar kham du byed pa'i zas kyang thams cad na yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gnas pa rnams zhes bye brag med par gsungs pa'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa ltar kham du byed pa'i zas kyang thams cad na yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because sentient beings who abide there are said to exist without making any distinction.

original: ci ste zas bzhi ni sems @348b can 'byung ba rnams gnas bar byed pa zhes bya ba spyi bstan pa 'di la dmigs kyis bsal ba 'di yod do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste zas bzhi ni sems @348b can 'byung ba rnams gnas bar byed pa zhes bya ba spyi bstan pa 'di la dmigs kyis bsal ba 'di yod do snyam na /
translated: If you think that the four foods are taught in general as the basis of sentient beings who arise, but that this is not the case in the formless realm,🔽then it would follow that form also exists there because the Abhidharmakośa declares,

original: lha las 'das te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lha las 'das te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Form is surpassed by passing beyond the peak of existence.

original: gal te de ltar yin na gzugs med pa dag na yang gzugs yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na gzugs med pa dag na yang gzugs yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that form exists in the formless realm.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is excepted.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba nyid ston pa ni gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba nyid ston pa ni gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The exception itself is taught in the Abhidharmakośa, which states, The formless are the definite exits from form.

original: gal te gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba dag la gzugs zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba dag la gzugs zhig yod par gyur na /
translated: If form existed in the formless absorptions and rebirths,

original: gzugs yod phan chad rang gi gzugs gdon mi za bar 'dus par byed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzugs yod phan chad rang gi gzugs gdon mi za bar 'dus par byed par 'gyur bas /
translated: If form exists there, then those born there would necessarily aggregate their own form.

original: der gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das par mi 'gyur zhing /🔽de dag gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: der gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das par mi 'gyur zhing / de dag gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, they would not have completely transcended the discernment of form.🔽They would not have escaped from form.

original: gzugs rnams las 'das par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs rnams las 'das par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not have transcended form.

original: gzugs yod na der skyes pa rnams gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs yod na der skyes pa rnams gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: If form exists there, it would be illogical to say that those born there are formless.

original: de'i phyir de na gzugs yod ces bya bar rtogs so //🔽gzugs med par gtogs pa'i gzugs sa 'og ma pa ni rags pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de na gzugs yod ces bya bar rtogs so // gzugs med par gtogs pa'i gzugs sa 'og ma pa ni rags pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is understood that form exists there.🔽Form belonging to the formless realm is coarse in comparison to the form of lower levels.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni phra ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni phra ba yin te /
translated: Form of the formless realm is subtle.

original: de'i phyir gzugs rags pa las dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs rags pa las dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha had in mind the coarse form of the desire realm when he said,

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The formless realm is the escape from form.”

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa zhig gang dag ces bya brgyas par gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa zhig gang dag ces bya brgyas par gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “What are the formless liberations?”

original: kham gyi zas la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: kham gyi zas la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same applies to oral food.

original: kham du byed pa'i zas za ba'i lha las 'das te /
analyzed: kham du byed pa'i zas za ba'i lha las 'das te /
translated: The gods who consume oral food are beyond that.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams 'og ma'i sa pa'i kham kyi zas rags pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams 'og ma'i sa pa'i kham kyi zas rags pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the coarse oral food of the lower realm.

original: de'i sa pa phra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i sa pa phra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not stated from the perspective of the subtle food of that realm.

original: gal te sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs rags ba las nges bar 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag ces bya bar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs rags ba las nges bar 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag ces bya bar 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that the formless realm is so called because it is definitely released from the coarse form of lower levels,

original: de lta na 'o nas bsam gtan rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs rags pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pa nas /🔽de @349a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'o nas bsam gtan rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs rags pa las nges par 'byung ba yin pa nas / de @349a * //
translated: then the absorptions would also be formless, because the first absorption is definitely released from the coarse form of the desire realm,🔽and similarly, the fourth absorption is definitely released from the coarse form of the third absorption.

original: bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa ni gsum pa'i gzugs rags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i bar du yin pas gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa ni gsum pa'i gzugs rags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i bar du yin pas gzugs med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would follow that the absorptions would be formless.

original: de yangs gong ma la bltos nas rags pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yangs gong ma la bltos nas rags pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is coarse in relation to higher levels,🔽then it would follow that the formless realm would be coarse in relation to the higher summit of existence.

original: de lta na yang srid pa'i rtse mo kho na gzugs med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang srid pa'i rtse mo kho na gzugs med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, only the summit of existence would be formless.

original: gal te rang gi sa pa'i gzugs yod bzhin du yang 'og ma pa'i gzugs las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams nges par 'byung ba gsungs na ni /
analyzed: gal te rang gi sa pa'i gzugs yod bzhin du yang 'og ma pa'i gzugs las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams nges par 'byung ba gsungs na ni /
translated: If the formless were taught to be a renunciation of form, even though form exists in its own stage,

original: de lta yin na tshor ba la sogs pa la sa nges par 'byung bar yang ci'i phyir ma bshad /
analyzed: de lta yin na tshor ba la sogs pa la sa nges par 'byung bar yang ci'i phyir ma bshad /
translated: then why is it not said that the formless is a renunciation of feeling and so on?

original: de dag ni sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs ltar tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs ltar tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba yang yin no //
translated: They are a renunciation of feeling and so on, just as they are a renunciation of lower level form.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term “and so on” includes discernment, formation, and consciousness.

original: gzugs las nges par 'byung ba ltar tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba nyid du gsungs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs las nges par 'byung ba ltar tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba nyid du gsungs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The formless is not taught to be a renunciation of feeling and so on, as it is of form.

original: de'i phyir sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag ma yin no zhes bya bar mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa 'og ma pa'i gzugs las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs med pa dag ma yin no zhes bya bar mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is not understood that the formless realm is not form because it is definitely free from the form of lower levels.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs kyi rnam pa zad par las 'das la zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs kyi rnam pa zad par las 'das la zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the sutra, “Having transcended the totality of form,”

original: rnam pa smos pa ni nang gi'am phyi'i 'am rags pa'am phra ba 'am dman pa'am gya nom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs ma lus pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir te gzugs kyi rnam pa de dag thams cad las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa smos pa ni nang gi'am phyi'i 'am rags pa'am phra ba 'am dman pa'am gya nom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs ma lus pa nye bar bzung ba'i phyir te gzugs kyi rnam pa de dag thams cad las 'das pa yin te /
translated: and the term “totality” is mentioned because all form is included in the categories of internal and external, gross and subtle, inferior and superior, and so on.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba la gzugs ma lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba la gzugs ma lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One transcends all those aspects of form because form does not exist in meditative attainment and birth in the formless realm.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba la bde ba yang ma yin /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa las ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba la bde ba yang ma yin /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not transcend the aspects of feeling and so on because pleasant and painful feelings exist in the formless realm.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa'i bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa'i bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The term “and so on” should be stated up to consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gzugs rnams la nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs rnams la nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs kyi //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one definitely emerges from form,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba zhes ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba zhes ni ma gsungs so //
translated: but it is not said that one definitely emerges from feeling and so on.

original: gal te gzugs med pa rnams gzugs las nges par 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa rnams gzugs las nges par 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the formless realm definitely emerges from form,

original: 'o na de'i phyir srid @349b pas srid pa las nges par 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na de'i phyir srid @349b pas srid pa las nges par 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: then it follows that it would definitely emerge from existence,

original: de ltar yin la mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: de ltar yin la mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: but that contradicts a sutra.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las de ni srid pas srid pa las nges par 'byung bar mi smra'o zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las de ni srid pas srid pa las nges par 'byung bar mi smra'o zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: I do not say that one definitely emerges from existence through existence.

original: de'i phyir srid pas srid pa las nges par mi 'byung bar gsungs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /🔽'dod pa'i srid pa'am gzugs kyi srid pa'am /🔽gzugs med pa'i srid pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa'i srid pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pas srid pa las nges par mi 'byung bar gsungs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / 'dod pa'i srid pa'am gzugs kyi srid pa'am / gzugs med pa'i srid pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa'i srid pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the sutra states that one does not definitely emerge from existence through existence.🔽It is said that one does not definitely emerge from existence through existence because one does not definitely emerge from the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm,🔽or the existence of the formless realm through the existence of the desire realm,🔽the existence of the form realm,

original: gzugs kyi srid pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa'am /
translated: or the existence of the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa de nyid las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir de skad gsungs kyi /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa de nyid las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir de skad gsungs kyi /
translated: It is said that way because one definitely does not transcend that formless realm existence.

original: sa dang khams gong ma'i srid pas sa dang khams 'og ma'i srid pa las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa dang khams gong ma'i srid pas sa dang khams 'og ma'i srid pa las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not said that way because one definitely does not transcend lower realm existence by higher realm existence.🔽Because one does not definitely transcend all and one does not definitely transcend forever.

original: thams cad dang gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba de la gzugs kyi srid pas ni thams cad las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa ste /🔽gzugs kyi srid pas ni 'dod pa'i srid pa ltar gzugs kyi srid pas gzugs med pa'i srid pa las nges par 'byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: thams cad dang gtan du nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba de la gzugs kyi srid pas ni thams cad las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa ste / gzugs kyi srid pas ni 'dod pa'i srid pa ltar gzugs kyi srid pas gzugs med pa'i srid pa las nges par 'byung ba ma yin la /
translated: In that regard, form realm existence does not definitely transcend all because🔽form realm existence does not definitely transcend formless realm existence, as desire realm existence does form realm existence.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pas kyang gzugs kyi srid pa ltar 'dod pa'i srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa las nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pas kyang gzugs kyi srid pa ltar 'dod pa'i srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa las nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: And formless realm existence does not definitely transcend desire realm existence and form realm existence, as form realm existence does formless realm existence.

original: gzugs kyi srid pas 'dod pa'i srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pas gzugs kyi srid pa las gtan du nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pas 'dod pa'i srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pas gzugs kyi srid pa las gtan du nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that form realm existence is permanent deliverance from desire realm existence, nor is formless realm existence permanent deliverance from form realm existence,🔽because those who are free from mundane attachment return to lower levels.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags bral ba rnams sa 'og mar slar yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags bral ba rnams sa 'og mar slar yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.

original: bsam gtan dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la gzugs zhes bya ba'i tshig gi ma gsungs pas de med pa ma gtogs pa rgyu gzhan gyis sgrub par nus te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la gzugs zhes bya ba'i tshig gi ma gsungs pas de med pa ma gtogs pa rgyu gzhan gyis sgrub par nus te /
translated: The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa na gzugs med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa na gzugs med do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: The formless are established by other causes,

original: da ni ji ltar na zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.🔽The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.

original: gal te gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med na de dag 'chi 'pho zhing khams 'og mar skye ba'i tshe gzugs rgyun bcad pa rnams kyi gzugs kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med na de dag 'chi 'pho zhing khams 'og mar skye ba'i tshe gzugs rgyun bcad pa rnams kyi gzugs kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The formless are established by other causes,🔽because they are not mentioned in the sutra.

original: dgra bcom pa 'khor ba phung po rgyun chad pa la yang 'byung ba thal lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'khor ba phung po rgyun chad pa la yang 'byung ba thal lo zhes bya'o //
translated: It follows, absurdly, that the arhat's samsaric aggregates are severed.🔽

original: gzugs @350a * //
analyzed: gzugs @350a * //
translated: and for the arhat, the continuum of aggregates in cyclic existence would be interrupted.

original: ni sems las skye ba yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ni sems las skye ba yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Form arises from mind.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs can ma yin pa la yang 'di nyid du gzugs kyi rkyen 'jug pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen dang gzugs kyi rkyen dang gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i 'jug pa las gzugs
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs can ma yin pa la yang 'di nyid du gzugs kyi rkyen 'jug pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen dang gzugs kyi rkyen dang gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i 'jug pa las gzugs
translated: Because even in the formless realm, the condition of form enters here, since the eye consciousness and so on, the condition of name and form, and the condition of form, such as attachment and aversion to form,

original: kyi khyad par skye bar lta'o //
analyzed: kyi khyad par skye bar lta'o //
translated: are seen to generate specific forms.

original: gzugs med pa dag nas gzugs dag tu skye ba rnams la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag nas gzugs dag tu skye ba rnams la /
translated: Beings who are born in the form realm from the formless realm

original: gzugs dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid gnas la /
analyzed: gzugs dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid gnas la /
translated: are born from a mind that is compatible with form.

original: de nyid de dag gi 'chi ltas yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid de dag gi 'chi ltas yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: That is their death sign.

original: de'i phyir sngar gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi rkyen gyis sngar 'gags pa'i rang gi sa bon las gzugs skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi rkyen gyis sngar 'gags pa'i rang gi sa bon las gzugs skye ste /
translated: Therefore form arises from its own seed, which previously ceased, due to the condition of the mindstream that previously engaged with form.

original: gzugs med pa dag nas gzugs dag tu skye ba rnams la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag nas gzugs dag tu skye ba rnams la /
translated: Those who are born in the form realm from the formless realm

original: gzugs dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid gnas la /
analyzed: gzugs dang mthun pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid gnas la /
translated: have a mindstream that is compatible with form.

original: de nyid de dag gi 'chi ltas yin no zhes smra ste /
analyzed: de nyid de dag gi 'chi ltas yin no zhes smra ste /
translated: That is their death sign.

original: de'i phyir sngar gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi rkyen gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu sngar 'gags la las gzugs skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi rkyen gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu sngar 'gags la las gzugs skye ste /
translated: Therefore, form arises from the cause of karmic maturation of the mindstream that previously coexisted with form, since the cause has ceased earlier.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they accept that past and present states are homogeneous causes.

original: dgra bcom pa rgyun ma lus par bcas pa la phung po skye ba'i rkyen 'ga' yang med pas yang de 'byung bar thal ba med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rgyun ma lus par bcas pa la phung po skye ba'i rkyen 'ga' yang med pas yang de 'byung bar thal ba med do //
translated: For arhats who have completely abandoned all contaminated states, no conditions for the arising of aggregates exist at all, so it is not the case that they would arise again.

original: re zhig 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs yin no //
translated: This is the Vaibhāṣika system.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The mind that is fully infused by the cause of its karmic maturation obtains entry.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag nas 'chi 'pho ba la skye ba gang yin pa de'i 'o /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa dag nas 'chi 'pho ba la skye ba gang yin pa de'i 'o /
translated: That refers to the form realm, since one is born there after dying in the formless realm.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de 'phen par byed pa'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de 'phen par byed pa'i sems pa'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the volition that propels one to that realm.

original: des bsgos pa ni gzugs de skyed par byed pa'i phyir de la nus pa bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsgos pa ni gzugs de skyed par byed pa'i phyir de la nus pa bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is infused with that, because it is the form that generates that form, since it is posited as the potency for that.

original: de 'jug pa ni rgyud la rnyed pa yin pas sems pa rnyed pa las te /
analyzed: de 'jug pa ni rgyud la rnyed pa yin pas sems pa rnyed pa las te /
translated: It arises from the acquisition of the mind that is infused by the cause of karmic maturation, because it is acquired in the mindstream.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa de las gzugs skye'i gzugs las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'jug pa rnyed pa de las gzugs skye'i gzugs las ni ma yin no //
translated: Form arises from the mind that is infused by the cause of karmic maturation, which is acquired in the mindstream, but not from form.

original: dgra bcom pa 'di de ltar rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jug pa rnyed pa'i rgyu sa bon srid pa med pas yang de la skye ba'i rgyun du thal ba med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'di de ltar rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jug pa rnyed pa'i rgyu sa bon srid pa med pas yang de la skye ba'i rgyun du thal ba med do //
translated: Since arhats do not have the seed of the cause of the acquisition of the entry of the latent states of karmic maturation, it is not the case that the continuum of birth arises from that.

original: ji ltar gnas pa ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni der ni ris @350b dang srog la yang /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni der ni ris @350b dang srog la yang /
translated: As for how it abides, that was explained earlier.

original: sems kyi rgyud ni rten pa yin //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni rten pa yin //
translated: The continuum of mind is the support of the class and life force.

original: zhes bya ba dang / gang gi rgyud gzugs la sred pa bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gang gi rgyud gzugs la sred pa bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: and “whose mind is free from craving for form.

original: zhes gzhan dag go //🔽de ltar sbyor phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes gzhan dag go // de ltar sbyor phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: So say others.🔽🔽Because it is applied in that way.🔽

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: Thus it is established that the base of infinite space is so called because it is the attainment of the meditative absorption of the perception of the sphere of infinite space.🔽Others say: The base of infinite space is so called because it is the desire to transcend form.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend internal and external form.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is concomitant with the mind.

original: gzhan dag na re gang zhig gzugs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i chos ni gzugs kyi gegs byed pa med pas de gzugs las nges par 'byung ba'i 'dod pa yid la byas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gang zhig gzugs dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i chos ni gzugs kyi gegs byed pa med pas de gzugs las nges par 'byung ba'i 'dod pa yid la byas te /
translated: The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa de med pas rab tu phye bas phyi nang gi gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa dka' par dmigs par nus te /🔽des gzugs med pa dang po'i sa pa ni nam mkha' rjes su tha snyad byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs dang lhan cig spyod pa de med pas rab tu phye bas phyi nang gi gzugs rnams las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa dka' par dmigs par nus te /🔽des gzugs med pa dang po'i sa pa ni nam mkha' rjes su tha snyad byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.🔽The desire to transcend form is the desire to transcend form that is not concomitant with the mind.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs las grol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa la de'i sa pa'i phung po dag la nam mkha'i 'du shes yang dag bar gnas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs las grol ba'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa la de'i sa pa'i phung po dag la nam mkha'i 'du shes yang dag bar gnas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Since it is liberated from form, the yogi correctly generates the discernment of space in the aggregates of that level.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so snyam du mos pa'i sbyor ba grub pas ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de /
translated: The base of infinite consciousness is established by the practice of aspiration that thinks, I will attain the base of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yongs su dag pa las mtshan ma bzung nas rnam par shes pa'o zhes yid la byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug yongs su dag pa las mtshan ma bzung nas rnam par shes pa'o zhes yid la byed /
translated: Having fully purified the sixfold collection of consciousness, the yogi apprehends the sign of consciousness and mentally engages in consciousness.

original: nye bar rtog mos par byed yang dag par shes par byed de /
analyzed: nye bar rtog mos par byed yang dag par shes par byed de /
translated: He aspires to fully understand and comprehend it.

original: do sngon du 'gro ba las sbyor ba grub pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la bdag snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam ste rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsam pa skyed pa de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa rjes su 'jug pas rab tu dga' ba'i rnam
analyzed: do sngon du 'gro ba las sbyor ba grub pas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la bdag snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam ste rnal 'byor spyod pa'i bsam pa skyed pa de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa rjes su 'jug pas rab tu dga' ba'i rnam
translated: Having previously generated the thought I will enter meditative attainment on the base of infinite consciousness, the yogi generates the intention to enter meditative attainment on the base of infinite consciousness and the subsequent homogeneous cause of that intention arises.

original: par shes pa dang shin tu dga' ba'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par shes pa dang shin tu dga' ba'i rnam par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The consciousness is the consciousness of the sphere of infinite space and the consciousness of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de las lang te ci yang med do snyam du btang snyoms kyi sbyor ba grub pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched lta ba rgya che ba dang mtha' yas pa las de sa dben pa'i 'du shes kyi mos pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las lang te ci yang med do snyam du btang snyoms kyi sbyor ba grub pas ci yang med pa'i skye mched lta ba rgya che ba dang mtha' yas pa las de sa dben pa'i 'du shes kyi mos pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Having emerged from that, he establishes the application of equanimity, thinking, “There is nothing at all,” and so the perception of the sphere of nothingness arises, which is vast and infinite.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched mchog tu btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ci yang med pa'i skye mched mchog tu btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, the sphere of nothingness is called the supreme equanimity.

original: gang gi phyir der rnam pa mtha' yas pa mngon par sems pa'i phyir sems las byung ba lhun gyis grub pa nyid du yang dag par gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir der rnam pa mtha' yas pa mngon par sems pa'i phyir sems las byung ba lhun gyis grub pa nyid du yang dag par gnas so //
translated: Because in that sphere, the mind is spontaneously present, since it is focused on infinite aspects.

original: 'du shes chung @351a * //🔽ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du shes chung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du shes chung @351a * // ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du shes chung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the smallness of the perception.🔽Because of the smallness of the perception, the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is so called.

original: rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ba mi gsal ba'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched yin te /
translated: Because the movement of perception is not clear, it is like non-perception.

original: 'du shes med pa lta bur de de na gnas so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa lta bur de de na gnas so //
translated: One abides there as if in non-perception.

original: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa bdun la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes bsal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa bdun la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes bsal ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not like the seven meditative attainments, which are distinguished by ideation.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the meditative attainment of nonideation and the meditative attainment of cessation, which are distinguished by the absence of ideation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the sphere of neither ideation nor nonideation.

original: de la yang de ltar sbyor ba'i phyir de nyid kyi sgo nas mi rung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang de ltar sbyor ba'i phyir de nyid kyi sgo nas mi rung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not unacceptable to apply this method to that meditative attainment?

original: de la yang 'di ltar rab tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'di ltar rab tu sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied in this way.

original: 'du shes ni nad do zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes ni nad do zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Ideation is a disease, etc.

original: de'i phyir gal te de la yang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de la yang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one were to apply this method to that meditative attainment, etc.”

original: ci'i phyir de dag gis de la de ltar 'dzin zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gis de la de ltar 'dzin zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Why do they apprehend it in this way?

original: 'du shes dang 'du shes med pa la skyo ba de dag rgyu cis der 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi blo skyed ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes dang 'du shes med pa la skyo ba de dag rgyu cis der 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi blo skyed ces bya ba la /
translated: Why are those who are disenchanted with perception and non-perception born there in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception?

original: 'du shes chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid rgyur brjod dgos par 'gyur bas 'dir yang de nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'du shes chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de nyid rgyur brjod dgos par 'gyur bas 'dir yang de nyid bshad do //
translated: Because of the weakness of perception. This is the cause that must be stated, and so it is explained here.

original: skye mched rnams lus su dkri ba'i phyir dang rgyas par dkri ba'i phyir gzugs med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams lus su dkri ba'i phyir dang rgyas par dkri ba'i phyir gzugs med pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The formless spheres are so called because they are the coils of the body, and because they are the coils of the extensive.

original: de yang las dang nyon mongs pa skye mched nyid skye bar byed pa dang srid pa'i phyir dang srid pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang las dang nyon mongs pa skye mched nyid skye bar byed pa dang srid pa'i phyir dang srid pa dang bral ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: They are also called formless because they are the spheres of karma and affliction, because they produce birth, and because they are existence, and because they are free from existence.

original: dngos gzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi brten pa'i phyir ram de snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi brten pa'i phyir ram de snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan thams cad kyi rten byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basic state is so called because it does not depend on anything else, or because it serves as the basis for all other meditative attainments.

original: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams zhes bya ba la mtshungs par ldan pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas nges pas de ltar bshad de /🔽'khor dang bcas pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas nges pa de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams zhes bya ba la mtshungs par ldan pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas nges pas de ltar bshad de / 'khor dang bcas pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i rdzas nges pa de ltar bshad do //
translated: Those associated with enjoyment are explained in that way because the substance of meditative attainment is ascertained by association.🔽The substance of meditative attainment is ascertained by association with retinue.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa ni ro myang ba dang lhan cig ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa ni ro myang ba dang lhan cig ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Those associated with retinue are said to be associated with enjoyment.

original: sred pas 'bras bu gcig tu byas so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sred pas 'bras bu gcig tu byas so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Craving makes the result one.

original: bsam gtan nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ldan yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ldan yang /
translated: Even though the absorptions possess other afflictions,

original: ci'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon @351b mongs pa can du bshad kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon @351b mongs pa can du bshad kyi /
translated: why are they explained as being associated with enjoyment and afflicted,

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: but not as being associated with other afflictions?

original: bsam gtan rnams ni dmigs dang 'brel pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir srid pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kho na bshad de //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni dmigs dang 'brel pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir srid pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kho na bshad de //
translated: The absorptions are explained as being associated with craving alone because they are distinguished by being related to their focal object.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan ni srid pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dmigs pa dang sems sbrel bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan ni srid pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dmigs pa dang sems sbrel bar mi byed do //
translated: Other defilements do not bind the object and the mind in the same way as craving does.

original: ro myang ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin dang 'dra bar dmigs pa la nye bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myang ba'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ting nge 'dzin dang 'dra bar dmigs pa la nye bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage through the door of enjoyment and because they are realized in the object in a manner similar to concentration.🔽Mundane virtue is called virtue because it is not associated with the defilements' stain and because it is endowed with the virtues of nonattachment, etc.🔽The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment of the virtue of the form realm.🔽The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment of the virtue of the formless realm.🔽The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment of the virtue of the form realm.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba ni dge ba zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang / ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽tatstsota ta ku sha ya tann'a p'urbi na bishtee b'a shra pa tvannanta re na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba ni dge ba zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir dang / ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // tatstsota ta ku sha ya tann'a p'urbi na bishtee b'a shra pa tvannanta re na /
translated: The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment of the virtue of the formless realm.

original: ro myong bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽dag par ro myong bar byed pa'o //🔽de las ni langs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba las langs pa yin no //
analyzed: ro myong bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni / dag par ro myong bar byed pa'o // de las ni langs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba las langs pa yin no //
