original: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ro myang bar mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ro myang bar mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment of the virtue of the form realm.🔽The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment of the virtue of the formless realm.🔽The enjoyment of that is the enjoyment

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: One enters into meditative attainment of that.

original: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'di la yod pa dang skad cig dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang mi 'dra ba las ldang pa rnams te lnga'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'di la yod pa dang skad cig dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang mi 'dra ba las ldang pa rnams te lnga'o //
translated: There are five types of emergence from meditative attainment of the first absorption that is concomitant with enjoyment: emergence from the same level, from a different level, from a different moment, from a different aspect and from a different focal object.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan gnyis pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po'i mjug thogs su bsam gtan gnyis pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Immediately after the first absorption, one enters meditative attainment of the second absorption.

original: de las ldang ba ni dang po dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang rgyun dang ldan par gcig go //
analyzed: de las ldang ba ni dang po dang rnam pa dang dmigs pa dang rgyun dang ldan par gcig go //
translated: One emerges from that absorption and the first absorption through possessing the same aspect, focal object and continuum.🔽One emerges from the same moment through possessing the same aspect, focal object and continuum.🔽One emerges from a different moment through possessing the same continuum.🔽One emerges from a different aspect through possessing the same focal object and continuum.🔽One emerges from a different focal object through possessing the same continuum.

original: skad cig las ldang ba ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'i mjug thogs su sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / rnam pa langs te /
analyzed: skad cig las ldang ba ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'i mjug thogs su sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / rnam pa langs te /
translated: One emerges from a different level through possessing the same aspect, focal object and continuum.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la dmigs pa'i mjug thogs su tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa las langs te zag pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa las dmigs te zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la dmigs pa'i mjug thogs su tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa las langs te zag pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su zag pa med pa dang / zag pa med pa las dmigs te zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: Immediately after rising from observing, one observes the contaminated. Immediately after rising from observing the uncontaminated, one observes the contaminated.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
translated: Immediately after the defiled, one observes the undefiled. Immediately after the undefiled, one observes the defiled.

original: mi 'dra ba las ldang ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las ldang ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: From the perspective of rising from the dissimilar,

original: gang zhig ro myong bar bya ba de las langs @352a * //
analyzed: gang zhig ro myong bar bya ba de las langs @352a * //
translated: one rises from that which is savored.

original: te ; gang gis ro myong bar byed pa de ni snyoms par 'jug pa min no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: te ; gang gis ro myong bar byed pa de ni snyoms par 'jug pa min no zhes bshad do //
translated: That by which one savors is not meditative attainment.

original: yang ji ltar 'di dag phan tshun 'gog par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di dag phan tshun 'gog par mi 'gyur /
translated: Again, how is it that these do not mutually exclude each other?

original: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa ni sred pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis ro myong bar byed pa ni sred pa ste /
translated: That by which one savors is craving.

original: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Meditative attainment is concentration.

original: de yis ro myong bar byed pa ma yin no zhe na 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de yis ro myong bar byed pa ma yin no zhe na 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: It is not the experience of the taste of concentration.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams gang yang rung bas bstan pa'i phyir dang phan tshun tshogs pa'i phyir de dag gi ming gis sgrib ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams gang yang rung bas bstan pa'i phyir dang phan tshun tshogs pa'i phyir de dag gi ming gis sgrib ste /
translated: There is no error here because they are taught to be concomitant states and they are mutually concomitant.

original: sred pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin ro myang ba'i ming can dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis sred pa ting nge 'dzin gyi ming can lta bu ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin ro myang ba'i ming can dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis sred pa ting nge 'dzin gyi ming can lta bu ste /
translated: For example, craving is called the experience of the taste of concentration through the power of craving and concentration is called the experience of the taste of concentration through the power of concentration.

original: phan tshun dgag pa med pas skyon med do //
analyzed: phan tshun dgag pa med pas skyon med do //
translated: There is no error because they mutually exclude each other.

original: bsam gtan rnams kho na yan lag dang ldan pa yin gyi gzugs med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kho na yan lag dang ldan pa yin gyi gzugs med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absorptions possess branches but the formless realm does not.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are pacified.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu brtson pa'i rnal 'byor can gang dag gang na rgyu ba rags pa yin pa de dag ni der yan lag nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu brtson pa'i rnal 'byor can gang dag gang na rgyu ba rags pa yin pa de dag ni der yan lag nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ba la /
translated: Since those who are diligent in virtue and are endowed with yoga move in the desire realm, they are established as branches there.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ni nye bar zhi ba lhag pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba de dag thams cad la rgyu ba zhan pas de dag la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa mi srid pa ting nge 'dzin shas che ba'i sa de dag na ni
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ni nye bar zhi ba lhag pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba de dag thams cad la rgyu ba zhan pas de dag la yan lag rnam par gzhag pa mi srid pa ting nge 'dzin shas che ba'i sa de dag na ni
translated: But since all minds and mental factors move weakly in the formless realm, it is impossible to establish branches there because they are levels of strong concentration.

original: sems las byung ba gzhan 'ga' yang gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba gzhan 'ga' yang gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: No other mental factors are primary there.

original: gcig la ni yan lag gi sgrar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig la ni yan lag gi sgrar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also illogical to call one of them a branch.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa dag tu yan lag rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa dag tu yan lag rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: Therefore branches are not established in the formless realm.

original: gzhan dag na re sa gang dag tu sems las byung ba tshar phyin par 'gag pa de dag kho na la yan lag rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sa gang dag tu sems las byung ba tshar phyin par 'gag pa de dag kho na la yan lag rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Others say: Branches are established in those levels where all mental factors cease completely.

original: bsam gtan dang por ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag 'gag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por ni sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dag 'gag go //
translated: In the first absorption, pain and displeasure cease.

original: gnyis par ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis par ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag go //
translated: In the second, investigation and analysis cease.

original: gsum par ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gsum par ni dga' ba'o //
translated: In the third, joy ceases.

original: bzhi par ni bde ba'i dbang po 'gag go //
analyzed: bzhi par ni bde ba'i dbang po 'gag go //
translated: In the fourth, pleasure ceases.

original: de yan chad na ni sems las byung ba gang yang tshar phyin par ldog pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yan chad na ni sems las byung ba gang yang tshar phyin par ldog pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: No mental factors whatsoever cease above that.

original: 'di yang the tshom mtshungs pas ci'i phyir de ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'di yang the tshom mtshungs pas ci'i phyir de ltar bshad ce na /
translated: Why is this explained in this way, since doubt is similar?

original: gtan la dbab pa la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan la dbab pa la bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based on the ascertainment of the four truths.

original: yan lag @352b ces bya ba'i don ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yan lag @352b ces bya ba'i don ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of branch?

original: 'dis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gsal bar byed pas na yan lag ste /
analyzed: 'dis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa nas bzhi pa'i bar gsal bar byed pas na yan lag ste /
translated: They are branches because they clarify the first absorption and so on up to the fourth.

original: mtshon par byed mngon par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshon par byed mngon par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of clarify is to illustrate and to manifest.

original: yang na yan lag gi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: yang na yan lag gi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin la /
translated: Or the meaning of branch is compatible.

original: de dag kyang rang gi sa dang mthun pas na yan lag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi sa dang mthun pas na yan lag go //
translated: They are branches because they are compatible with their level.

original: yang na yan lag gi sgra ni mchod sbyin gyi yan lag ltar tshogs dga' ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang na yan lag gi sgra ni mchod sbyin gyi yan lag ltar tshogs dga' ba la 'jug ste /
translated: Or else, the term “limb” is used in the sense of a collection, like the limbs of a sacrifice, because they are a collection of limbs.

original: 'di dag phan tshun tshogs yin pas yan lag yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun tshogs yin pas yan lag yin no //
translated: They are limbs because they are a collection of each other.

original: ting nge 'dzin yan lag kyang yin la bsam gtan yang yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yan lag kyang yin la bsam gtan yang yin no //
translated: Concentration is both a limb and meditative absorption.

original: lhag ma rnams ni yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni yan lag yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The remaining factors are limbs.

original: yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag yan lag dag las don gzhan du gyur pa med pa ji lta bar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag yan lag dag las don gzhan du gyur pa med pa ji lta bar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as an army with four limbs is not different from its limbs, so too is meditative absorption with five limbs.

original: 'dir tshogs pa la bltos nas bstan pa'i phyir don gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir tshogs pa la bltos nas bstan pa'i phyir don gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Here, it is not different from the collection because it is taught in dependence on the collection.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ting nge 'dzin gtso bor brjod pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ting nge 'dzin gtso bor brjod pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: It is explained in that way because concentration is the primary factor.

original: sa de dag na ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: sa de dag na ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin te /
translated: Concentration is the primary factor on those levels.

original: mdo las ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi dag la blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdo las ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi dag la blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: A sūtra declares, The faculty of concentration should be viewed in terms of the four absorptions.

original: yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The absorptions with five branches are similar.

original: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can la bltos nas bstan pa'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa med de dmag bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni tshogs pa can la bltos nas bstan pa'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa med de dmag bzhin no //
translated: The collection is not a different object from its members because it is taught in reliance on its members, like an army.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ting nge 'dzin gtso bor brjod pa'i phyir bshad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ting nge 'dzin gtso bor brjod pa'i phyir bshad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is explained in that way because concentration is the primary factor.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: sa de dag na ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin zhes bya bar ji ltar rtog ce na /
analyzed: sa de dag na ting nge 'dzin gtso bo yin zhes bya bar ji ltar rtog ce na /
translated: How do you know that concentration is primary on those levels?

original: mdo las ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi dag las blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mdo las ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po ni bsam gtan bzhi dag las blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because a sūtra declares, The faculty of concentration should be viewed in terms of the four absorptions.

original: ji ltar phan tshun bsrung ba dang sped pa'i phyir yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag byed pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag lnga zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: ji ltar phan tshun bsrung ba dang sped pa'i phyir yan lag bzhi pa'i dmag byed pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag lnga zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med de /
translated: Just as an army with four divisions is said to be “with its four divisions” because it protects and preserves each other, so there is no contradiction in saying that the absorptions have five branches.

original: rgyal po'i 'khor gyis gzhan dag bsrung ba dang bskyab pa'i byed pa grub pa la yang rgyal po nyid gtso bo yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor gyis gzhan dag bsrung ba dang bskyab pa'i byed pa grub pa la yang rgyal po nyid gtso bo yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the king is the principal one in the accomplishment of the activity of protecting and preserving others by the king’s retinue, so too it is with the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba ni de la 'du byed btang snyoms ni @353a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste zhes bya ba ni de la 'du byed btang snyoms ni @353a * //
translated: The third absorption has five branches.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dga' ba la gtod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i dga' ba la gtod pa med pa'o //
translated: The equanimity of formation is the absence of the placement of delight that is the level of the second absorption.

original: dran pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan la brjod pa ste thag mi ring ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: dran pa ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan la brjod pa ste thag mi ring ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Mindfulness is the expression of the sign of equanimity because it is not distant.

original: shes bzhin ni rjes su bsrung ba'i tshul gyis so //🔽btang snyoms yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni rjes su bsrung ba'i tshul gyis so // btang snyoms yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alertness is the protection of mindfulness.

original: btang snyoms kyi yongs su dag pa ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi yongs su dag pa ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Complete purity of equanimity is the complete purity of equanimity.

original: sa 'og ma'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the faults of lower levels.

original: skyon ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba la sogs brgyad de dag kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skyon ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba la sogs brgyad de dag kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The faults are the eight: investigation, analysis, joy, and so on.

original: dran pa yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dran pa yongs su dag pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Purity of mindfulness is also like that,

original: sa 'og ma'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma'i skyon dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the faults of lower levels.

original: bsam gtan dang po pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first absorption is called

original: bsam gtan dang po na yod pa ni bsam gtan dang po pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na yod pa ni bsam gtan dang po pa'o //
translated: that which exists in the first absorption is of the first absorption.

original: de nyid phyir smras pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba lhag pa dang / gsum pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba rnams lhag pa dang / bzhi pa la bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba lhag pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid phyir smras pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba lhag pa dang / gsum pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang bde ba rnams lhag pa dang / bzhi pa la bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba lhag pa dang /
translated: Because of that, it is said that in the second absorption, inner clarity is predominant, in the third, equanimity, mindfulness, alertness, and pleasure are predominant, and in the fourth, the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain is predominant.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa dag tu dga' ba dang bde ba dag khyad par med pa dang / gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag tu btang snyoms dang dran pa khyad par med pa dang / bzhi kar ting nge 'dzin khyad par med pas te /
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa dag tu dga' ba dang bde ba dag khyad par med pa dang / gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag tu btang snyoms dang dran pa khyad par med pa dang / bzhi kar ting nge 'dzin khyad par med pas te /
translated: In the first and second, joy and pleasure are not distinguished. In the third and fourth, equanimity and mindfulness are not distinguished. In all four, concentration is not distinguished.

original: de'i phyir smras pa yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gnyis pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gnyis pa na yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Are the branches that exist in the first absorption also present in the second?”

original: mu bzhi ste mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste mu dang po ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ste /
translated: There are four possibilities: The first possibility is investigation and analysis.

original: bsam gtan dang po kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They exist only in the first absorption and do not exist in the second.

original: gnyis pa ni nang rab tu dang ba'o zhes bya ba ste gnyis pa kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang dang po na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nang rab tu dang ba'o zhes bya ba ste gnyis pa kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang dang po na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second possibility is complete internal clarity. It exists only in the second absorption and does not exist in the first.

original: gsum pa ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third possibility is joy, pleasure, and one pointed mind because they exist in both.

original: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni bshad pa dag las gzhan pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag ma yin zhing gnyis pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni bshad pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni bshad pa dag las gzhan pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag ma yin zhing gnyis pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
translated: The fourth possibility is the factors not included in the above explanations.🔽The same method of analysis should be applied to all the factors of the absorptions.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag thams cad phan tshun sbyar bar bya'o zhes @353b bya ba ni yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yang yod dam zhe na mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag thams cad phan tshun sbyar bar bya'o zhes @353b bya ba ni yan lag gang dag bsam gtan dang po na yod pa de dag gsum pa na yang yod dam zhe na mu bzhi ste /
translated: Are the factors that exist in the first absorption also present in the third absorption? There are four possibilities.

translated: Because it is physical pleasure arising internally in the body that is generated from concentration, since it is compatible with concentration, as just explained.

original: bsam gtan dang mthun pas bsam gtan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang mthun pas bsam gtan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not concentration itself because it is compatible with concentration.

original: dper na bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba'i sems de bsam gtan kho na ste lus kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyur pa na langs pa kho nar 'gyur bas 'dir sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin las @357a * //
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba'i sems de bsam gtan kho na ste lus kyi rnam par shes pa mngon sum gyur pa na langs pa kho nar 'gyur bas 'dir sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin las @357a * //
translated: For example, the mind of preparation for the absorptions is not concentration itself because when physical consciousness manifests, it is the mind that has arisen from the absorptions.

original: skyes pa bsam gtan ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa bsam gtan ma yin no //
translated: Here, that generated from preparation is not concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ma yin pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pas langs par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ma yin pa ni ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pas langs par brjod do zhe na /
translated: That not generated from concentration is called arisen from concentration because it is compatible with concentration.

original: dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: The example and the example itself are not similar.

original: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang pos zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang pos zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: If physical pleasure arising internally in the body is generated from the sense faculties of the desire realm, then it would not be physical pleasure generated from concentration.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang po ni gzugs na spyod pa shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba reg bya'i yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang po ni gzugs na spyod pa shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba reg bya'i yul can ma yin la /
translated: The body faculty of the desire realm is not the object field of the tactile objects of pliancy that exist in the form realm.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rten du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rten du yang mi rung ste /
translated: Also, the consciousness that focuses on it is not suitable as its basis.

original: gsum dag ni thams cad rang gi sa pa yin zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsum dag ni thams cad rang gi sa pa yin zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is said that the first three are of their own level.

original: ma yin te shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma yin te shin tu sbyangs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is not so, because the consciousness of pliancy arises.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang pos gzugs na spyod pa shin tu sbyangs pa'i ming can reg bya kho na 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus kyi dbang pos gzugs na spyod pa shin tu sbyangs pa'i ming can reg bya kho na 'dzin gyi /
translated: The body faculty of the desire realm only apprehends tactile objects called pliancy that exist in the form realm.

original: de'i sa pa gzhan ni ma yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i sa pa gzhan ni ma yin pas skyon med do //
translated: It does not exist on its level, so there is no error.🔽Also, they would be uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pa dag tu yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyang zag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dag tu yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyang zag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The two, tactile objects and body consciousness, would be uncontaminated in uncontaminated absorption.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yan lag cung zad cig ni zag pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: yan lag cung zad cig ni zag pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Some of its branches are contaminated.🔽

original: cung zad cig ni zag pa med pa yin na mi rung bas so //
analyzed: cung zad cig ni zag pa med pa yin na mi rung bas so //
translated: It would not be tenable that some parts are contaminated and some parts are uncontaminated.

original: yang ji ltar na reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa dag yan lag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa dag yan lag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How could tactile objects and body consciousness be branches?

original: de gnyis yan lag tu mi brjod kyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis yan lag tu mi brjod kyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Those two are not called branches.

original: de brjod la de gnyis ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de brjod la de gnyis ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / de'i yul can yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: But they are explained as uncontaminated because they are concomitant with that and because they are its object.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang zag pa med pa'i phyir de dag kyang zag pa med par 'dod de /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyang zag pa med pa'i phyir de dag kyang zag pa med par 'dod de /
translated: Pliability of the body is said to be the branch of correct effort, and since the branches of enlightenment are uncontaminated, they are also asserted to be uncontaminated.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag tu bshad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag tu bshad kyi /
translated: Pliability is explained as a branch of enlightenment because it is compatible with the branches of enlightenment.

original: dngos kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhe na zag pa med pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dngos kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhe na zag pa med pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: But they are not actually uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zag pa med pa dag yin gyi dngos kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zag pa med pa dag yin gyi dngos kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The same is so for uncontaminated states: they are uncontaminated because they are compatible with uncontaminated states, but they are not actually uncontaminated.

original: mig ji snyed pa dang / gzugs ji snyed pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa nas de bzhin du rgyas par lus @357b ji snyed pa dang / reg bya ji snyed pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dang 'gal te /
analyzed: mig ji snyed pa dang / gzugs ji snyed pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa nas de bzhin du rgyas par lus @357b ji snyed pa dang / reg bya ji snyed pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dang 'gal te /
translated: This contradicts the statement, “There are as many eyes as there are forms, as many eye consciousnesses as there are forms,” and so on, up to “There are as many bodies as there are tangibles, as many body consciousnesses as there are tangibles.”

original: reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa dag zag pa dang bcas par gsungs pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin zhes rgyas par 'byung ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa dag zag pa dang bcas par gsungs pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin zhes rgyas par 'byung ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction because it is said that tangibles and body consciousness are contaminated, but the others are not.

original: de las gzhan reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa bde ba dang dga' ba dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa bde ba dang dga' ba dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The others are not uncontaminated because they are not associated with pleasure and joy.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dag ni cig car yod pa ma yin te lus dang yid rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dag ni cig car yod pa ma yin te lus dang yid rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pleasure and mental satisfaction do not exist simultaneously, because the two consciousnesses of body and mind do not occur simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan yan lag lngar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan yan lag lngar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the branches of absorption would not be five.🔽No, because it is taught in terms of possibility.

original: ma yin te srid pa'i phyir bstan pas zhes bya ba ni yan lag lnga bstan pa dang 'gal ba med de srid pa'i phyir bstan pas so //
analyzed: ma yin te srid pa'i phyir bstan pas zhes bya ba ni yan lag lnga bstan pa dang 'gal ba med de srid pa'i phyir bstan pas so //
translated: The teaching of five branches is not contradicted, because it is taught in terms of possibility.🔽It is like investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag cig car mi 'byung yang srid pa'i dbang du byas nas rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag cig car mi 'byung yang srid pa'i dbang du byas nas rtog pa dang bcas pa zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, although investigation and analysis do not occur simultaneously, they are taught in terms of possibility, as in the statement, “It possesses investigation and analysis.”🔽If it is something to be established,

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis rim gyis 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis rim gyis 'jug go //
translated: then it is established that investigation and analysis do not occur simultaneously,

original: cig car ma yin pa de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: cig car ma yin pa de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'am /
translated: but not that they do not occur sequentially.

original: yang na lnga po rnams rnam grangs kyis yod pas yan lag lnga yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na lnga po rnams rnam grangs kyis yod pas yan lag lnga yin gyi /
translated: Or else, the five are members by way of synonyms,🔽but not by the existence of the five simultaneously.

original: lnga po cig car yod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: lnga po cig car yod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: grub pa yin te sems kyi rtsing ba dang zhib pa dag phan tshun bcom nas 'byung ba'i phyir cig car mi srid cing /
analyzed: grub pa yin te sems kyi rtsing ba dang zhib pa dag phan tshun bcom nas 'byung ba'i phyir cig car mi srid cing /
translated: It is established because grossness and subtlety of mind occur by mutual exclusion, and so they are not possible simultaneously.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis bltos pa can yang yin pas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis bltos pa can yang yin pas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since grossness and subtlety are relative, investigation and analysis exist up to the peak of existence.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib pa dag gi rnam pa'i dbye ba mi rung ngo zhes sngar nyid rgya cher bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib pa dag gi rnam pa'i dbye ba mi rung ngo zhes sngar nyid rgya cher bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained in detail above that the classification of grossness and subtlety is not tenable.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po la yod pa'i yan lag lnga po rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag kho na las yan lag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi por nas
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan dang po la yod pa'i yan lag lnga po rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba dang ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag kho na las yan lag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi por nas
translated: Therefore, the five branches of the first absorption are investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and meditative stabilization.

original: yin te / de la yan lag gnyis por nas bsam gtan gnyis pa rnam par bzhag ste de na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //🔽yan lag @358a * //
analyzed: yin te / de la yan lag gnyis por nas bsam gtan gnyis pa rnam par bzhag ste de na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag med pa'i phyir ro // yan lag @358a * //
translated: The second absorption is posited with two branches,

original: gsum por nas bsam gtan gsum pa rnam par bzhag ste /🔽de na dga' ba yang med pas so //
analyzed: gsum por nas bsam gtan gsum pa rnam par bzhag ste / de na dga' ba yang med pas so //
translated: the third absorption is posited with three branches,

original: yan lag bzhi bor nas bsam gtan bzhi ba rnam par bzhag ste /🔽de na bde ba yang med pas so /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi bor nas bsam gtan bzhi ba rnam par bzhag ste / de na bde ba yang med pas so /
translated: the fourth absorption is posited with four branches,🔽and the remaining absorptions are posited with four branches.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag por nas bsam gtan lhog ma rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag por nas bsam gtan lhog ma rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the remaining absorptions are posited with four branches because pleasure also does not exist in the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po la sems las byung ba gzhan dag yod kyang lnga kho na yan lag tu bshad kyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sems las byung ba gzhan dag yod kyang lnga kho na yan lag tu bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, although other mental factors exist in the first absorption, only five are explained as branches.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the aspects of discernment, etc.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa rnams bor nas bsam gtan gong ma rnam par bzhag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa rnams bor nas bsam gtan gong ma rnam par bzhag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The higher meditative absorptions are not established by discarding discernment, etc.,

original: de rnams thams cad na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist in all of them.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la de rnams yan lag nyid du ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la de rnams yan lag nyid du ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, they are not mentioned as members in the first meditative absorption.

original: yang na ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te dgongs pa 'di mi 'dod na rgyu gzhan zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te dgongs pa 'di mi 'dod na rgyu gzhan zhig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, why? If you do not accept this intention, you must state another reason.

original: gal te phan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du shes la sogs pa dag pas rtog pa la sogs pa rnams phan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rgyu gzhan smras pa ni dran pa dang shes rab dag ces phan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te phan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'du shes la sogs pa dag pas rtog pa la sogs pa rnams phan pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes rgyu gzhan smras pa ni dran pa dang shes rab dag ces phan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you say, “because they are beneficial,” you must state another reason, such as, “because investigation and analysis are beneficial in the first meditative absorption.”

original: dran pa dang shes rab ji lta ba de ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa phan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab ji lta ba de ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa phan pa ma yin te /
translated: But memory and insight are not beneficial in the way that investigation and analysis are.

original: dran pa legs par gnas shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhum pa dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa legs par gnas shing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhum pa dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mindfulness is well established and one knows reality just as it is, one is neither timid nor wild.🔽Although both mindfulness and wisdom are beneficial, they are not explained as branches.

original: gang gi phyir dran pa dang shes rab gnyis phan pa yin yang yan lag tu ma bshad pa de'i phyir rtog pa la sogs pa rnams phan pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag tu ma bshad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa dang shes rab gnyis phan pa yin yang yan lag tu ma bshad pa de'i phyir rtog pa la sogs pa rnams phan pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag tu ma bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, investigation and so on are not explained as branches of the first absorption because they are beneficial.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: yan lag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi bor nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi bor nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: In order to establish the second absorption and so on, two, three and four branches are omitted.

original: kha cig de skad du rgol ba yod kyi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis nye bar shes pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig de skad du rgol ba yod kyi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis nye bar shes pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes ston pa'o //
translated: Some say that this is a dispute, but this is not something that is known by oneself.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The former masters say:

original: ji snyed mngon pa de dag thams cad yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: ji snyed mngon pa de dag thams cad yan lag ma yin te /
translated: All those that are known are not branches.

original: rang gi sde pa rgan rabs rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //🔽rgyud rab tu zhi bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba la /🔽sngar rtog pa dang @358b ba'i 'khrugs pa la sems dmigs pa la gzhol ba ma byung ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa rgan rabs rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro // rgyud rab tu zhi bar rgyu ba zhes bya ba la / sngar rtog pa dang @358b ba'i 'khrugs pa la sems dmigs pa la gzhol ba ma byung ba la /
translated: because it is fully grasped by the elders of one's own school.🔽The second absorption is called the abode of joy because it is the abode of the joy that arises from the separation of the mind from the defilements of investigation and analysis.🔽The third absorption is called the abode of those who possess equanimity and are endowed with special investigation because it is the abode of those who possess equanimity and are endowed with special investigation.

original: da ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral bas dmigs pa la bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa ste ches shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral bas dmigs pa la bgrod pa gcig par gyur pa ste ches shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The fourth absorption is called the abode of those who possess equanimity and are endowed with pure action because it is the abode of those who possess equanimity and are endowed with pure action.

original: rab tu dang ba dad pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dang ba dad pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.🔽The word abode is to be supplied in each case.

original: de ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pas nges par 'byung ba yin yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa dag las nges par 'byung ngo snyam du yid ches pa skye ste de ni 'dir nang rab tu dang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gnyis pa thob pas nges par 'byung ba yin yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa dag las nges par 'byung ngo snyam du yid ches pa skye ste de ni 'dir nang rab tu dang ba yin no //
translated: The word abode is to be supplied in each case.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa thams cad du yod pa yin yang bsam gtan gnyis pa kho na la yan lag tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa thams cad du yod pa yin yang bsam gtan gnyis pa kho na la yan lag tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The word abode is to be supplied in each case.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gcig tu 'khrugs pa yang 'di bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag la btang snyoms gtso bo yin pa'i phyir au pa ra ta pra bh'a b'a s'u bho ga sya hi shrardh'a ba la ba t'i bha ba tyalb'a bho ga sya tu
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gcig tu 'khrugs pa yang 'di bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag la btang snyoms gtso bo yin pa'i phyir au pa ra ta pra bh'a b'a s'u bho ga sya hi shrardh'a ba la ba t'i bha ba tyalb'a bho ga sya tu
translated: The first absorption is the abode of joy, the second is the abode of pleasure, and the third is the abode of equanimity.

original: beksha:/ gzhan dag na re rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang rdzas gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: beksha:/ gzhan dag na re rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang rdzas gzhan ma yin la /
translated: Others say: Investigation, analysis and concentration are not substantially different.

original: nang rab tu dang ba yang rdzas gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba yang rdzas gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, inner clarity is not substantially different.

original: de la sems kyi ngag kun nas bslang ba'i gnas skabs ni rtog pa yin la gnas skabs ma yin pa ni dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi ngag kun nas bslang ba'i gnas skabs ni rtog pa yin la gnas skabs ma yin pa ni dpyod pa'o //
translated: In that regard, the state of the mind that is motivated by speech is investigation and the state that is not is analysis.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs ni dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs ni dpyod pa'o //
translated: The state of nondistraction is analysis.

original: rab tu zhi bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni nang rab tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs ni nang rab tu dang ba'o //
translated: The state of complete pacification is inner clarity.

original: rdzas gzhan med na ji ltar zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan med na ji ltar zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If they are not substantially different, how can they be substantially different?

original: sems las byung ba ni sems la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni sems la yod pa yin te /
translated: Mental factors are in the mind.

original: sems nyid sems las byung ba yin par ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems nyid sems las byung ba yin par ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is illogical that the mind itself is a mental factor.

original: chos gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: chos gzhan 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it a separate factor,

original: sems la yod pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag zhes bya ba yang sems las byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //🔽'di ni bstan bcos kyi grub pa'i mtha' ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa la sogs pa dag rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: sems la yod pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag zhes bya ba yang sems las byung ba yin no zhes zer ro // 'di ni bstan bcos kyi grub pa'i mtha' ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa la sogs pa dag rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'am /
translated: but also the specific states of the mind are mental factors.🔽This is not the tenet of the treatise.

original: sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag sems las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag sems las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The tenet of the treatise is that investigation and so on are not substantially different from the mind, but are specific states of the mind that are mental factors.

original: rnam par bsgyur ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par bsgyur ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The Sūtra on the Concentration That Perceives the Buddha of the Present Face to Face says:

original: rnam par bsgyur ba'i mdo las ni dbang po lnga ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde @359a * //
analyzed: rnam par bsgyur ba'i mdo las ni dbang po lnga ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde @359a * //
translated: The five faculties such as faith are mental factors.

original: ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / dge slong dag gis yid mi bde ba'i dbang po skyes pas skyes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / dge slong dag gis yid mi bde ba'i dbang po skyes pas skyes so zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: the faculty of equanimity, and the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: 'du byed de'i 'bras bu rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas rnam pa dang gzhi dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'du byed de'i 'bras bu rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas rnam pa dang gzhi dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows correctly the result of that formation, together with its cause and its conditions, together with its aspects and its basis.🔽He knows correctly the cause of those formations that are born from the faculty of mental pleasure, and so on up to: the cause of those formations that are born from the faculty of mental pain.

original: 'du byed gang dag gi rgyu gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba nas yid mi bde ba'i dbang po las skyes pa'i 'du byed de dag gi rgyu ji srid pa dang / 'du byed gang dag gi rgyu gang dag mi rtag pa nas ji srid mi rtag pa'i rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skyes pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag gi rgyu gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba nas yid mi bde ba'i dbang po las skyes pa'i 'du byed de dag gi rgyu ji srid pa dang / 'du byed gang dag gi rgyu gang dag mi rtag pa nas ji srid mi rtag pa'i rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skyes pa dang /
translated: He knows correctly the cause of those formations that are born from the faculty of mental pleasure, and so on up to: the cause of those formations that are born from the faculty of mental pain.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang las rtag par 'gyur ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po byung zhing skyes pa la rtag tu rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang bsam gtan gyi lta ba dang 'gog par rjes su lta ba dang so sor bsgyur bar rjes su lta ba dag dang de la sems nye bar gnas pa dang
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang las rtag par 'gyur ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po byung zhing skyes pa la rtag tu rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang bsam gtan gyi lta ba dang 'gog par rjes su lta ba dang so sor bsgyur bar rjes su lta ba dag dang de la sems nye bar gnas pa dang
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is the faculty of mental dissatisfaction that arises and is generated and is constantly observed and abides in the view of concentration, the view of cessation, the view of transformation, and the mind that abides in that.

original: / gang du byung ba yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma lus pa 'gag pa dang ma lus pa nub pa dang ma lus pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ba dang / ci las skyes pa'i yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma lus pa 'gag pa dang ma lus par nub pa dang ma lus pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gang du byung ba yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma lus pa 'gag pa dang ma lus pa nub pa dang ma lus pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ba dang / ci las skyes pa'i yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma lus pa 'gag pa dang ma lus par nub pa dang ma lus pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur te /
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction that arises from that is completely ceased, completely subsides, and completely exhausted, and the faculty of mental dissatisfaction that arises from that is completely ceased, completely subsides, and completely exhausted.

original: 'di na dge slong dben pa 'dod pa nas bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong dben pa 'dod pa nas bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, a monk who desires solitude attains and abides in the first concentration, which is free from desires and free from negative and nonvirtuous attributes, and is endowed with ideation and scrutiny, and is born of solitude and joy.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma lus pa 'gag pa dang ma lus pa nub pa dang ma lus pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ba 'di ni dge slong dag nges par 'byung bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i bar du 'byung
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma lus pa 'gag pa dang ma lus pa nub pa dang ma lus pa yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ba 'di ni dge slong dag nges par 'byung bar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba nas btang snyoms kyi dbang po'i bar du 'byung
translated: The cessation, the disappearance, the complete destruction of the faculty of sorrow, the faculty of discouragement, the faculty of suffering, the faculty of discouragement, the faculty of dissatisfaction, without remainder, without exception, is called, monks, the going forth.🔽The same for the other faculties, up to the faculty of equanimity.🔽The five faculties, faith, etc., are the faculties of those in training.🔽The faculty of coming to know what was previously unknown is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the first state of trance.🔽The faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the second state of trance.

original: ngo // ji skad bshad pa ltar yan lag de dag ces bya ba ni dang po la lnga dang gnyis pa la bzhi dang gsum pa la lnga dang bzhi pa la bzhi rnams so //🔽thams cad la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo // ji skad bshad pa ltar yan lag de dag ces bya ba ni dang po la lnga dang gnyis pa la bzhi dang gsum pa la lnga dang bzhi pa la bzhi rnams so // thams cad la mi 'gyur te /
translated: The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the third state of trance.

original: nyon mongs pas dben ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas dben ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The faculty of coming to know what was previously unknown is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the first state of trance.

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the second state of trance.🔽The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the third state of trance.🔽The faculty of coming to know what was previously unknown is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the first state of trance.🔽The faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the second state of trance.🔽The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the third state of trance.🔽The faculty of coming to know what was previously unknown is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the first state of trance.🔽The faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the second state of trance.🔽The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the third state of trance.

original: 'dir brjod pa las dben par bsgrubs pas dga' ba kho na bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa las dben par bsgrubs pas dga' ba kho na bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The faculty of coming to know what was previously unknown is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the first state of trance.🔽The faculty of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the second state of trance.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the third state of trance.

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa ma dben pa las skyes pa @359b yang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa ma dben pa las skyes pa @359b yang ngo //
translated: The faculty of coming to know what was previously unknown is the faculty of those who are candidates for the fruit of the first state of

original: de ltar na gang gi phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gi phyir 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the first meditative absorption is “isolated from the desire realm and isolated from evil, nonvirtuous attributes.”

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de la 'dir dgos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de la 'dir dgos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the phrase “the joy and bliss that arise from that separation”?

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa las dben pa las skyes pas kyang 'dir dga' ba shes par byas bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa las dben pa las skyes pas kyang 'dir dga' ba shes par byas bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase is used to indicate that the joy of the first meditative absorption is produced by separation from the affliction of the desire realm.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba dang bde ba zhes zung du sbyar te bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba dang bde ba zhes zung du sbyar te bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the root text states that the first meditative absorption is “endowed with both joy and bliss.”

original: ji ltar shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi dga' ba bsam gtan gyi yan lag tu shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi dga' ba bsam gtan gyi yan lag tu shes par byed ce na /
translated: How does the root text indicate that the joy of the first meditative absorption is accompanied by pliancy?

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can la med de /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can la med de /
translated: Pliancy is a virtuous mental factor and, therefore, it does not exist in the afflicted states of mind.

original: de'i skabs su yan lag gsum kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i skabs su yan lag gsum kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the root text states that the first meditative absorption is “accompanied by three aspects of informative form.”

original: nyon mongs pas bsnyegs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas bsnyegs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is pursued by the afflictions.

original: de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gis rab tu ma dad par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽nyon mongs pa can la ni dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa de'i yan lag ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gis rab tu ma dad par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // nyon mongs pa can la ni dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa de'i yan lag ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Because it is made contemptible by the defilements of that stage.🔽Faith and tranquility are not branches of the second dhyana when it is defiled.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can la dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i yan lag gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can la dad pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i yan lag gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the second dhyana when it is defiled, there are no two branches: faith and tranquility.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnyis pa la dga' ba yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnyis pa la dga' ba yod do //
translated: But in the second dhyana when it is not defiled, there is joy.

original: dang po la ma yin zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dang po la ma yin zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you understand that joy is not in the first dhyana?

original: dben pa las skyes pa smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to arise from seclusion.

original: nyon mongs can gyi bde bas kun tu rmongs par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs can gyi bde bas kun tu rmongs par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is confused by defiled pleasure.

original: des rmongs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas kun tu rmongs par byas pa la dran pa dang shes bzhin med do //
analyzed: des rmongs pas nyon mongs pa can gyi bde bas kun tu rmongs par byas pa la dran pa dang shes bzhin med do //
translated: Because of confusion by that, there is no mindfulness and introspection in the confusion of defiled pleasure.

original: nyon mongs pa can la ni dran pa la brjed nges pa dang shes rab la shes bzhin ma yin dag gzhan gyi phyir 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la ni dran pa la brjed nges pa dang shes rab la shes bzhin ma yin dag gzhan gyi phyir 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the three roots of the afflicted view of the self are not present in the afflicted view of the self, because the afflicted view of the self is not associated with craving and repugnance.

original: dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi gsum pa med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi gsum pa med de /
translated: And in the afflicted view of the self, there is no third root, namely equanimity, because it is associated with delusion.

original: de'i phyir de ni yan lag gnyis pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni yan lag gnyis pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it has two branches.

original: / de'i dran pa dang shes rab la shes bzhin dang btang snyoms med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i dran pa dang shes rab la shes bzhin dang btang snyoms med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with delusion, it is not accompanied by mindfulness and introspection.

original: gal te btang snyoms med na ci'i phyir ma bkag ce na /
analyzed: gal te btang snyoms med na ci'i phyir ma bkag ce na /
translated: If equanimity is absent, why is it not prohibited?🔽Because, in the third root, it is prohibited in the fourth root, which is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi bzhi pa la de bkag pa'i phyir don gyis gsum pa la yang de bkag par shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽nyon @360a * //🔽mongs pas dri ma can du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi bzhi pa la de bkag pa'i phyir don gyis gsum pa la yang de bkag par shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽nyon @360a * //🔽mongs pas dri ma can du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is defiled by the afflictions.

original: gang gi phyir dri ma can du yin pa ni du: gyi btang snyoms dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms yongs su dag pa med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri ma can du yin pa ni du: gyi btang snyoms dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir btang snyoms yongs su dag pa med la /
translated: Because it is defiled, it lacks the purity of equanimity, because equanimity is a universal mental factor that is virtuous.

original: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas de kun tu rmongs pa'i phyir de'i dran pa ni brjed ngas pa yin pa'i phyir dran pa yongs su dag pa yang med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas de kun tu rmongs pa'i phyir de'i dran pa ni brjed ngas pa yin pa'i phyir dran pa yongs su dag pa yang med do //
translated: And it lacks the purity of mindfulness, because it is confused by the occurrence of the afflictions and because it is forgetful.

original: de lta bu ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag nyid do //
translated: This is the branch of the fourth absorption.

original: kha cig shin tu sbyangs pa btang snyoms zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: kha cig shin tu sbyangs pa btang snyoms zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

translated: Those who assert that joy, faith, mindfulness, and introspection are branches of the absorptions assert that the first and third have four branches.

original: gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dag yan lag gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bzhi pa dag yan lag gsum pa yin no //
translated: The second and fourth have three branches.

original: bsam gtan gsum ni skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum ni skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third meditative concentration is defective because it possesses the fault of inbreathing and outbreathing.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras yan lag dang ldan pa yang yin zhes sngar gyi tshul bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ni zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras yan lag dang ldan pa yang yin zhes sngar gyi tshul bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ni zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //

original: bde ba la sogs pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba la ji lta ba la bde la sogs pa bzhi bsam gtan gyi skyon yin zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal gyi rgyu lus ma rungs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The four members of the third meditative concentration are equanimity, mindfulness, equanimity that is neither pleasure nor pain, and samadhi.

analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can yid mi bde ba ste /

analyzed: de ltar rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'di dag nyid dang de mtshungs par ldan pas so //
translated: The four are pleasure, joy, equanimity, and mindfulness.🔽The four are pleasure,

original: de ci'i rgyu las de'i skyon nyid du rig ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i rgyu las de'i skyon nyid du rig ce na /
translated: Why is it that only these four are considered to be faults?

analyzed: gzhan dag gis ma yin gyi bzhi po de dag kho na mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni mi g-yo ba ste skyon brgyad las grol ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
translated: According to others, the Sūtra teaches the faults of the first meditation with a view to the fourth meditation.

original: chos mngon pa'i ni mtshan nyid pa ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i ni mtshan nyid pa ste /
translated: The Abhidharma teaches the true characteristics of the faults.

original: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag spangs pa'i phyir dang gang zhig bde ba dang yid bde ba yang nub pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po nye @360b bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs so //🔽de'i phyir ga mya ste na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag spangs pa'i phyir dang gang zhig bde ba dang yid bde ba yang nub pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po nye @360b bar bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs so // de'i phyir ga mya ste na /
translated: In fact, the Sūtra says: “One actualizes and remains in the first meditation, having previously abandoned joy and suffering.🔽”

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bde ba rnams kho na skyon no zhes so //🔽ci ste rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ko ba ro dho ye na tadbhyu pa ga ma aishdya ta /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bde ba rnams kho na skyon no zhes so //🔽ci ste rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ko ba ro dho ye na tadbhyu pa ga ma aishdya ta /
translated: Therefore, the faults are only vitarka, vicāra, joy and pleasure.🔽If you maintain that vitarka and vicāra are not faults, then you should not say that the first meditation is free from the two, i.e., initial inquiry and investigation.

original: rnal 'byor can rnams kyang gang mi 'dod kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa gzhan la sems mngon par rgyug pa de ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i skyon te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can rnams kyang gang mi 'dod kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa gzhan la sems mngon par rgyug pa de ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i skyon te /
translated: Even for yogis, when the mind is drawn to other objects of meditation and aspects, even though they do not wish it, that is the fault of investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba'i rtsol ba dag gis sems g-yeng bar byed pas na g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba'i rtsol ba dag gis sems g-yeng bar byed pas na g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the mind is distracted by the exertion of investigation, analysis, joy, and pleasure, it is called “wavering.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The pleasure of the third aggregate of consciousness🔽is not the pleasure of the first two concentrations, because it is free of investigation and analysis.

original: de ni dri dang ro med pas sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: de ni dri dang ro med pas sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: It is not the pleasure of the fourth concentration, because it is free of inhalation and exhalation.🔽It is not the pleasure of the formless realm, because it is free of the formless realm.🔽It is not the pleasure of the first concentration, because it is free of investigation and analysis.🔽It is not the pleasure of the second concentration, because it is free of inhalation and exhalation.🔽It is not the pleasure of the third concentration, because it is free of joy.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the pleasure of the fourth concentration, because it is free of pleasure.🔽It is not the pleasure of the formless realm, because it is free of the formless realm.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the pleasure of the first concentration, because it is free of investigation and analysis.🔽It is not the pleasure of the second concentration, because it is free of inhalation and exhalation.🔽It is not the pleasure of the third concentration, because it is free of joy.🔽It is not the pleasure of the fourth concentration, because it is free of pleasure.

original: de med na rtog pa dang dpyod pa med de /
analyzed: de med na rtog pa dang dpyod pa med de /
translated: It is not the pleasure of the formless realm, because it is free of the formless realm.🔽It is not the pleasure of the first concentration, because it is free of investigation and analysis.🔽It is not the pleasure of the second concentration, because it is free of inhalation and exhalation.🔽It is not the pleasure of the third concentration, because it is free of joy.🔽It is not the pleasure of the fourth concentration, because it is free of pleasure.🔽It is not the pleasure of the formless realm, because it is free of the formless realm.

original: de dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the pleasure of the first concentration, because it is free of investigation and analysis.🔽It is not the pleasure of the second concentration, because it is free of inhalation and exhalation.🔽It is not the pleasure of the third concentration, because it is free of joy.

original: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It is not the pleasure of the fourth concentration, because it is free of pleasure.🔽It is not the pleasure

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams dmigs pa dang rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems yod do zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya'i skye mched rnams dmigs pa dang rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems yod do zhe na /
translated: In the second absorption and so on, the focal object and the minds that motivate indicative form exist because the form, sound and tactility bases exist there.

original: der skyes pa rnams la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa rnams la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: But the three collections of consciousness and investigation and analysis do not exist there.

original: rang gi sa pa yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Nor do those of its level exist there.

original: sprul pa'i sems bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the mind governing emanation.

original: ji ltar sa gong mar skyes pa sa 'og ma'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya la dmigs par 'dod cing /
analyzed: ji ltar sa gong mar skyes pa sa 'og ma'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa gzugs dang sgra dang reg bya la dmigs par 'dod cing /
translated: Just as one born in a higher level manifests the mind governing emanation of a lower level, so too one born in the second absorption and so on focuses on form, sound and tactility.

original: rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar 'dod pa dag bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar 'dod pa dag bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa mngon du byed do //
translated: Those who assert that the motivating factor is indicative form manifest the motivating factor of the first-level eye consciousness and so on.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zag pa med pa dang nyon mongs can bsdu'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zag pa med pa dang nyon mongs can bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase virtuous and so on includes uncontaminated and afflicted states.

original: sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba'am zhes bya ba ni /🔽dper na 'dod pa'i khams las @361a * //
analyzed: sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba'am zhes bya ba ni / dper na 'dod pa'i khams las @361a * //
translated: Free from attachment to lower levels means

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba las bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba las srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba las bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba las srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar lta bu'o //
translated: for example, free from attachment to the desire realm, from the first absorption to the sphere of nothingness, and from free from attachment to the first absorption to the summit of existence.

original: sa 'og mar skyes pa las zhes bya ba ni dper na srid pa'i rtse mo nas 'chi 'pho zhing ci yang med pa'i skye mched du skye ba nas /
analyzed: sa 'og mar skyes pa las zhes bya ba ni dper na srid pa'i rtse mo nas 'chi 'pho zhing ci yang med pa'i skye mched du skye ba nas /
translated: Born in a lower level means for example, dying from the summit of existence and being born in the sphere of nothingness,🔽and so on down to dying from the first absorption and being born in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang por skye ba na thob pa'i bar lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skye ba na thob pa'i bar lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one is born in the first absorption, one obtains the first absorption and so on up to the base of infinite consciousness.

original: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched la sogs pa dag nas 'chi 'pho ba sa 'og mar skye ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched la sogs pa dag nas 'chi 'pho ba sa 'og mar skye ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should state that when one dies in the base of nothingness and so on and is born in a lower level, one obtains the lower level.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the summit of existence

original: de ni sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na las thob kyi /🔽sa 'og ma skyes pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na las thob kyi / sa 'og ma skyes pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: One obtains the summit of existence only through freedom from attachment to the lower level.

original: de yan chad nas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yan chad nas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not obtain it through being born in the lower level because there is no higher level above it.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi la bsams nas de skad du bshad kyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi la bsams nas de skad du bshad kyi /
translated: This is explained with respect to the actual bases of the absorptions and formless realm states.

original: nye bar bsdogs ni de dang ldan pa 'dod chags dang ma bral bas kyang sbyor ba las thob po //
analyzed: nye bar bsdogs ni de dang ldan pa 'dod chags dang ma bral bas kyang sbyor ba las thob po //
translated: But one obtains the preparatory stages through freedom from attachment to the lower level and also through preparation.

original: de dang mi ldan zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Why is it said that one does not possess it?

original: 'dod chags dang bral skye ba la ni zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis ci chog / gang las na de dang mi ldan zhes khyad par du byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral skye ba la ni zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis ci chog / gang las na de dang mi ldan zhes khyad par du byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it specified that they do not possess it?

original: gang gi phyir dag pa dang ldan pa yang sbyor ba las bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa'i dngos dag pa pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dag pa dang ldan pa yang sbyor ba las bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa'i dngos dag pa pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob cing /
translated: Because those who possess pure absorption or formless states obtain the actual basis of pure absorption or formless states through preparation and they obtain the factors conducive to penetrative insight through degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams pa las nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they obtain the factors conducive to degeneration through degeneration.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba las dor ba nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan nam gzugs med pa 'am de 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa dang de dang ldan pas kyang 'thob po //
