translated: One also becomes disgusted with it, because it is to be definitely abandoned, like a raft.

original: dge dang dri ma med ces bya ba la //
analyzed: dge dang dri ma med ces bya ba la //
translated: The wholesome and the untainted.

original: dge ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: dge ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The wholesome is the stage of the factors conducive to penetration.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni sa bcu gcig na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi brgyad na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni sa bcu gcig na yod do zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i dngos gzhi brgyad na'o //
translated: The mundane exist on eleven levels, in the desire realm, the unskilled stage, the special meditative absorption, and the eight actual bases of the meditative absorptions and formless states.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni gang na lam yod pa na yod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams ni gang na lam yod pa na yod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The supramundane exist where the path exists.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa sa gzhan dgu na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo ma gtogs pa sa gzhan dgu na'o //
translated: They exist on nine levels, with the exception of the realm of desire and the summit of existence.

original: de dag dri med rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag dri med rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
translated: They are the three doors of liberation, which are also stainless.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo ni zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par thar ba'i sgo yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo ni zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // rnam par thar ba'i sgo yang yin la /
translated: The doors of liberation are not tenable as being contaminated, because they are the objects of the four correct knowledges.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to say that they are doors of liberation and also contaminated.

original: 'di dag gi dmigs pa nges pas zag pa dang bcas pa dang stong pa nyid dang chos thams cad la dmigs pa zag pa med pa bden pa yongs su gcod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dmigs pa nges pas zag pa dang bcas pa dang stong pa nyid dang chos thams cad la dmigs pa zag pa med pa bden pa yongs su gcod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are contaminated by the determination of their objects, and because they are uncontaminated by the object of all dharmas, emptiness, and by the entry into the discernment of the truths.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la smon pa med pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the emptiness of the truth of suffering.

original: bden pa gzhan gsum la yang 'gog pa las mtshan ma med pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa gzhan gsum la yang 'gog pa las mtshan ma med pa dang 'gog pa'i bden pa nyid do //
translated: The signless of the signless is the truth of cessation itself, which is signless among the other three truths.

original: stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa la dran ba nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa la dran ba nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The wishless of the wishless is the four applications of mindfulness, which are wishless in regard to emptiness and wishlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa la chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nyid do //
translated: The application of mindfulness to dharmas is signlessness.

original: @368a * // stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ming de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @368a * // stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ming de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is called that because it focuses on emptiness.🔽The samadhi that focuses on emptiness is called the emptiness of emptiness.🔽The emptiness of emptiness is the nonlearner’s.🔽The emptiness of emptiness is the nonlearner’s.

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ste de bzhin gzhan nyid la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ste de bzhin gzhan nyid la yang brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni mi slob pa'i zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the nonlearner’s.

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams stong pa nyid du yid la byed pa /🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni de'i rjes la skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid khyod kyang stong pa nyid zhes mi slob pa de nyid yid la byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams stong pa nyid du yid la byed pa /🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni de'i rjes la skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid khyod kyang stong pa nyid zhes mi slob pa de nyid yid la byed de /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis shing gi ro mer bcug nas de tshig pa dang / shing de yang 'jug pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi nyon mongs pa bsregs nas stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid kyis sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis shing gi ro mer bcug nas de tshig pa dang / shing de yang 'jug pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi nyon mongs pa bsregs nas stong pa nyid de yang stong pa nyid kyis sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: Just as someone might put a log into a fire and it would be burned up, and that fire would also be burned up by that log, in the same way, after the afflictions are burned up by emptiness, that emptiness is also refuted by emptiness.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes la bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rjes la bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That is to be generated after the emptiness that has entered into the aspect of emptiness.

original: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i rjes la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i rjes la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be generated after the one that has entered into the aspect of selflessness,

original: de ni skyo ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyo ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is conducive to disenchantment.

original: ji ltar stong par mthong ba ni skyo bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar stong par mthong ba ni skyo bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: How is it that seeing emptiness does not cause disenchantment?

original: srid pa bdag med par mthong ba dag la yang mngon par dga' ba yod do //
analyzed: srid pa bdag med par mthong ba dag la yang mngon par dga' ba yod do //
translated: Even those who see existence as selfless have delight.

original: 'khor ba stong par mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba stong par mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not see cyclic existence as empty.

original: de nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin 'di ni rnam pa dang ldan pa yin yang stong pa nyid ces bya'i /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin 'di ni rnam pa dang ldan pa yin yang stong pa nyid ces bya'i /
translated: Even though this concentration has aspects, it is called emptiness.

original: bdag med pa med pa nyid ces ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa med pa nyid ces ni mi bya ste /
translated: But it is not called the nonexistence of selflessness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni ches shin tu skyo ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni ches shin tu skyo ba skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The aspect of emptiness is the cause of the generation of great weariness,

original: dper na gcig pu lam du zhugs pa lam stong pa mthong bas skye nas myur du 'gro ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gcig pu lam du zhugs pa lam stong pa mthong bas skye nas myur du 'gro ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: just as when one traveling alone sees an empty road, he quickly generates weariness.🔽By means of the wishless, one attends to the impermanence of the appropriated aggregates.

original: smon pa med pas kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams mi rtag par yid la byed la de'i rjes la skyes pa'i smon pa med pa'i smon pa med pa ni mi slob pa de mi rtag par yid la byed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pas kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams mi rtag par yid la byed la de'i rjes la skyes pa'i smon pa med pa'i smon pa med pa ni mi slob pa de mi rtag par yid la byed do //
translated: The wishless that arises subsequently to that attends to the impermanence of the nonlearner.

original: sdug bsngal bar yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar yang ma yin la /
translated: It does not attend to them as painful,🔽or as causes, etc.

original: rgyu la sogs par ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: rgyu la sogs par ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase “or as causes, etc.”🔽refers to the aspects of origination, production, and condition.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag tu yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa dag tu yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It does not attend to them as the path,🔽because the path is the antidote to the three realms.🔽It does not attend to them as cessation,🔽because it is not the truth of cessation that is being cultivated at this time.🔽It does not attend to them as peace,🔽because it is not the truth of the path that is being cultivated at this time.🔽It does not attend to them as sublime emergence,🔽because it is not the truth of the path that is being cultivated at this time.🔽It does not attend to them as a passage,🔽because it is not the truth of the path that is being cultivated at this time.🔽It does not attend to them as a definitive emergence,🔽because it is not the truth of the path that is being cultivated at this time.🔽It does not attend to them as an emptiness,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as a signless,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as wishless,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as a reality,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as a realm,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as an element,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as a foundation,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as a support,🔽because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does not attend to them as a basis,

original: zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the unconditioned is not the reality of the conditioned.🔽It does

original: zag pa med pa ni lam gyi bdag nyid yin pas sdug bsngal gyi bdag @368b nyid ma yin la sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni lam gyi bdag nyid yin pas sdug bsngal gyi bdag @368b nyid ma yin la sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Since the uncontaminated is the nature of the path, it is not the nature of suffering and it is not related to suffering.

original: de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: lam gyi rnam pa rnams su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa rnams su yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the aspects of the path,

original: de ni sun 'byin pa'i rnam par zhugs pas lam la sdang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang ji ltar smon pa med pa ni re zhig lam la smon pa med pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi smon pa med pa'i smon pa med par yang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhi na de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sun 'byin pa'i rnam par zhugs pas lam la sdang ba yin pa'i phyir ro // yang ji ltar smon pa med pa ni re zhig lam la smon pa med pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi smon pa med pa'i smon pa med par yang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhi na de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: because it is hostile to the path, since it is engaged as a form of aversion.🔽Moreover, how could the wishless be wishless due to the aspect of being wishless with regard to the path?

original: smon pa med pa ni srid pa la ldang bas lam la smon pa med do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni srid pa la ldang bas lam la smon pa med do //
translated: The wishless is not wishless with regard to the path because it is engaged with the desire to rise from existence.

original: srid pa rnams kho na la bsam pa'i sgo nas smon pa med pas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa rnams kho na la bsam pa'i sgo nas smon pa med pas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: It is wishless because it is wishless with regard to existence alone from the perspective of thought.

original: lam ni srid pa la brten pa dang rag las pa'i phyir lam ni rab tu sdang ba zhes mi 'thad do //
analyzed: lam ni srid pa la brten pa dang rag las pa'i phyir lam ni rab tu sdang ba zhes mi 'thad do //
translated: The path is not tenable as “hostile” because it is based on and dependent on existence.

original: de ni lam gyi rnam pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni lam gyi rnam pas 'jug ste /
translated: It is engaged by the aspect of the path.

original: smon pa med pa'i smon pa med pa ni lam nyid la sdang ba'i sgo nas mi rtag pa'i skyon gyis sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i smon pa med pa ni lam nyid la sdang ba'i sgo nas mi rtag pa'i skyon gyis sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wishlessness of wishlessness is hostile to the path itself because it repudiates it through the fault of impermanence.

original: de ni de la lam la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis 'jug pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni de la lam la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis 'jug pa mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that it is engaged by the aspects of the path and so on.

original: 'o na gal te mi rtag pa lam gyi rang bzhin la sdang na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mi rtag pa lam gyi rang bzhin la sdang na /
translated: If it is hostile to the path that is impermanent by nature,

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas kyang lam de smos par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽de ni de'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas kyang lam de smos par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na / de ni de'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then it follows that it would also be mentioned as suffering in the sūtra, since it is said, “Whatever is impermanent is suffering.”🔽It is not the path because it has the characteristic of that.

original: lam ma yin zhing sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lam ma yin zhing sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the characteristic of suffering.

original: de'i gnas skabs yin kyang tha dad pa mi rig pa'i phyir gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes nges par bzung ba'i yang
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs yin kyang tha dad pa mi rig pa'i phyir gang gi phyir sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo zhes nges par bzung ba'i yang
translated: Because it is not recognized as distinct from the state of suffering.

original: phyir ro // gal te lam mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du gyur na phung po rnams zhes bshad do //🔽mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: phyir ro // gal te lam mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du gyur na phung po rnams zhes bshad do // mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi slob pa'i mtshan ma med pa so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa la zhi ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
translated: If the path were suffering because it is impermanent, then the aggregates would not be mentioned.🔽The signless concentration is the signless of no more learning.🔽Nonanalytical cessation is not sublime because it is not a definite means of deliverance and it is neutral.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ni nges par 'byin pa rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir gya nom pa ma yin pas so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa sdug bsngal thams cad
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ni nges par 'byin pa rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir gya nom pa ma yin pas so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa sdug bsngal thams cad
translated: Nonanalytical cessation is not sublime because it is not a definite means of deliverance and it is neutral.

original: dang bral ba ma @369a * //
analyzed: dang bral ba ma @369a * //
translated: and not free from the sign of the signless.

original: yin no // zhi ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yin no // zhi ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The aspect of peace is the signless of the signless, because it is the entry into the signless by way of the aspect of peace.

original: lam bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa ni de la 'jug pa la bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
analyzed: lam bsgom pas yongs su nyams pa ni de la 'jug pa la bde ba'i 'du shes skye'o //
translated: When one degenerates from the cultivation of the path, the notion of pleasure arises in regard to it.

original: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang nges par 'byin pa'i rnam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa dang nges par 'byin pa'i rnam par ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the aspect of cessation and the aspect of definite separation.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir gya nom pa'i rnam pas ma yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'gog pa dang thun mong pa nyid kyi phyir gya nom pa'i rnam pas ma yin la /
translated: It is not the aspect of excellence because it is common to the cessation of impermanence.

original: bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the aspect of definite separation because it is not free from that.

original: 'di ltar so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pas 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pas 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is not definite separation from cyclic existence because of the cessation that is not a specific analysis.🔽Because it is hostile to the noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la ji ltar sdang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la ji ltar sdang zhe na /
translated: How is it hostile?

original: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they turn their back on emptiness, etc.

original: re zhig ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni rtag pa mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dag tu de la dmigs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam la rigs na /
analyzed: re zhig ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni rtag pa mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dag tu de la dmigs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam la rigs na /
translated: The first two meditative stabilizations are suitable as the noble path, because they focus on the aspects of permanence and impermanence, respectively.

original: gsum pa ni zhi bar 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba nyid du rung zhe na /
analyzed: gsum pa ni zhi bar 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba nyid du rung zhe na /
translated: But how can the third meditative stabilization be suitable as the noble path, since it focuses on the unconditioned thing of peace?

original: mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos la bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos la bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it praises the qualities of the cause of the non-entry of the meditative stabilization of the non-learner.

original: zag pa med pa dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de ltar 'phags pa'i lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The uncontaminated meditative stabilizations are not like that, because the uncontaminated meditative stabilizations are not hostile to the noble path.

original: mi nang zhes bya ba ni mi dag gi nang du'o //
analyzed: mi nang zhes bya ba ni mi dag gi nang du'o //
translated: Among humans means among humans.

original: der yang sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i gling gsum du'o //
analyzed: der yang sgra mi snyan ma gtogs pa'i gling gsum du'o //
translated: And there, in the three continents except for Uttarakuru.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyis skyes par byed de skyes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyis skyes par byed de skyes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Both men and women can become men,

original: bud med dag kyang tshe'i 'du byed 'jog pa dang gtong ba dag la dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: bud med dag kyang tshe'i 'du byed 'jog pa dang gtong ba dag la dbang ba yin no //
translated: not only men, but also women, for they have power over the life-force and can relinquish it.

original: lha dag gi nang du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi rnams kyi lus ni shin tu gya nom pa yin yang na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pas nad la sogs pa lta bu yin pas de nyid kyi phyir
analyzed: lha dag gi nang du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi rnams kyi lus ni shin tu gya nom pa yin yang na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i rten du gyur pas nad la sogs pa lta bu yin pas de nyid kyi phyir
translated: In the realms of the gods means that although the bodies of humans are very refined, they are like illness and so on, since they are the basis of sickness, aging, death and so on.

original: ci nas kyang rnal 'byor pa de bya ba byas pa'i phyir 'du byed zag pa med pa 'jug pa la yang mi mthun pa 'du shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci nas kyang rnal 'byor pa de bya ba byas pa'i phyir 'du byed zag pa med pa 'jug pa la yang mi mthun pa 'du shes par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, in order for the yogi to complete his task, he must generate the perception of aversion to the engagement of uncontaminated compositional activity.

original: 'du byed 'jug pa la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes de 'dra ba 'dren pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed 'jug pa la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes de 'dra ba 'dren pa yin te /
translated: He must generate such a perception of aversion to the engagement of compositional activity.

original: de'i phyir mi dag gi nang kho nar skyes kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dag gi nang kho nar skyes kyi /
translated: Therefore, he is born only among humans,

original: lha dag gi nang @369b du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lha dag gi nang @369b du ni ma yin te /
translated: not among the gods.

original: lha rnams ni phal cher dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba nyid kyis lus kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnams ni phal cher dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba nyid kyis lus kha na ma tho ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Gods are mostly without physical misdeeds because they experience the maturation of virtuous karma individually.

original: mi g-yo la zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir slob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba rnams bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo la zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir slob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba rnams bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir lam la sdang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unshakable ones, because they are not hostile to the path, since they have remaining tasks to perform.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But not other arhats.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: But not other arhats means not liberated according to circumstances.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i lam rjes su bsrung ba la brtson pa byas pa nyid yin pas de sun 'byin par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i lam rjes su bsrung ba la brtson pa byas pa nyid yin pas de sun 'byin par mi nus so //
translated: Because they have already made effort to protect the ārya path, they are unable to destroy it.

original: nyer bsdogs bdun ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs bdun ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the seven access concentrations.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Except for the access concentrations to the second absorption and so on.

original: de dag ni zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni zhi ba dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in the aspects of calm, gross, etc.

original: sa gzhan bcu gcig po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa gzhan bcu gcig po zhes bya ste /
translated: The eleven other stages are the four meditations, the three formless states, and the four absorptions of unattractiveness, etc.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa dang mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa dang mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la mngon du mi byed do //
translated: The first two, i.e., the realm of desire and the realm of unattractiveness, are not actualized immediately after the noble path.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ba dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis ni rang gi sa lhag ma nyid chos shes pa dang sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su mngon du byed do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ba dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis ni rang gi sa lhag ma nyid chos shes pa dang sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su mngon du byed do //
translated: The summit of existence and the base of nothingness are actualized immediately after the remaining stages of their own realm, i.e., the cognition of the doctrine and the subsequent cognition of the truth of cessation.

original: rigs bzung nas de ltar bshad de /🔽'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni rjes su shes pa'i mjug thogs su ma yin la /
analyzed: rigs bzung nas de ltar bshad de / 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni rjes su shes pa'i mjug thogs su ma yin la /
translated: This explanation is given in terms of the families.🔽Those of the realm of desire are not actualized immediately after the subsequent cognition.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams ni chos shes pa'i mjug thogs su ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams ni chos shes pa'i mjug thogs su ma yin no //
translated: Those of the realm of form and the formless realm are not actualized immediately after the cognition of the doctrine.

original: de la yang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni 'gog pa shes pa dang mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa ste rnam pa gzhan gyi rjes su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni 'gog pa shes pa dang mtshan ma med pa mtshan ma med pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa ste rnam pa gzhan gyi rjes su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is the cognition of cessation, and the signlessness of signlessness is the cognition of suffering, because they are produced in the aspect of another.

original: de gang gis thob ce na de zad pa shes pas thob pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir sgo nas thob bo //
analyzed: de gang gis thob ce na de zad pa shes pas thob pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir sgo nas thob bo //
translated: By what is it obtained? It is obtained by the cognition of exhaustion, because it is obtained through freedom from attachment.

original: sbyor bas ni mngon du byed do //
analyzed: sbyor bas ni mngon du byed do //
translated: It is manifested by application.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba med de /
translated: The Lord does not have application,

original: thar ba dang mthun pa'i phyir de mngon du mdzad do //
analyzed: thar ba dang mthun pa'i phyir de mngon du mdzad do //
translated: but he manifests it because it is in accord with liberation.

original: lam yang de la mngon par dga' ba med de sngon nyid du de la 'jug pa dang ldan ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis byed do //
analyzed: lam yang de la mngon par dga' ba med de sngon nyid du de la 'jug pa dang ldan ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis byed do //
translated: He does not delight in the path, because he has already entered it in the past, and the noble path is produced.
